story:
Short Summary

Have you ever wanted to be part of a music album? Hopefully today you will achieve this. In way of introduction my name is Paddy Ryan, I am 26 years old and have performed as a musician for 16 years.  The music industry is already very full to bursting point with bands all competing for the same space. 

I was recently asked to write a song in memory of Chaplin Mychal Judge for members from the Fire department of New York. I did this, which was greatly received. Musicians have also asked to record my songs, but they are certain to not perform them how I have intended.

Currently I have an album worth of songs I have been asked to record. I have been invited to travel to Los Angeles to a major studio, which would guarantee the quality that is needed. It would also be much easier to contact the correct people for help with promotion and production, with the studio behind the project.

It has taken 16 years and every cent and penny I have earned to get this opportunity to have my work recorded correctly. To have these songs recorded with experts in the industry will assure the subject matter will receive the respect they deserve.

Some of the songs are serious and others are feel good songs, I would love you to hear them but I can't achieve this on my own.

What We Need & What You Get

For this project to be as successful, it will require £2000 ($3050). This will be broken down as follows;
£630 - Trans-Atlantic flights
£150- Hotel for duration of recording
£1220 - Recording time, mastering, production costs.

By contributing to the project you will be rewarded with special gifts based on the amount you can afford to pledge, ranging from signed albums, merchandise, personal song recordings up to personal concerts. 

If the album does not reach the goal of £2000 in its entirety, the project will continue but the studio time period would be greatly reduced at a cost to quality and quantity.

If we raise more than the goal, the extra funds will be spent on promotion and reaching more people with the messages and stories in the music.

The Impact

Once the album is complete it will be promoted on radio and to the everyone who has a copy. The songs are very meaningful and poignant, especially to the Fire Fighter community and those who risk their lives for others. 

This is a debut solo album but having performed on other artists work, it is already expected to be a firm favourite, taking in many styles from rock, country, celtic rock, folk and power ballads. A true melting pot of styles from around the world.

Risks & Challenges

We have scheduled 5 full days in the studio, which does not seem a lot of time to get what in essence takes 5 hours per song to record alone. However the songs have been fully written, rehearsed  and ready to be recorded. The production team also includes rockstars from different genres along with top Hollywood producers, with many decades of experience recording top artists in LA.   

The only other issue that is possible is a adverse weather could delay flights and therefore start time. If this unlikely event should happen, the time lost will be recovered by working through every second we have available at my expense. 

Other Ways You Can Help

This project does need as much money as possible to achieve the best results. We have tried to include an option for everyone to play their part, however I also understand that not everyone can contribute money. 

The album requires people to know it exists which means radio play, social media, word of mouth etc. If you can not contribute please share this with your friends and family. If everyone could contribute that would be amazing and give our subject matters the attention they deserve, but we still need your help to let people know it exists.  

Please join us on this project, your contribution is vital to the success which will feel amazing knowing that we have achieved it together.

Thank you

In way of introduction my name is Paddy Ryan, I am 26 years old and have performed as a musician for 16 years.  The music industry is already very full to bursting point with bands all competing for the same space. 
I was recently asked to write a song in memory of Chaplin Mychal Judge for members from the Fire department of New York. I did this, which was greatly received. Musicians have also asked to record my songs, but they are certain to not perform them how I have intended.
Currently I have an album worth of songs I have been asked to record. I have been invited to travel to Los Angeles to a major studio, which would guarantee the quality that is needed. It would also be much easier to contact the correct people for help with promotion and production, with the studio behind the project.

story:
Hi there fellow-guitar music lovers!  

 For a very long time, I have been wanting to get my classical guitar recordings mastered and packaged. I am going through with this because I want it to be done right and sound the best for YOU. This is all about giving YOU a quality product that you can enjoy listening to the rest of your lives. I want it to be the "go-to" music you want to hear when you need to relax, think or play etc. So I come to you here, on Indie Gogo, in an effort to raise funds to get this finally completed.  I am planning to work with Disc Makers to package the album, create the artwork, master the tracks, and more. (I worked with them before on three projects in the past and was greatly pleased with their product and professionalism)   I am hoping to release a Classical Guitar Volume one and two, which includes my recordings from 1991-2015,  but I need necessary funding  in making this a reality.


Let's proceed! This project is literally a culmination of decades of practicing and performing since the early 1980's on classical guitar.  A tremendous amount of focus and dedication, went into this over a long period of time. To me it seems like a massive construction project that has been going on for 20+ years, and I loved every minute building it and being behind the classical guitar.  From 1991, to the present, I have recorded my favorite classical guitar works with excellent equipment, but the mastering, packaging, promoting and distribution of these compositions has yet to be done. John Lennon once sang, "Life is what happens to you when you're busy making other plans." Well, my plans to get this project completed were always shelved due to lack of funds and a hectic and busy life we all get side-tracked by.  But now, with Indie Gogo I have some hope! Yeah! The vision I had long ago can possibly come true. So why not give it a try? Together we can finally finish this 20+ year project so it can reach your ears. (here below are a few photos of the analog reels and session dated 1991-92).  [You can hear samples/videos at the bottom of this page]

            

The compositions await your "green light" to take them down the road of mastering- magic,  packaging,  promotion, artwork, distribution and more. (A breakdown of the costs is listed further below.)


 I have been dedicated and committed to the guitar from the time I first laid hands on it at age 10.  I have put all my heart, soul, and mind into the recordings of this project. All those precious years have passed and I have yet to have that Classical Guitar CD in my hand and in yours.  I have always believed we should have something to show for all the time and effort we put into something. Several people have heard the non-mastered demos, and they tell me they greatly enjoy the music. When I hear  nice comments from friends and folks all over the world (You Tube, Vimeo etc.)  it  inspires me to do this completely right and get it mastered and packaged professionally for YOU! 

 The selections I perform on the album(s) are from various classical guitar composers through the centuries. Music that will take you on a beautiful journey of soundscapes, feelings, and emotions.  I have selected compositions that resonate deep within me, and I am sure you will be moved also! 


THE ACTUAL RECORDINGS ARE DONE, except for one or two more selections.  I do have enough recorded compositions for two full-length discs in the classical genre. The last hurdle for this project is raising funds:

BASIC BREAKDOWN OF THE COSTS (DIsc Makers website pricing)

  • $900 -   Packaging (4 to 6 panel digipaks) approx 300 to 500 discs 
  • $1200 - Two disc set Vol. 1 & 2  (2nd disc optional idea-best value)
  • $1000 - Mastering (additional $ for disc two-optional) (15-20 works per disc)
  • $500 -   Design/Artwork
  • $200 -   Licensing, Copyrights 
  • $200 -   Album Tune-up (level checks and optimizing)
  • $90 -     Distribution/promotion
  • $40 -     ISRC Encoding
  • $20 -     UPC Bar code
  • $200 -  Miscellaneous (Postcards, posters, stickers etc.)
  • $200-   Shipping costs ( most likely will be much higher w/perks/rewards)
  • $300-   Indie Gogo percentage/fee is 5%
  • $180-   Third party processors (Credit card/Paypal fees)

As you can see, things add up quickly if we do this top-notch, and the goal amount will just barely finish one project.  It does not include all the unforeseen things and unexpected costs. Time whispers in my ear saying, "It's either now or never."  So I am giving this a push now while I am motivated. As I mentioned, funds have been the stumbling block for these projects to get finalized, optimized and completed.  Your generous contributions will go a long way. I am shooting for a release date in Fall of 2016 or a couple months on either side. The work that has gone into these classical recordings over decades is immense. 

If the funding goal is not achieved, I will do my best to release the classical recordings to those who donated and/or release the (non-mastered) as mp3 files to be obtained on itunes, CDbaby etc.  If substantial partial or full funding is achieved, I will do my best to send out perks and fulfill and ship the items listed, barring any unforeseen crisis. (I guess we can call that a disclaimer) Don't forget to listen to me play in the videos below and on You Tube! I am confident you will enjoy what you hear.

I thank each and every one of you for your help and support in the effort to make a run for the finish line. I have opted to "In Demand" which allows ongoing funding which can be used to do future projects of my very very own original classical guitar compositions and more!


Telling others and spreading the word is one of the greatest ways you can help this campaign become a success! If you feel inspired by my project, please tell others by sharing this page, using the Indiegogo "share tools." Thank you for your efforts to share! We can make this happen. 

A photo below shows me in 1988 at the University of Nevada Las Vegas where I attended many classes in music theory, composition and classical guitar. 

A few of the compositions I have planned to be on this project were being rehearsed and fine-tuned during this time period around 1988. I was just 25! Through the years I have been very careful and meticulous to save and protect the original recordings I did, I had hoped some future day an album or more of my classical guitar performances would be presentable to the public in a  very professional manner. 

My Videos below, and in the gallery are recent recordings done in 2015.  All these recordings need the additional "mastering touch" of a sound engineer and the professional packaging of Disc Makers.


Visit the gallery  and see my other music videos here on Indie Gogo. I have five compositions by various composers here on the campaign page for you to sample, On You Tube I have about 200  videos, with over a million views, and about 3,000 subscribers. Visit my website (see link on campaign page) to discover more about me. I thank all my early and new listeners, and supporters of my music. You have no idea what you mean to me! I also thank all the fellow musicians and friends. A special thank you to Muriel Anderson for having me perform with her now a couple times. Thanks to all who have purchased my Guitar Journey book on CD and "How to Fingerpick Guitar Like the Best" on Amazon. Thank you so very much!

Musically Yours,

Ray Tutaj Jr.

story:
Long story short...

It seems sometimes impossible. Making music, and earning a somewhat decent living from it, but it’s something that I am determined to do with my life, and I have been working towards this goal now for a while. 

The people I have met along the way have been incredible and have inspired me to look at making my next record in a different way. 

Instead of going down the traditional route of waiting, and hoping that some huge record label will hear one of my songs and in turn invest loads of time and money,

instead of trying to scrape whatever money I can together, borrow from banks and putting pressure on a moment in time that should be a beautiful, creative process, I am reaching out to my friends and fans to ask them to be a part of helping me to make my second album.

 From the early stages of the recording process, to the part where I get to introduce my new music to the world, I want to involve the people who have been so supportive by coming to my shows, buying my first record, and all those who have all in all given me the strength, encouragement and belief that my path as a songwriter and artist is exactly that path I should be on. 

“You’re denying your fans a chance to be part of something bigger with you” were the words from the mouth of my friend Ian Crombie, “A new record will offer them a chance for them to participate in your success.  Let them in.  Let them be part of a process they want to be part of, watching you blossom beyond where you are now”.

I am looking to raise $16,000 USD for this project.
This amount will go towards the following:
Recording, mixing, mastering, releasing, and everything that goes with releasing a record including: Press packs, photography, artwork, design, CD duplication, music video, PR campaign.

story:
Le 18 novembre 2015, Equse lancera officiellement son troisième album « Like a Whisper »

La production d'un album pour un groupe indie est très dispendieuse. Le montant amassé servira à nous aider à payer une partie des frais de production et de fabrication. 

Pour aider la réussite de notre projet, vous pouvez faire votre part de plusieurs façons.
1- En faisant la pré-commande de votre album physique ici.
2- En partageant en grand nombre sur vos réseaux sociaux.
3- En  faisant la pré-commande de votre album digital sur iTunes ici :
https://itunes.apple.com/ca/album/id1040253789

Merci infiniment!

Equse

//

On november 18th 2015, Equse will release their third official album named « Like a Whisper »
Producing an album for an indie band is very expensive . The amount raised will be used to help us pay part of the production and manufacturing cost.

To help this project to be be real succes , you can do your part in several ways.
1- By pre-ordering your physical album here .
2- By massive sharing on your social networks.
3- By pre-ordering your digital album on iTunes here :
https://itunes.apple.com/ca/album/id1040253789

Thank you very much!

Equse.

story:
Help Us Get to Harrisburg

Hi! I'm Ari Shagal, composer and bandleader of the Summarily Dismissed, a NYC soul/jazz group with a humorous twist. Last year, we played a great show at the Harrisburg Midtown Arts Center, and we've been invited back this year. It's a fantastic venue, and a great opportunity for us to establish ourselves as regional artists and use the momentum for more gigs around the northeast. But traveling always comes at a cost, and this is no exception. So, I thought it would be a good idea to get some help from you, the fans, and offer you some unique perks in exchange, from a shoutout in the liner notes of our next album to a private house concert where you live!

Us Traveling = You Scoring Perks!

Recently, our inimitable singer Matt Lomeo moved to Memphis, a nerve center of the blues. Even as he pursues solo performances in that genre, though, he is not gone from our ranks (what can I say, his voice is THAT good!) So, the cost of us traveling to Harrisburg this year is steeper than it was last year, simply because getting him up from Memphis, in addition to the rest of us heading over from NYC, adds a sizable amount to the total. We're trying to fulfill a goal of $2500, as that will cover the cost of travel expenses, lodging, and musician compensation.  In return, because we know that not everyone is in a position to fork over significant amounts, we're offering an eclectic range of perks, at an equally eclectic range of prices. For as little as $5, you can get your name listed in the "Special Thanks" section of our next album. We also have several perks available for under $100 each, including t-shirts, homemade cookies, a Q&A session with the band via Skype, and even the chance to pick a cover song for us to add to our repertoire. For $100, you get a music lesson with a conservatory-trained composer and music theoretician (that being yours truly), either in-person (for those in the NYC area) or via Skype. For $150, you can choose THREE cover songs for our lineup. Further up the giving ladder, you have the opportunity to book us for a house concert-- no one will ABANDON your living room if you've got A BAND IN your living room!

Start Spreadin' the News

We know that times are tough, and not everyone can give money . . . but we'd love it if you helped us spread the word about our campaign, via Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Google+, the water cooler at work, happy hour at the bar . . . you get the idea. In the words of Mike Myers' famous character Linda Richman, "Talk amongst yourselves!"

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Hi!

Thank you for clicking my campagne! 

I am 21 year old Michelle Viagianni, Guitarist , Singer and Songwriter from Austria. 

It is very hard to get famous in music business in Austria. I work very hard to live my dream as a professional musician one day. My music genre is black metal, death metal, hard rock and surpriiiiiiiise : music from the hippie generation. For example Hendrix, Clapton, Cocker, Joplin and others.

So you're asking where the problem is? I work very hard for my daily money as a technical engineer and live a very economical life style. But unfortunately Austria is a quite expensive land and there is never much money left to buy things like guitar strings, a good microphone and other stuff. 

But the biggest problem are my parents. They are very conservative and can't understand who much I love my music. When I play my guitar they come in and shout at me that I should stop playing this cruel music and get a life.. My dad even destroyed one of my guitars that I worked so hard for. I need to find myself a rehearsal room. Now. Or I have to stop with the one thing I live for. 

And as I said, I don't have enough money to rent a room where I can play with the band. So I need you to support me! As soon as I have a proper location and a good microphone and a camera, I'll upload videos on Youtube. And maybe have a chance to get discovered by a music label.

With the money I get I will rent a room where I can play and practise with the band and where we won't get disturbed and disturb anyone. If there's money left I'll also buy a good mirophone and a new Fender Guitar . The one that my dad destroyed. 

I think I am pretty skilled and if you give me the chance to live my dream, I swear that I'll do anything to become a record deal!

And I'll reward you all with MP3's and videos from my band!

(Sorry for grammar and spelling mistakes but my mother language is German. But I try to get better in English everyday.)

story:
Summary

Hi, I’m Sabina, also known as Musiqmama. I want to go to California, to learn how to SURF... Because I feel that, in life, it's like this: You cannot change the Waves, but you cán learn how to Surf!
I've had quite a few waves so far in life, and I've managed to learn how to swim and thus survive. But I want to take it to the next level: Surfing instead of just surviving!

Part of my plan, besides learning how to surf, is to study massage and become a part-time masseuse. I have a natural talent for it... now I just need to expand my repertoire! 

What I Need

In total I need $7000,- to realize my plan.
That may sound like a lot, but it's in fact quite reasonable for the Flights + the professional Massage training + a place to stay for 3 whole months + Surfing lessons + Food & drinks for 90 days... In fact: $7000,- is a minimum amount to cover all of these costs.

What You Get

If you help me with this you will,
* GET AN AMAZING PRESENT in return for your help: a great massage / a very useful workshop / an exclusive sauna party (!) or the AWESOME party for everyone who donates... There is even more to choose from - check out the great perks you can get!
* Make a dream come true... Yeah! :D
* Help me to keep working for international jazz musicians... the people who make Music happen!!!

The Impact

Since the beginning of 2009, working for my small company Musiqmama has been an amazing journey... I've worked for some of the greatest jazz artists in the world! Many of them are independent artists. In fact, I started out working for Simin Tander, when nobody had heard of her... Next January, she's going to release an album on the world-famous ECM label! I'm so proud of her! I've also done releases for the amazing Okeh label from Sony, with great international artists like Branford Marsalis, The Bad Plus, Dee Dee Bridgewater, Bill Frisell, Bobby McFerrin, Nir Felder, Jeff Ballard, Silje Nergaard and many, many more! Working in the music business means working in challenging conditions. But it's for a very good cause: keeping quality music alive. Please think about this.

I love my job! But it doesn't make enough money to take a "surfbattical" for three whole months...

This "SURFBATTICAL" is very important to me, because it will help me to continue my work for musicians with full force and passion. Taking some time off and having some physical distance from my work for a while, will help me to become more balanced in life, and have a better sense of direction of where I'm headed in the long term. Many people will benefit from this, either via massages or via the work I do with Musiqmama.

By donating, you help me to make this all happen! I can't do it without you. If you help me realize my Surfbattical, I'll naturally give back the love.

Ways You Can Help

Please help by choosing your favorite perk and donating. If you don't have the financial means to do that, please help me realize my Surfbattical by spreading the word about this campaign, via email, social media or word of mouth. :D

Either way: THANK YOU VERY MUCH!!!

story:
“What would our lives be like if our days and nights were as immersed in nature as they are in technology?” 

― Richard Louv, The Nature Principle: Human Restoration and the End of Nature-Deficit Disorder

We're pretty sure you've heard of or visited a National Park...or maybe you've seen a really cool documentary about them on Netflix. Did you know that America was the first country in the world to create one? The foundation of Yellowstone in 1872 set the stage for what would become our National Park System with a mission to protect unique ecosystems so that all people from all over the world --not just the privileged few-- could experience our natural heritage for generations to come.



These protected lands are places where we can experience the world the way our ancestors experienced it. When we need a break from the buzz of city life nothing can lift our spirits the way the sounds of nature can.  Nature's story can be heard in the babbling rivers, creeks and streams that move across the land, the rushing of waterfalls, the howls, hoots and chirps of the dwellers of the forest. And when night comes we can see the sky exploding with the light of stars and galaxies millions of light years away. When we're in the forest we can hear a story that is as old as the stars themselves. 

Not only are these lands a treasure and learning resource for humans, they're also important for biodiversity by helping preserve habitats for countless plants and wildlife and protecting endangered species. 

In 2016 the National Park Service will turn 100 years old and WildEyes wants to celebrate by joining them in their mission to inspire a whole new generation of park lovers.


Starting this Fall, we will embark on an exciting journey to capture all 59 of our National Parks in a way you've never seen them before; from the Everglades in swampy southern Florida to one of our harshest desert environments, Death Valley, in eastern California.

What's really exciting about this project is that we'll be filming these wild spaces with a specially designed camera that films in 360°. This innovative technology creates an immersive experience when combined with a smartphone and a virtual reality headset like Google cardboard. When viewed in this way, the video responds to the viewer's movements. If you look to the right, the video will move to the right and vice versa, creating a unique, engaging interaction between viewer and each national park.



“An environment-based education movement--at all levels of education--will help students realize that school isn't supposed to be a polite form of incarceration, but a portal to the wider world.” 

― Richard Louv, Last Child in the Woods: Saving Our Children from Nature-Deficit Disorder

We will develop lesson plans for young people that will accompany these interactive videos. We are excited to offer an important and memorable 'virtual field trip' - an opportunity to interact with and be inspired by our country's beautiful natural spaces and the biodiversity we can find there.



We'll be traveling in our mobile production-studio, a converted 1985 Thomas bus, to relieve the high cost of lodging, create a mobile working environment and because living/working in a bus sounds pretty cool to us! But before we can do that we have to build beds that turn into desks, customizable storage areas in every corner, and a kitchen to keep the cost of human-fuel (food) down.

Of course, in order to get where we want to go we need fuel (bus food). Lot's of it! We'll also need to pay for our parking spots in the National Parks and all of the permits required to film there. 


Now the technology: filming 360° requires a fancy set up that uses multiple cameras to capture video in 6 different directions. These videos are then filtered, color-corrected and finally stitched together using information from each shot to sync them with mathematic precision and an artistic touch. We also need sound equipment to capture nature's sounds in high-quality and 360° ...that way it makes you feel like you're really there!

We'll be using Unofficial Cardboard as our viewer of choice, and as our viewers in classrooms and events. You can get one too by supporting the project!

'EXPLORE AMERICA' 11x17 PRINT from Holdfast Outfitters
& a shout-out on Twitter/Facebook


VR HEADSET + "Imagination Vacation: Yellowstone" by Catching Summer

VR HEADSET + 13x19 National Parks Map Poster from Slick Turtle Design 

(And get an Associate Producer Credit!)

We're donating a year of our lives (maybe more) for this project because we truly believe in the power of inspired youth and because getting to all the parks takes time. 

Fortunately, we have an excellent production company to help with motion graphics and video editing.

Derek Rowe:
Director/Graphic Designer/Web designer/Video Editor/Creative Alchemist/Bus Driver

I am driven by the hope that...tomorrow is going to be awesome! But not just tomorrow, I want every day to be awesome!  Unfortunately I can't take credit for this endless quest for awesome, my mother has always motivated me to think big and follow my dreams. I remember asking her, "Mom! How did you know you wanted to be a teacher?" She would always say: "I enjoy helping others... Oh, and I knew teachers get summers off and that means we could take you and your brothers on awesome adventures!" Many times those adventures were trips to national parks, the spark for my love of the natural world.

I believe her loving support also led me to always strive to do more. Since 2008 I have worked on projects with Disney, Nickelodeon, TLC and have directed and edited many commercials, music videos and short films...including co-producing a documentary film, called "Within Reach" about a bicycle journey across the US visiting 100 sustainable communities. This project not only taught me what it takes to produce a national tour but it opened my eyes to the fact that in order to create a sustainable future we all need to reconnect with the natural world.

Since then I have been dedicated to producing media that inspires people to find their own path towards a sustainable future and a life filled with the gifts of nature. During the Blue Ocean Film Festival last year I had the opportunity of showing my latest documentary "One Simple Question" and talking with conservationists from around the world. I remember one ocean scientist saying "if he can get people to look under the water, he can get them to care about ocean conservation." At this same festival I attended a sneak peak of a new secret Google project called Google Cardboard, where I got to see first hand the power of virtual reality. I knew then, if we could get people to look around at the beauty of the national parks we could get them to care.

Vanessa Hernandez:
Photographer/Writer/Location Manager/Comedic relief/Queen of everything, basically

I'll just go ahead and take all the credit for the birth of this project...just kidding. It has been my dream to visit all the national parks since I was 19. My love for these places started when I went on a trip with my partner’s family to Great Smoky Mountain National Park. It's not everyday you see crystal clear river water gliding past boulders the size of cars or black bear cubs rough housing on a hiking trail while their mother slinks into a wall of Rhododendron, all tucked into a magical mountain-scape. It was basically love at first sight. I've always had a love for animals and would usually have my room filled with birds, hamsters, turtles, a bearded dragon and fish (these were the pets I was allowed to have and which is why I spent 5 years as a vet tech.) Growing up in Florida I was used to going on trips to the beach or to Disney World. 

It wasn’t until I went to the Smokies that going on a trip felt like going home. 

That trip flipped a switch in me. Photography became an exciting way to document all the wonderful things I was seeing. Writing was another way to capture the experience. After visiting the Smokies a few more times and then heading west to the Grand Canyon, Rockies and Yosemite, I knew I had to see all of these magical places. It’s my hope that this project will inspire others, my age and younger, to go out and see America’s Best Idea and become the next generation of environmental stewards.  

Along with my love of traveling, I also love planning trips --where we'll go, what route we'll take, what we'll eat (this often takes precedence.) I'll be figuring out where we're going, researching great places to film, updating our Instagram account and contributing to our blog!


Samantha Shannon:
Educational Director/Logistics Coordinator/Wild-hearted Yogi/Asker of Questions/Eternal Optimist
  

As a preschool teacher, I find inspiration in the boundless curiosity that my children have about their world. Because they have only been on this planet for 4 years, everything inspires a question. Everything. “Why can’t we see the air? What does this beetle eat? Do you have a mom? Why is the toilet so loud when I flush it? When is nap time over? Why are there bad guys?”

I believe that my responsibility as an educator is to create a safe, supportive environment for students to ask and explore their questions. Even an “I don’t know” answer is an opportunity for us to learn together.

My role in WildEyes is to help students question and redefine their relationship with the world by helping them feel engaged with, and connected to, our country’s wild spaces.

I am certain that positive change can come from such a connected, engaged community - one that considers all humans, all plants, and all animals to be vital members.
With our combined experience of digital media and youth education we'd like to create a media experience that engages young people with the same excitement they have for video games but connected to nature. We want the respect kids have for technology to extend to a respect for nature.




Other ways to support the WildEyes project and mission:

  • Join our email list: http://eepurl.com/btrbqT
  • Share this campaign on social media!
  • We appreciate connection, introductions, and in-kind donations.

story:
The story goes something like this...

Hey Friends! The initial production of my very first debut solo EP is finished and I am just a few short steps away from completing this dream of mine. April 4th 2015, I wrapped up production on my Debut Self Titled EP "Conversations" with Mike Marsh of The Avett Brothers at Paper Mill Studio in Nashville TN. This was all thanks to you guys, Thank You So Much!!! However in order to finish this EP I am calling on you guys once again. You see, I have raised all but $2500.00 of my goal and that is all that stands in the way of making this dream a reality. The EP has a stellar cast of Musicians featuring Mike Marsh (The Avett Brothers) on drums, Paul Defiglia (The Avett Brothers) on stand up bass, Critter Fuqua (Old Crow Medicine Show) on banjo and accordion as well as some up and coming Nashville session musicians Kyle Cox, Rachel Smith and Avery Bright. I will be offering similar perks for those of you who wanted to contribute but were unable last time as well as a couple of new ideas.

Needs & Wants...

So like I said I need to raise $2500.00, I am nervous doing another campaign so soon, but confident in the support the songs and project have been receiving, especially having only played a hand full of shows. The funds will be spent as follows.

Mixing- $500.00

Mastering- $500.00

Pressing (getting the material on cd, and the artwork pressed to have physical copies to give to you and sell to others)- $1500.00

This is a once in a lifetime, or should I say a make or break opportunity for me to live a dream, for helping me get there I will make sure you are rewarded by receiving perks that will only be available through this campaign.

If we don't reach the goal, although I am confident in you guys!!! The funds will all still go toward the final processes in completing the EP.

Thumprints

Like I said this is a dream and that's why I cannot and will not give up. I am a 31 year old father of 2 and if anything I want my kids to know that we are here to love and we are here to dream, and to pursue the dreams we are most passionate about. I want to show people that we don't have to settle for mediocrity. Regardless of age, race, disability, financial situation or what ever other excuses we use to hold our selves back, I want people to know we have to pursue what we are designed to do.

I wasn't as successful as Id like to have been with the last campaign, but that isn't stopping me, I will have some platforms in which I can promote to a bigger and more diverse audience and will take full advantage of those opportunities. But I believe having the opportunity to work with these great artist and the time and money people have put into this project is not at all in vain. The success was being able to record the three songs and we did that, now we just need to mix, master and press.

I feel like vulnerability and transparency are the only way to go when chasing a dream in trying to get others on board. I'll be posting videos and songs throughout so you guys can decide if this is talent you want to invest in. I have the will, I have the drive and the dream, the purpose and the passion, unfortunately I wasn't born with a trust fund... But I refuse to let money stand in the way of a dream and hopefully you guys are willing to support the cause! I want to leave a thumbprint on peoples hearts with the music I make and the challenges I overcome in reaching personal goals and seeing dreams turn to reality.

The fall out...

This is a challenge. I'm not going to lie, there is always the risk of failure. I am ruling it out  though and using any platform necessary to see success and I want you to be a part of it with me. There are strength in numbers and beauty in helping someone achieve his or her dreams.

Can't donate, don't want to or donated to the last...

Already donated to the recording project earlier this year and can't afford to donate now? That is okay, you can still be a vital part of this campaign by sharing on any and all of your social networks and by using the indie go go share tools to get the word out and about. Literally anyone and everyone you can think of.
story_txt:
The story goes something like this... Hey Friends! The initial production of my very first debut solo EP is finished and I am just a few short steps away from completing this dream of mine. April 4th 2015, I wrapped up production on my Debut Self Titled EP "Conversations" with Mike Marsh of The Avett Brothers at Paper Mill Studio in Nashville TN. This was all thanks to you guys, Thank You So Much!!! However in order to finish this EP I am calling on you guys once again. You see, I have raised all but $2500.00 of my goal and that is all that stands in the way of making this dream a reality. The EP has a stellar cast of Musicians featuring Mike Marsh (The Avett Brothers) on drums, Paul Defiglia (The Avett Brothers) on stand up bass, Critter Fuqua (Old Crow Medicine Show) on banjo and accordion as well as some up and coming Nashville session musicians Kyle Cox, Rachel Smith and Avery Bright. I will be offering similar perks for those of you who wanted to contribute but were unable last time as well as a couple of new ideas.   Needs & Wants... So like I said I need to raise $2500.00, I am nervous doing another campaign so soon, but confident in the support the songs and project have been receiving, especially having only played a hand full of shows. The funds will be spent as follows.
Mixing- $500.00
Mastering- $500.00
Pressing (getting the material on cd, and the artwork pressed to have physical copies to give to you and sell to others)- $1500.00
This is a once in a lifetime, or should I say a make or break opportunity for me to live a dream, for helping me get there I will make sure you are rewarded by receiving perks that will only be available through this campaign.
If we don't reach the goal, although I am confident in you guys!!! The funds will all still go toward the final processes in completing the EP.   Thumprints Like I said this is a dream and that's why I cannot and will not give up. I am a 31 year old father of 2 and if anything I want my kids to know that we are here to love and we are here to dream, and to pursue the dreams we are most passionate about. I want to show people that we don't have to settle for mediocrity. Regardless of age, race, disability, financial situation or what ever other excuses we use to hold our selves back, I want people to know we have to pursue what we are designed to do.
I wasn't as successful as Id like to have been with the last campaign, but that isn't stopping me, I will have some platforms in which I can promote to a bigger and more diverse audience and will take full advantage of those opportunities. But I believe having the opportunity to work with these great artist and the time and money people have put into this project is not at all in vain. The success was being able to record the three songs and we did that, now we just need to mix, master and press.
I feel like vulnerability and transparency are the only way to go when chasing a dream in trying to get others on board. I'll be posting videos and songs throughout so you guys can decide if this is talent you want to invest in. I have the will, I have the drive and the dream, the purpose and the passion, unfortunately I wasn't born with a trust fund... But I refuse to let money stand in the way of a dream and hopefully you guys are willing to support the cause! I want to leave a thumbprint on peoples hearts with the music I make and the challenges I overcome in reaching personal goals and seeing dreams turn to reality.   The fall out... This is a challenge. I'm not going to lie, there is always the risk of failure. I am ruling it out  though and using any platform necessary to see success and I want you to be a part of it with me. There are strength in numbers and beauty in helping someone achieve his or her dreams.
    Can't donate, don't want to or donated to the last... Already donated to the recording project earlier this year and can't afford to donate now? That is okay, you can still be a vital part of this campaign by sharing on any and all of your social networks and by using the indie go go share tools to get the word out and about. Literally anyone and everyone you can think of.

story:
A New Kind of Documentary

We're making a show with a balance of live performances, in-depth interviews and behind the scenes footage.  Host Joe Kendrick and studio chief Tony Preston partnered together to create a journey into the heart of Southern music and culture in half hour episodes, and need your help in making it a reality. You can help us realize our dream of creating the second episode in our new series, and enjoy some nice perks along the way!

We're hitting the road so you can (eventually) hit the couch for a flick. And you can join us!

We need $6400 to make it happen the right way, with a full crew manning lights, sound, cameras, and then editing it all into the finished episode. There's also hundreds of miles of driving to The Honeycutters' shows and other locations for shoots, and some food to keep us on our feet.

We have a number of ways to thank you for contributing, from having your name on the credits to finished versions of the show, to t-shirts and invitations to the exclusive performance by The Honeycutters in studio to film part of this episode.

    "Music is the wine that fills the cup of silence."

    Robert Fripp said that, and it's one of my favorite quotes about music. We're asking for you to help fill our cup, so we can pass it along for others to discover and enjoy.

    We have filled that cup of silence many times before, from our first episode on Aaron Burdett, to previous collaborations on the music talk show and interview series, the Lingua Musica Show. Southern Songs and Stories is built upon the experience we gained from making dozens of those shorter videos, and our pilot episode with Aaron.

      What If?

      If we don't make our goal, our obligation to finish the episode remains. We will still get the benefit of most of your contribution, and will make up for any shortfall ourselves. Would you be able to tell that the show was fueled by Ramen noodles? We're hoping for meat and three all the way, but are packing soda crackers and sardines, just in case.

      You Say You Eat Ramen, Too?

      No worries! Join us by encouraging your friends, family and acquaintances to help our endeavor. We intend to make many more of these shows, and are using this opportunity not only to raise money but also to raise awareness for our series, which we hope finds a home on a network near you.

story:
This campaign is in hopes to raise enough funds to produce my debut album entitled  " When Music Hits You, You Feel No Pain" . I aspire to share with you all the sound and songs of Missy D with this album.  Learn about my discovery, my evolution, my dream and my goals for the upcoming years to come...

HOW DID YOU BECOME MISSY D?

My name is Diane Umutoni Mutabaruka.  I was born and raised in the Motherland, Africa. I am from the thousand of hills of Rwanda to the Drogba city of Cote d'Ivoire and the Victoria Falls of Zimbabwe. I represent a blend of African cultures and I try to do the same with my music. Over the years, I constantly moved around, switched schools and travelled. With every change, I was always trying to find myself, my  identity, my home , and my voice.  At the time, little Diane was just very shy and reserved.

 Until that one day I met Hip-Hop.

It was probably about 5pm, my brother switched on the TV screen like any usual day after school. There was this tall handsome man holding a baby in his hand and gesturing to a certain melody . His name was Tupac Shakur and the song was " Brenda's got a Baby". It had my little hands snapping along from beginning to end. I had no idea what he was saying, but it stuck with me. Even when I had to leave home and go to a foreign country.

Eight years later, it was the beginning of my teenage years, so my voice wanted to rebel but something was still holding me back. I remember that moment like yesterday. Words bottled in my mind, but an empty sound coming out of my mouth. Who knew that my second year at Jean de la Fontaine was going to be life changing. We were learning the recorder that year! It doesn’t sound exciting, and it wasn’t!

But I remember this one moment so clearly as  my classmate put up his hand and insisted that we learn something that applies to our generation. He said exactly what everyone was thinking. At the time, I only wished I had as much courage as him. A few weeks later, we dropped our recorders and learned the history of that same sound I loved so much, Hip Hop!

Fast-forward to 50 people looking at me with a microphone in my hand. My 11 year old voice resonating through the sound system and my friends waving their hands in the air.  I was at the right place at the right time. I was happy and I was found. I had gained courage and had a voice. I was ALIVE that summer day.

The question was then would I perform again?

THE BEGINNING OF SOMETHING NEW:

In 2003, I discovered Missy D.

Missy D was the voice that spoke up, stood up, and cheered for the people. Anything Diane couldn’t do,  Missy D could!  That day with the help of my good friend Dhoha, we rebelled , we sang, we rapped, we performed and voiced out our message!

“ Dans ton hip hop,le microphone c’est comme le telephone,

Tu parles, tu bouges, c’est comme les vacances!

Le hip hop c’est pas du pop! c’est de la bonne musique...”

Chorus:

Pour tu ce qui nous kiffe

ou qui ne kiffe kiffe pas

on s’en fiche on s’en fout

ca nous touche pas du tout

My first performance was catharsis. It liberated me. It let out this voice that was hidden for the past years! As soon as my voice got out, It didn’t want to hide anymore. I wrote constantly from sonnets, poems to raps in my little yellow music book. My voice grew, my performances multiplied and I became a regular performer just at 14.  Suddenly as I found comfort in French Hip Hop, my parents switched me to a different school, an english school.

Although I was comfortable with my French mic, I still didn’t speak much to the strangers, locals, taxi drivers, or any other english speakers. I remember going to church , praying in French while trying to translate what the priest was saying.  All I heard and understood was Hope. Like praying, my voice stayed internal for the next few months. With hope, I kept challenging myself by translating anything I heard. I fell in love with music once more. Sitting down in my dad’s office, I translated Usher and 50 Cent songs with a dictionary next to me. I didn’t attend any ESL classes outside of school. My teacher was Hip-Hop. I learned English through Hip Hop.

That summer, I grabbed my microphone again and rapped in English. I didn’t know a lot of expressions, similes,  idioms and metaphors  in English. With just hope and hip-hop, I introduced Missy D to this anglophone audience.

“ There u go, u talking to the rapper girl,

I can flow in french and english, I’m waiting to speaking spanish

Fast or slow, here we go, yo!

you are waiting for a rap, you better start to clap...”

Once again, Missy D spoke up for the new girl Diane. I continued to write raps  to inspire, to purge and also to have fun throughout high school. You would find me rapping about chemistry and economics. It was a way of studying , understanding these foreign theories while rhyming to a melody.  This was more than just a form of expression, it became my identity.  The same way that Hip Hop gave me life, I hope my music can do the same for any listener.

WHAT NOW?:

It's been 12 years, I now know more english vocab words and can formulate a full sentence. Who would have thought that I would even attend university in English. Now I just graduated from UBC.

Over the years,  I have had the chance to perform on various stages from the open mics, talent shows, university football games, downtown nightclubs and restaurants. You might have heard me perform with the wonderful Laydy Jams!

You can call it a dozen years of learning about myself, about expression, about french, about english, about friends, about home, about language, about love, about community, about music, about Hip-Hop, and about Diane. I am still a performer, a femcee/rapper, an artist, a slam poet, a singer, a songwriter and a master of ceremony.

If it were to end tomorrow, I want to leave the world with an album. A mark that I was here, I am surprisingly ready. I am volunteering to put my hand up and speak up! I want to speak up for the unheard, for the lost souls, and for the jammers.The dream has never been more real and vivid. And now, I see it and THIS IS IT!  

THE DREAM:

The dream is my First Album coming to you in 2016. It will be entitled:  When Music Hits You, You Feel No Pain!

“When the Music Hits, You Feel No Pain” : A tribute to my love for MUSIC! Music that makes you feel something. This title highlights the therapy I get from writing but also the fun, the discovery. the learning, the memories that are encompassed within this album. I hope to showcase different sides of my personality, different stories, different adventures. I am learning  to sing more,  find my own rap sound and also start songwriting for others. This is the beginning, every track will have different story and a different meaning to this journey.

In this album you will find:

  • Music that literally hits you : Groove, funk, fun, quick, the name, head nodding: MISSY D!

  • Music the therapist : “feel no pain”, Music the diary, the lullaby, the feel good,  the feel something.

  • Music the lover, music the dreamer, music the sound of generations, music the old soul,  music the smooth talker, music the melody, music the singer.

  • Music the confidence, music the lyricism, music the rough, music the tough, music the talk that talk...

  • Music the change, music the hope, music the activism, music the truth, music at it's Roots, Rock and Reggae!

  • Music at its origin , music at its discovery, music at its memories : my beginning! = My First Album!

As shown in the album cover art made by the amazing Brianna Klassen, there is a certain vibrancy that resonates when music hits me.Whether I am performing, listening or creating music, I feel at peace and in no pain.

Words in mind : Multifaceted, Personal, Creative, Fresh, Feelings, Storytelling, Diary, Introspective, Therapy, Rap & Soul...

HOW CAN YOU HELP ?


We are fundraising for :

  • recording of the songs
  • mixing and mastering of the songs
  • manufacturing of the album
  • filming promotion and music videos
  • distributing the album in 2016.

Please feel free to share the link, donate what you can, and promote a message of hope whether it’s through my music or each other.

Now you know my story, my aspirations, my goals, and now here's to HOPE! Hoping that as I leave my dreams into your hands, we all hope it becomes reality!

YOUR SUPPORT IS EVERYTHING!

I AM READY, HOPE YOU CAN HEAR ME ?

 All I need is one mic, and maybe a few dollars ;)!

Love,

Diane a.k.a Missy D

story:
About GetClassical – Positively Personal Performance

Welcome to GetClassical – a platform for classical music enthusiasts, offering information about today’s classical music scene through our blog posts and connecting new audiences to GetClassical’s concert events.

Music Journalist and founder of GetClassical, Ilona Oltuski, (member of MCANA) is thrilled to announce a new season with a variety of great performances by upcoming and arrived musicians, of great caliber. Some, you will have heard here first, some are household names within New York’s vibrant music scene – but all collaborations are based on close relationships with the artists and appreciation for their great, musical talent.

GetClassical continues its relationship with WWFM whose broad spectrum of listeners we would like to welcome for another exciting season of broadcasts.

We produce events of a great variety, performed at different venues: from cabaret star Adrienne Haan’s Carnegie Hall’s debut at Weill Recital Hall, to world renowned cellist Mischa Maisky and friends, at LePoisson Rouge. Art lovers will experience music in their favorite environment: Soho’s art gallery Louis Meisel.

Our monthly series at the very intimate, downtown Jazz Club Zinc Bar, right in the heart of New York City’s downtown nightlife scene continues, while we are looking forward to a new collaboration for a GetClassical Salon series, with Yamaha Artists Services, at their newly renovated showroom.

Classical music has a great tradition, but musicians realize the importance of reaching out to a wider audience, and to create a fresh outlook and enthusiasm to classical music.

What makes our concerts special is the actual concert experience: GetClassical creates a very personal and relaxed environment that encourages people – with a glass of wine in hand – … to celebrate talent, the way it used to be celebrated when classical compositions of the day, represented the newest talent on the block. It’s in this spirit of community building and artistic interaction; we also welcome visiting guest artists to the stage. Jazz musicians have always encouraged “jamming” together – we will extend this friendly gesture to the classical experience, adding an element of excitement and surprise. You will definitely have the opportunity to meet the artists, up close and personal – we bring the after-party to the concert. 

We need support for artist's compensation, audio and video production, to create the buzz our talented artists deserve. We also appreciate any ideas for press coverage, or the donation of a grand piano for venues that don't provide one. 

Help us plan the next season for GetClassical concerts with your contribution and come, enjoy the music.

story:
About Enharmonics

Enharmonics A Cappella is an all-female group at the University of Arizona. This group was founded in 2014 and performs mostly pop music mid-20th century to present and some jazz.
Most of our members are music majors and/or have had a lot of musical background. We are serious and passionate about this group and it is much more than a hobby for us. The fun is just a bonus!

Where Will the Money Go?

Our budget for this semester is around $1700! But we're only asking for $500 for a kick start (the more the better). This includes our attire, printing our music, getting recognized as a club at the university, helping us get to ICCA (an international collegiate A Cappella competition) and much more!

How You Will Help Us

We want to represent our university the best way we can, and our attire will play into that. We would love to have formal attire (one that we will use for our performances and ICCA) as well as informal attire (club shirts!). 
The money to help print our music would benefit our group greatly. We have 13 members, and our arrangements can go from 12-20 pages long! Now multiply that by 13. 
ICCA is a fun way to bring the other collegiate A Cappella groups together and share with each other and compete with one another. It'll challenge us as well, and who doesn't like a good friendly competition?
We had each of our members pay a membership fee to help pay for a few things to start off our semester. We would love it if we could reimburse our members and you can help!

Challenges

We are the newest group at the University of Arizona and it will be our first ICCA competition. We also would like to get our name out there as well as record a CD in the near future. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate money? That's okay! Please get our name out there and share with those who would love to help us out in any way! Thank you for your time! If you have any questions or would like us to sing for you, contact us at enharmonicsua@gmail.com. Visit our website: http://enharmonicsua.wix.com/enharmonicsua
story_txt:
About Enharmonics Enharmonics A Cappella is an all-female group at the University of Arizona. This group was founded in 2014 and performs mostly pop music mid-20th century to present and some jazz. Most of our members are music majors and/or have had a lot of musical background. We are serious and passionate about this group and it is much more than a hobby for us. The fun is just a bonus!  Where Will the Money Go?
Our budget for this semester is around $1700! But we're only asking for $500 for a kick start (the more the better). This includes our attire, printing our music, getting recognized as a club at the university, helping us get to ICCA (an international collegiate A Cappella competition) and much more!
    How You Will Help Us
We want to represent our university the best way we can, and our attire will play into that. We would love to have formal attire (one that we will use for our performances and ICCA) as well as informal attire (club shirts!). 
The money to help print our music would benefit our group greatly. We have 13 members, and our arrangements can go from 12-20 pages long! Now multiply that by 13. 
ICCA is a fun way to bring the other collegiate A Cappella groups together and share with each other and compete with one another. It'll challenge us as well, and who doesn't like a good friendly competition?
We had each of our members pay a membership fee to help pay for a few things to start off our semester. We would love it if we could reimburse our members and you can help!
    Challenges
We are the newest group at the University of Arizona and it will be our first ICCA competition. We also would like to get our name out there as well as record a CD in the near future. 
    Other Ways You Can Help Can't donate money? That's okay! Please get our name out there and share with those who would love to help us out in any way! Thank you for your time! If you have any questions or would like us to sing for you, contact us at enharmonicsua@gmail.com. Visit our website: http://enharmonicsua.wix.com/enharmonicsua

story:
Le Lien: Indie Alt. Rock - Next Single (UPDATED 11-9-15)

Planned Release in 2016

Why I Need Your Help

We have plans now to work on my next single release! My music manager Tony Peterson of ND Script Entertainment has connected me with Bob Tucker and Jane Getz.

Bob Tucker is a producer and guitar player with astonishing music credits. Bob recorded and mixed The Temptations' Grammy winning album Ear-Resistible and platinum album. Bob Tucker has shaped the sound of such hits as Tupac Shakur’s “Keep Your Head Up,” “Pour Out A Little Liquor,” “Dear Mama,” and the remix “I Get Around.” His credits also include India Arie "I am Not My Hair" and "This Is My Testimony Vol.1"

Jane Getz is a singer & songwriter who also has amazing credits. Jane has recorded a number 1 album with John Lennon. Jane has also worked with Ringo Starr, Herbie Mann, Charles Lloyd, Pharoah Sanders, the Bee Gees and she received a recording contract with RCA.

This Next Single - Fire (working title)

We are all excited about getting this single recorded. This is not just another song that I will record and release. It has the potential to be submitted for a Grammy nomination in 2016! Also we are going to do whatever we can to get these quality recordings placed in TV and film.

As I mentioned, I do have a full-time job but it only pays the cost of bills and rent. I had little to no savings at the end of every month. With your help, recording the next song for my eventual album will make it all possible.

Why you should help & How you can help

On average it costs 3K to record, hire musicians to produce & master 1 quality song. You will be not only helping me but also some of the musicians and other team players I will employ to get this project going. Simply select a perk to contribute, get awesome stuff and the satisfaction of knowing that you'd helped like shake and bake! :)

About Me & My Music Career

As early as I can remember I have been writing poetry and songs. I have been taking vocal lessons since age 8 and would sit in front of my computer for hours writing songs. Music is everything to me and I’ve put everything on the line to make my dreams come true. Since moving to LA, I’ve had a building momentum of success.

In 2013 I had the pleasure to work and learn with Mike Sullivan where we finished and recorded my song: "Give Me Your Love."  It was the first single I released for sale online digitally. It was something I've never done before and a milestone in my career.

In 2014 Callin Passero of Dead Hello and I teamed up to write “Somebody to Love”  and had the good fortune to get David Hildago from Distortion Track to play drums for the song. It was an amazing experience and one of my favorite songs. I will be giving you a copy of the song at every level!!!!

In 2015 I sang at a party and met my current manager. Our plan is to record an album in order to move my career to the next level. As a part of the process, we will be doing just one song first.

I have a lot of soulful introspective lyrics where I want to add a small quartet with a four piece band. My soulful, rock and bluesy hearfelt songs are not out in the world yet. I know when you hear a quality recording that you helped create - you won't be let down. 

Transparency

I just updated this 11/9/2015. I recently received a loan to get my car fixed. Thanks to the generous support of others that I will respect and leave their names anonymous. Please know that I will still need to pay every cent of the borrowed money back. I also have joinbreeze.com for a temporary ride. The payments are $200 a week for this leased car. Ouch! I know - HOWEVER - After some serious careful consideration I have decided to change the campaign just to cover music 100%.

It's too late to change the amount so I will use all the funds to go towards an eventual EP.

I WON'T QUIT!!!! So if the campaign doesn't fund I am still going to record this song but it might take much longer than anticipated.  However, some of you have asked how can you help. This is how. You CAN make a difference in my life and my music will touch so many others' lives! #LevelUpLe

Music is everything to me! Everyone involved will be so grateful you decided to help!!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out about our project by sharing this page with friends and family! Click here to share on twitter.

For More about Le - Go to www.LeLien.com

Email me at: Backers2015@LeLien.com

story:
**** turn on the english subtitles for the clip :)

The Band

Gypsy Ska Orquesta also known as „La Gypsy” is a band from Caracas-Venezuela formed in 2009 as a Street music project. With their great mixture of Balkan music, Ska, Swing, Cumbia, Reggae and even Salsa they always blow the audience with their performances full of energies. In addition to a lot of concerts in Venezuela they have done by now two European tours in the last two years, playing in 11 countries and more than 50 cities, sharing the stages with many great artists in such festivals as Mighty Sounds in Czech Republic, Burg Herzberg in Germany or Goulash Disko in Croatia, everything self organised and financed.

The project 

With this campaign we're aiming to get funds to continue with this project for which we’ve been fighting the last two years. It’s not easy to keep a band working when the members live in such different places as Venezuela, Spain, Germany and Poland. It requires a lot of effort not only physical but also economical, but we like big challenges and what is more important we believe in what we're doing! 

That's why we took with us on tour in 2015 a good friend of us: Krzysztof Gajewski, who's the director of the documentary film Ska Delight. He was with us during the whole tour, almost two months, and he filmed a lot of interesting things that show how it looks to be on tour from the perspective of a young band. With this material we will do a documentary film called GSO Presents:The Road of the Goat  which is planned to be released at the end of 2016 and through it we want to show you our work from inside, our fears, our expectations and even our quarrels: being on tour is not the kind of easy stuff. 

Apart of the film, we also want to ask you for your help to organise our first European winter tour which will take place in March 2016 during a month, yeah we start the new year with new challenges! It's really important for us to keep this as a totally independent project, that's why we will be really thankful to all of you if you can help us, and even if you cannot collaborate with money you can help us a lot spreading the word about our campaign!!!

The money we will collect with this campaign will be spent in:

Film postproduction 3000€-Film editing (we have around 48 hours of material), colouring, sound, subtitles, animations and expenses for meetings of the crew.

European winter tour 3500€-3 flying tickets from Caracas to Germany and some mechanical repairs for our tour van.

Production of the Perks 1500€- Cds, posters, stickers, DVDs, t-shirts

LOTS OF LOVE FROM GSO CREW!!!

story:
Transcript:

  • 0:00 THE WORLD Political
  • 0:04 Political MUSICAL 
  • 0:07 TOUR
  • 0:14  from MUNICH/Germany
  • 0:22  ca. 600 Km  =  100.000€
  • 0:31  ca. 2000Km = 200.000€
  • 0:46 ca.  WORLD  =  300.000€ or MORE :)
  • 0:57 #KONNEXIONBALKON
  • 1:01  THX LOVE
  • 1:04 (Applause)




Ladies and Gentelmen 

dear kids and animals, 

Friends and  Foes 

and now something KONNSTREETLY different


KONNEXION BALKON

 a seriously fucking unique, non-profitable, charity organization for change and inspiration :)   

                                                       Indeed miraculous are we!



KONNEXION BALKON 

is a group of professionally well trained classical musicians, Jazz musicians and  non qualified musicians. We are all fanatical lovers of classical,jazz, pop,rock and folk music. Indeed a Potpourri of nationalities and newly sampled compositions.We are legally self-employed, freelance musicians.

Quite simply,

Buskers!



   CHANGE ART 4 MONEY


                                   

Stravansky 

Violin Player/Master of Ceremony/Lead Screamer/Dompteur

"... initially I always wanted to sing, but they handed me a violin which led to heavy psychic disturbances..." passionate sushi eater, thermal baths addicted. Professional emotionalist with main topic "Busking".


                                       

Alex  

Bassplayer and Banjo virtuoso

 Composer/better Singer than Igor, but these are just rumors ;) Our oldest member; he barely shows up these days, but that's his problem ;). He writes music scores for choirs, theater, films, string quartet, sometimes for us, diverse colleagues and for himself. They pay him! It's alright, he will come back to us for sure!!


                                      

Vladimir 

Accordion/unwilling to sing

Born in the Ukraine (left bottom corner).

Talks just after having guzzled three Augustiner beer and he's almost always in time. Nothing left to say. Laughs rarely (but loud). Slavonic. Melancholic.


                                          

Steffen 

Bass and Banjo player, arranger, music teacher

doesn't like himself on photos, doesn't like to be called "the small basso" , moans... we always earn good money with him.


                                         

Julian 

Lead Singer/ Piano Player

Makes music since stepping on planet Earth . His mother Barbara is a professional concert pianist and daughter of the legendary tenor Fritz . His father Ron is singer, actor and entertainer. Now he is playing with us. 

I don't quite get it.


                                             

Michael 

Bass and guitar virtuoso  

with 9 and a half fingers, joins in occasionally as background singer. Sound engineer, composer, teacher... but not for us. Plays over 200 shows a year... but not with us. He's working too much!!


                                           

Sini

Pianoplayer, Composer, Entertainer

Loves women, wine and songs. Silly, funny, entertaining, artist and playboy. Gentleman. 

That's it!


                                           

Dizzy 

Extraterrestial.Period.


Pavel, Igi, Guto, Lorenz,Kolja / Bass Players on demand.They are with us too seldom to give a real assessment, but they are quite cute though!



THE MOVIE





...how it all began...


When you're a Student and broke  you are sometimes struck with the best ideas. That's when creativity sets in. Indeed this  happened to us and voilà! we hit the streets! No more waiting, anticipating, agents, calls, waiting again... We were young, crazy and had success with it. Today we are a little less younger, a little more crazier, bit still  completely successful with it.

         

 by Marco Jordan


Of course there are good times and bad times, but such is life.However we are serious musicians, who choose the streets as our stage, not because we have to but because we want to be close to YOU, our audience...


  YES YOU!

                                   

                                                               by Eyad Abushaar‎


KONNEXION BALKON 

means always something thorough for the ears! An excellent performance,  charming entertainment enriched with witty and freaky side kicks, thanks to our extremely dedicated audience.



       

                  

       

 by Elke Rutz


KONNEXION BALKON 

established in 1999 has in recent years  made its name as Munich's most famous street Crosover Mashup Theatre!!


    by Håkan Ringman‎ 

"I am having trouble  in defining KONNEXION BALKON properly" says Igor and adds " a geographical realm of our music is diffuse and disperse.... one could say continental European perhaps......aiming to feel and bring to the audience all this melancholy, with some crazy beats kicking in. 

We are so to speak free art, enabling everyone to enjoy the luxury of our music.And our Motto is Pay what you want ,when you want and how you want! We have to admit the more the better!


 

by Evgeny Suslov            by Laura Cavada                           by Santana Medina

by Moritz

by 丘丘瑄 ChiuChu

So  if you stop by and your shoppingbags are full but your pockets are empty after having shopped -to-you -drop, no worries! Just donate by clicking and   you'll make several musicians very happy! 

 

    by enfotograf


 The more you give,The more you get, Not with us!!! We want to make our music available to everyone. Music schouldn't cost anything. No way, music must cost anything! You’ll always get from us utmost we have to give, no matter how much money you support us with! Everybody gets the same, you can visit our concerts, download our music, sing with us, laugh and dance..

Enjoy!

                             



 by Elise Ntoremi



 RÉSUMÉ... 


                                                          maybe on your language?? 

                                                        www.konnexionbalkon.com



THE END



almost..



Ladies and Gentelmen 

dear kids and animals

                   Friends and  Foes 


and now something KONNSTREETLY different


KONNEXION BALKON


( same story on... )


                                                                                                  

                                                                                                             


KONNEXION BALKON … ein gemein/nützlicher Verein für Inspiration und Veränderung. Ein ernsthaft/ungewöhnliches Projekt – Glück!!! Ein Unikat! Die beste Straßenband der Welt!! 

KONNEXION BALKON bedeutet …Immer ordentlich was auf die Ohren! Eine ausgezeichnete, musikalische Performance und charmantes Entertainment bereichert durch improvisierte, unerwartete, aufschlussreiche, witzige und skurrile Nebenrollen, dank unserem sehr engagierten Publikum! 

KONNEXION BALKON sind… Klassisch ausgebildete Musiker, Jazz-Musiker und keine Musiker.Absolute Liebhaber von Klassik, Jazz, Pop, Rock und Folklore. Ein Potpourri an Nationalitäten und neu gesampelten Kompositionen aller Musikrichtungen.Und natürlich sind wir nach Recht und Gesetz auch „normale Selbstständige“. Und das sind wir natürlich auch – völlig normal und selbständig:-) Straßenmusiker eben.

KONNEXION BALKON wie alles begann… Wenn man pleite ist und Student, hat man manchmal die besten Ideen – und die hatten wir. Ab auf die Straße! Schluss mit Warten, Agenten, Telefonieren, Warten… Wir waren jung, wir waren bescheuert und wir hatten Erfolg damit! Heute sind wir halb so jung, nur noch halb so bescheuert und haben Erfolg damit! Mal besser mal schlechter, Ihr wisst wie das so ist…. Aber wir sind die Musiker, die sich die Straße als Bühne ausgesucht haben. Weil wir es wollen, nicht weil wir es müssen!!

KONNEXION BALKON ein 1999 gegründetes Kollektiv,das sich in den letzten Jahren als Münchens bekanntestes Straßen-Pop-Theater einen Namen gemacht hat!!

„Mit einer amtlichen Definition für Konnexion Balkon tue ich mir schwer -sagt Igor über Konnexion-und eine geografische Ortung ist für unsere Musik leider nicht möglich...... kontinentaleuropäisch vielleicht... Obwohl es durchaus melancholische und verrückte Momente zu hören und zu sehen gibt...... wir sind gefestigt......wir brauchen keine bunten Pillen, wir mögen das...... wir sind des musikalischen Wahnsinns fette Beute...... die freie Kunst im vollendeten Sinne...geliehen und ausgezeichnet interpretiert... und für alle, die sich eingeredet haben diese oder jene Art von Musik nicht zu mögen... auch für Euch ist etwas dabei........ versprochen! Eine umweltbewusste Band, die nichts neues komponiert, aber Vorhandenes besser macht!! Musikalisches Upcycling!!“

Wir sind sozusagen FREIE KUNST ALS LUXUS FÜR ALLE!!! 

Und die Devise lautet: PAY WHAT YOU WANT ..or MORE!!!

Also folgendes: Ihr wart bei einem unserer Straßenkonzerte, die Hände voll mit Tüten und keinen Pfennig mehr in der Tasche. Kein Problem! Dafür haben wir jetzt eine ganz tolle neue Option! DONATE! Hier klicken und schon sind 6,7,8 Musiker glücklich gemacht!



And now Ladies and Gentelmen 

liebe Kinder und die Kinderinnen 

Freunde und Feinde


something KONNSTREETLY different



ZUSAMMENGEFASST...


                                                       


KONNEXION BALKON
