Sound engineer, composer, teacher... but not for us. Plays over 200 shows a year... but not with us. He's working too much!!                                           SiniPianoplayer, Composer, EntertainerLoves women, wine and songs. Silly, funny, entertaining, artist and playboy. Gentleman. That's it!                                           Dizzy Extraterrestial.Period.Pavel, Igi, Guto, Lorenz,Kolja / Bass Players on demand.They are with us too seldom to give a real assessment, but they are quite cute though!THE MOVIE...how it all began...When you're a Student and
broke  you are sometimes struck with the best ideas. That's when
creativity sets in. Indeed this  happened to us and voilà! we hit the
streets! No more waiting, anticipating, agents, calls, waiting again... We were
young, crazy and had success with it. Today we are a little less younger, a
little more crazier, bit still  completely successful with it.

          by Marco Jordan
Of
course there are good times and bad times, but such is life.However we are
serious musicians, who choose the streets as our stage, not because we have to but because we want to be close to YOU, our audience...
  YES YOU!

                                                                                                  by Eyad Abushaar‎


KONNEXION
BALKON 
means always something thorough for the ears! An excellent
performance,  charming entertainment enriched with witty and freaky side
kicks, thanks to our extremely dedicated audience.



       
                  
       
 by Elke Rutz



KONNEXION BALKON 
established in 1999 has in recent years  made its name as Munich's most famous street
Crosover Mashup Theatre!!




    by Håkan Ringman‎ 


"I am having trouble  in defining KONNEXION BALKON properly" says Igor and adds " a geographical realm of our music is diffuse and disperse.... one could say continental European perhaps......aiming to feel and bring to the audience all this melancholy, with some crazy beats kicking in. 
We are so to speak free art, enabling everyone to enjoy the luxury of our music.And our Motto is Pay what you want ,when you want and how you want! We have to admit the more the better!



 
by Evgeny Suslov            by Laura Cavada                           by Santana Medina


by Moritz

by 丘丘瑄 ChiuChu

So  if you stop by and your shoppingbags are full but your pockets are empty after having shopped -to-you -drop, no worries! Just donate by clicking and   you'll make several musicians very happy! 



 
    by enfotograf


 The more you give,The more you get, Not with us!!! We want to make our music available to everyone. Music schouldn't cost anything. No way, music must cost anything! You’ll always get from us utmost we have to give, no matter how much money you support us with! Everybody gets the same, you can visit our concerts, download our music, sing with us, laugh and dance..
Enjoy!                             




 by Elise Ntoremi


 RÉSUMÉ... 



                                                          maybe on your language?? 
                                                        www.konnexionbalkon.com


THE END



almost..



Ladies and Gentelmen 
dear kids and animals

                   Friends and  Foes 



and now something KONNSTREETLY different


KONNEXION BALKON

( same story on... )

                                                                                                  
                                                                                                             



KONNEXION BALKON … ein gemein/nützlicher Verein für
Inspiration und Veränderung. Ein ernsthaft/ungewöhnliches Projekt – Glück!!!
Ein Unikat! Die beste Straßenband der Welt!! 
KONNEXION BALKON bedeutet …Immer ordentlich was auf
die Ohren! Eine ausgezeichnete, musikalische Performance und charmantes
Entertainment bereichert durch improvisierte, unerwartete, aufschlussreiche,
witzige und skurrile Nebenrollen, dank unserem sehr engagierten Publikum! 
KONNEXION BALKON sind… Klassisch ausgebildete Musiker, Jazz-Musiker und keine
Musiker.Absolute Liebhaber von Klassik, Jazz, Pop, Rock und Folklore. Ein
Potpourri an Nationalitäten und neu gesampelten Kompositionen aller
Musikrichtungen.Und natürlich sind wir nach Recht und Gesetz auch „normale
Selbstständige“. Und das sind wir natürlich auch – völlig normal und
selbständig:-) Straßenmusiker eben.
KONNEXION BALKON wie alles begann… Wenn man pleite ist und Student, hat man manchmal die
besten Ideen – und die hatten wir. Ab auf die Straße! Schluss mit Warten,
Agenten, Telefonieren, Warten… Wir waren jung, wir waren bescheuert und wir
hatten Erfolg damit! Heute sind wir halb so jung, nur noch halb so bescheuert
und haben Erfolg damit! Mal besser mal schlechter, Ihr wisst wie das so ist….
Aber wir sind die Musiker, die sich die Straße als Bühne ausgesucht haben. Weil
wir es wollen, nicht weil wir es müssen!!
KONNEXION BALKON ein 1999 gegründetes Kollektiv,das sich in den letzten Jahren als
Münchens bekanntestes Straßen-Pop-Theater einen Namen gemacht hat!!
„Mit
einer amtlichen Definition für Konnexion Balkon tue ich mir schwer -sagt Igor
über Konnexion-und eine geografische Ortung ist für unsere Musik leider nicht
möglich...... kontinentaleuropäisch vielleicht... Obwohl es durchaus
melancholische und verrückte Momente zu hören und zu sehen gibt...... wir sind
gefestigt......wir brauchen keine bunten Pillen, wir mögen das...... wir sind
des musikalischen Wahnsinns fette Beute...... die freie Kunst im vollendeten
Sinne...geliehen und ausgezeichnet interpretiert... und für alle, die sich
eingeredet haben diese oder jene Art von Musik nicht zu mögen... auch für Euch
ist etwas dabei........ versprochen! Eine umweltbewusste Band, die nichts neues
komponiert, aber Vorhandenes besser macht!! Musikalisches Upcycling!!“
Wir sind
sozusagen FREIE KUNST ALS LUXUS FÜR ALLE!!! 
Und die
Devise lautet: PAY WHAT YOU WANT ..or MORE!!!
Also
folgendes: Ihr wart bei einem unserer Straßenkonzerte, die Hände voll mit Tüten
und keinen Pfennig mehr in der Tasche. Kein Problem! Dafür haben wir jetzt eine
ganz tolle neue Option! DONATE! Hier klicken und schon
sind 6,7,8 Musiker glücklich gemacht!



And now Ladies and Gentelmen 
liebe Kinder und die Kinderinnen 
Freunde und Feinde


something KONNSTREETLY different



ZUSAMMENGEFASST...


                                                       

KONNEXION BALKON

story:
They say you can't go back in time...well, you kind of CAN!

"Listening to KATZ Radio is like being sucked up into a vortex of memories!"

- Carla Nichols, faithful listener

CLICK HERE TO LISTEN LIVE!

Short Summary

KATZ Radio is a Christian-Community radio station based out of the Dallas/Fort Worth metroplex.  The station is owned by Stretch Productions - a tenured media team comprised of Cami Bradley and her husband of 28 years, Randy.  In mid-2015, Cami and Randy began to expand their home production suite into the radio realm to accommodate the station’s 24/7 broadcast.  In November 2015, the station went live and its vast library of music and programming has continued to expand daily.

But sadly. December 2015 brought some unfortunate news for broadcasters nationwide…

The SWA (Small Webmaster’s Agreement) was a law that was in effect since 2007, but was not renewed for 2016.  This means stations like KATZ Radio are at risk of losing music licenses, and stations must go to each PRO (Performing Rights Organizations) individually to obtain these necessary licenses.  This decision was made by unelected judges who make up the CRB (Copyright Royalty Board).  Below we will provide more context about how this decision drastically increases the station's operating costs.


How It Started

Also in 2015 - but before the inception of KATZ Radio - Cami joined forces with her former radio partner John Roberts and began their original one-hour radio program titled Come Praise The Lord.  John Roberts has spent over 30 years in show business. His wealth of experience ranges from stage acting/theater production (including Broadway, the Fort Worth Opera and Casa Manana) to television producing and hosting an award-winning weekly cable television show in Dallas.  Cami Bradley's vast media background includes DJ and Broadcast Meteorologist at multiple Dallas/Fort Worth radio stations (including 50,000-watt clear-channel WBAP), as well as camera operator and voice-over work at KXAS-TV/NBC Channel 5 in Fort Worth.

It wasn’t long after the show’s launch that Cami had the dream of 24/7 airplay in the form of a radio station.  The station was to mirror the show’s format; featuring Christian-Classics (oldies!) that no other stations are actively highlighting.  Yes, there are “oldies” stations and shows, but not in the Christian music format.  The core of the music library's content focuses on Southern Gospel and Contemporary Christian music.  But, the main focus of KATZ Radio is the local tie-in to the DFW area churches, as well as featuring both rising and established artists.


A note from Cami Bradley:

“KATZ Radio is Christian-Community Radio for DFW. Do we have music from your church? Each hour, we play choir and orchestra numbers (both new and old!), plus Praise & Worship time with the congregations/praise bands alongside established Christian-Classic Hits from the 70s-90s! AND we give local DFW indie-artists some airplay too - as it is so hard to get on radio! Join us for the PURR-fect blend of music- and message me about our very inexpensive ad rates right now.

As soon as time and money allows this winter/spring, I will be adding some special tapes donated to KATZ  from some important historical radio and TV stations here in the metroplex. I have some original shows and clips - ranging from 7 minutes to an hour in length! For the TV shows, I can pull the audio off for radio.

And although mostly KATZ  is music - I do want to add just a few teaching slots as well. I've already talked with one or two of you about this!)  And so far, we have music from the following churches in the Ft. Worth/Dallas metroplex: 

Sagamore Hill (Ft. Worth), Bethesda (Ft. Worth), Christ Chapel (Ft. Worth), Harvest (Watauga), The Exchange (Keller), Fielder Road (Arlington), Fellowship (Grapevine), Gateway (N. FW -AND- Southlake campuses), White's Chapel (Southlake), 1st Baptist Grapevine, 1st Baptist Dallas, Shiloh Terrace (Dallas; at the Garland line), Prestonwood (Plano), and I have music from The Heights (Richardson) which I have not added yet but will. We are also very excited to be playing music from 1st Baptist Houston, Calvary Chapel Merritt Island Florida, St. Andrew, Panama City Florida, The Singing Men Of Texas, and The Singing Women Of Texas!


What We Need & What You Get

It’s easy to see that the world of media (and media platforms) is changing rapidly.  Previously, running KATZ Radio averaged around $200/month ($2,400 annually) and the SWA law covered all necessary music licenses for its broadcasting needs.  But without the help of the SWA law, here is a look at the upcoming costs:

  • $.17 cents per song, per 100 listeners
  • $500 annual minimum to SoundExchange
  • $1,200 annual minimum to PROs (ASCAP, SESAC, BMI)
  • $200 monthly costs previously mentioned
  • Hundreds of additional dollars for equipment, initial music purchases and engineers that repair and maintain the equipment 
For a “big picture" breakdown on the above as well as the additional effects on the entire radio industry, check out these great articles:

http://www.radioworld.com/article/crb-ruling-is-“crushingly-bad-news”-for-microcasters/277856

http://www.radiosurvivor.com/2016/01/05/why-american-independent-internet-radio-may-go-extinct-in-2016/

After the successful launch of KATZ Radio’s flagship program Come Praise The Lord, Stretch Productions and their affiliates felt God pressing them to expand their reach.  While the launch of KATZ Radio has been an exciting step of obedience in that direction, the massive increase in costs due to the SWA law being dissolved is now a major barrier on the path.

  • As the title suggests, the entire goal is to keep KATZ Radio on the air.  For this to happen within the scope of the recent law changes, research shows it will average at least $475/month. The financial goal of $6,000 is based on that number for one year of airplay (minus Indiegogo's fee after the funds are raised).
  • Your contribution will not go unnoticed.  The Bible also teaches to "give honor where honor is due."  Unless you wish to remain anonymous, you will receive a special on-air "thank you" for you and/or your business.  You can find more about our rewards in the sidebar.
  • If the entire goal of $6,000 is not met, your special contribution still matters!  Even if a total of $6,000 is raised - which would average one week's airplay - that one week could reach one person. 

Risks & Challenges.

    • Stretch Productions and their affiliates are completely and confidently equipped in both experience (and spirit) to "press on" towards what the Lord has called them to do.
    • While they are so thankful for KATZ Radio’s progress-to-date, without the necessary funding, the station will be at risk of losing its licenses and going dark.


Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, it's understood that not everyone will be in a place to make a financial gift. If you feel led to help keep KATZ Radio on the air, here are some alternative ideas on how you can get plugged in:

  • Share our campaign on your personal/business social media pages.
  • Alert your local media about the mentioned changes in broadcasting and its effect on the future of KATZ Radio.
  • Pray for the broadcast and the listeners.

story:
Sicmonic

We are Arizona based life long musicians known and recognized locally & internationally for outstanding musicianship & unique musical artistry. We consider ourselves to be craftsman of sound. For years we have worked endlessly creating and putting together not just a music album but a work of art in motion. We believe our music has powers to cause good things & even change lives for the better because it was created with those things in mind. We have teamed up with legendary producer/engineer/owner of Villain Recording and The Best Clothing Co, Byron Filson to help bring our vison of Darcauditure to life! With that said we need your help to complete and to share this unique & influential music with the world! How you can help - Sicmonic is roughly halfway there but needs financial assistance to complete the album process. Please be a part of our music history & be a part of creating a lasting piece of art! PLEASE DONATE to the completion of our latest & most influential musical vision yet! Darcauditure! Thank you sincerely for your support! Together, we can complete this meaningful and one of a kind masterpiece! Thank you truly! Any and all donations are greatly appreciated and will help tremendously (perks will ship after campaign ends).  Thank you! We love all of you!    
Sincerely,
Billy, Ray, Zack, David, and Zach
SICMONIC

story:
I NEED YOU! Will you help me reach the world with my gift of song?! I’m Delores Harris, also known as Lady Dee. I’ve been singing since the age of 4, professionally since the age of 15. I’m also an actress of stage plays and independent films. In my former day job, as a Pre K- 8th grade principal, I was known as ( and am still known as) Dr. Harris. Although I’ve been performing and recording intermittently, both individually and with groups, most of my time has been spent raising my two sons and being a dedicated educator. At one time, in the eighties, my group, Everlife, was even signed to 20th Century Fox. However, that relationship just wasn’t meant to be. I’m The Detroit Black Music Awards’ August 2014 to August 2015 R&B Female Vocalist of the Year, and was a 2012 nominee. I am also the 2014 Torch Foundation’s Cultural Award winner for using my vocal gift (at no charge) as a way to encourage others to financially support efforts for student educational and social development programs. As the 2011 winner of the Radio One/Detroit Tigers Singing Stars Competition; I performed the National Anthem at a Detroit Tigers’ game. I have also performed the National Anthem for the Detroit Pistons!  I have graced the same stages as, and/or with The Calloways and other members of Midnight Star, Sir Nose, After 7, actor Leon Robinson, Martha Reeves, Spyder Turner, The Contours and The Original Vandellas, Patti Austin, Sheila Raye Charles (daughter of Ray Charles) and Smokey Robinson.

Now, I’m ready to sing and perform for the world, but don’t have the funds to support my dream, being on pension. Many of my friends and associates have made to stardom or close to it over the years while I was focused on my children and day job. One in particular who is a Grammy-award winning, platinum selling artist, songwriter and producer, has written a song just for me! Not only do I need funds for the use of the song, but I need it for production and legal costs that are necessary to properly complete and release the project. This huge expense, minimally $10,000, has prompted me to realize that releasing a single first, rather than a full EP (album) is at least a way to get started.

I claim and have faith that this single release and future projects will not only reach the world, but will chart well! With a product to share, I can even more easily be booked by promoters and agencies, giving me the opportunity to travel around the world to perform. Before I leave this plane of existence, I want this for myself and others whose hearts my music may reach. I’ve spent my days helping others and their children. Now, I need help! Be a part of making my dream come true. Your kindness will be noted and never forgotten! Maybe I might meet you as I travel the world too! Please contribute today, and tell everyone you know to do the same. Together we can!

booked by promoters and agencies, giving me the opportunity to travel around
the world to perform. Before I leave this plane of existence, I want this for
myself and others whose hearts my music may reach. I’ve spent my days helping
others and their children. Now, I need help! Be a part of making my dream come
true. Your kindness will be noted and never forgotten! Maybe I might meet you
as I travel the world too! Please contribute today, and tell everyone you know
to do the same. Together we can!

story:
DESERT is a Dark Epic Metal act from Israel which exists since 2002 and released 2 EP’s and 2 full length studio albums. Our last record, entitled "Never Regret”", was released worldwide on 2015 via Raven Music and in Russia via Irond Records. This album made a huge impact and  received an amazing reviews, feedbacks and recognition among the fans and the press worldwide. Through the years DESERT co-operated both on stage and in the studio with lot of great and well known musicians such as Joakim Broden (Sabaton), Ralf Scheepers (Primal Fear), Chris Boldentahl (Grave Digger) and many others. DESERT played hundreds of live shows – in Israel and abroad, in clubs and open air festivals such as Sabaton Open Air (Sweden), Aiya Napa Youth Festival (Cyprus), Total Metal Festival (Italy), PolineRock Festival (Bulgaria) and many others. And still counting! Later this year DESERT will join forces with the mighty Circle II Circle for a huge European tour.

DESERT Official website: www.desertband.com

Social media:

We decided to create a great and very special video clip for one of the most epic and powerful songs - “Son Of A Star” - on our last "Never Regret" album. 


The main theme of this song is the revolt of Shimon Bar Kokhva against the Roman Empire which took place at the ancient Judea through 132-135 CE. We've worked hard couple of months on the script for this video with the director Vadim Mechona (who previously worked with Orphaned Land videos and also produced our previous “Never Regret” video). 


The main idea and agenda are to create a huge historical video in the wave of “Spartacus – Blood and Sand” – something that will require a big production and funds. And this is the reason why we need each one of you.

Real historical outfits, actors, production team, and equipment – all this requires the heavy funding that we need to gain by our own. In this tough business we don't have the support from any record company – just us with a huge ambitions and big agenda to create an insane video clip…

For “Never Regret” album recordings we also opened an Indiegogo campaign that helped us a lot to cover a big part of recording expenses. So we hope that this campaign will be even more successful and with your help we will be able to produce a great video that will open a new page in DESERT history.

To cover the production expenses we need 10 000 €. As much funds we will raise from the campaign -  we will afford bigger production. If we’ll rise more than 10 000 € - rest of the funds will be invested in our upcoming European tour with Circle II Circle and Lord Volture.

In exchange of your help we prepared for you some unique stuff, most of it (like “Son Of A Star” tshirt)were prepared specially for the campaign funders and will be available only for them!!! 

Victoria constat in legionum virtute (Victory depends of legions’ valor)

Gaius Julius Caesar 

5 Euro – Rookie Legionnaire pack

Autographed exclusive photo of the band – signed and dedicated + 20% discount on one purchase at our official web store.

15 Euro – Junior Legionnaire pack

“Never Regret” CD, signed and dedicated + Rookie Legionnaire pack. Free shipping

20 Euro – Decanus Legionnaire pack

Digipack “Never Regret” – special edition with bonus track signed and dedicated + Rookie Legionnaire pack. Free shipping

30 Euro - Decurio Legionnaire pack


“Son Of A Star” tshirt + Digipack “Never Regret” – special edition with bonus track signed and dedicated. Please add a T-shirt size next to your name (S, M, L, XL, XXL). Free shipping.

40 Euro – Digital Legionnaire pack

All DESERT discography (include very rare EP “The Way To Honor” and karaoke versions of “Never Regret” album) in one, all the tracks in high quality audio into the special USB stick. Free shipping.

50 Euro - Tesserarius Legionnaire pack

Your name clearly featured in the music video credits + Decanus Legionnaire pack. Please add a T-shirt size next to your name (S, M, L, XL, XXL). Free shipping.

70 Euro – Optio Legionnaire pack

Digital Legionnaire pack + “Son Of A Star” tshirt + Digipack “Never Regret” – special edition with bonus track signed and dedicated. Please add a T-shirt size next to your name (S, M, L, XL, XXL). Free shipping. + Your name clearly featured in the music video credits + Autographed exclusive photo of the band

100 Euro – Drums pack

A pair of signed drum sticks and snair drum plastic that Assaf used during the filming of the video + Autographed exclusive photo of the band + “Son Of A Star” tshirt + Digipack “Never Regret” – special edition with bonus track signed and dedicated. Please add a T-shirt size next to your name (S, M, L, XL, XXL). Free shipping

150 Euro – Centurion pack

A free VIP pass for any of our nearest gigs(early access to venue to meet the band include the upcoming European tour) + Autographed exclusive photo of the band + “Son Of A Star” tshirt + Digipack “Never Regret” – special edition with bonus track signed and dedicated. Please add a T-shirt size next to your name (S, M, L, XL, XXL). Free shipping

200 Euro – Movie Star pack

You will be invited to the set, at the day of the video filming, to take part in the production and maybe even to play a role in the video (transportation to the filming place on your own)! “Son Of A Star” tshirt + Digipack “Never Regret” – special edition with bonus track signed and dedicated. Please add a T-shirt size next to your name (S, M, L, XL, XXL). Free shipping + Your name clearly featured in the music video credits + Autographed exclusive photo of the band

800 euro - Guitar Player pack

Sergei Metalheart's custom built electric guitar + 10 signed guitar picks with band's logo (shipping included)

1000 euro - Caesar Pack

Movie Star pack + Guitar Player pack

THANK YOU FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION! WE APPRECIATE THAT!

For any questions or problems please write us: a.m.releases@gmail.com
Visit DESERT here:
www.desertband.com
www.facebook.com/DesertOfficial
www.instagram.com/desert_official
www.twitter.com/Desert_band
www.vk.com/desert
www.youtube.com/Desertofficial

story:
I am debuting my first album, First Flight, with my true voice, after years of soul-searching and all I want more than anything is to inspire younger people who need solace, create opportunities of creativity within other artists, and turn my art into a powerful tool to raise awareness for the things I honor most. On the album, you will hear mellotrons, Wurlitzer organs, string sections, & live drums (just to name a few)!

HERE ARE A FEW LYRICS LEAKED FROM THE ALBUM: 

PREACHHHHHHHHHH!!!

AND NOW...

My name is Wren Wilder and I've been creating music for as long as I can remember. My family loved music deeply and was responsible for introducing me to the artists that influenced and inspired me the most.  I woke up to Billie Holiday on vinyl every morning as my mother cooked up breakfast. In the evening, my family would listen to Bob Marley's, Legend, while we lit the tiki torches and told our stories. Music was always a storytelling device and when my family went through its transformations, it became the only way of communicating with the world that felt organic and real. 

My father, as a singer-songwriter himself, practiced with his band in the basement under my bedroom while I tried to fall asleep. He and my bonus (step) mother would plan out weekends filled with nonstop music for my brother and I. Together, we discovered countless musicians who molded my ears, as a young musician, and that's when I knew I wanted to make music forever.

 

I had always been a performer since I can remember. My mom had me taking dance classes, violin lessons, piano lessons, all the clubs and activities that involved me on a stage!

 

When I turned thirteen, my mother asked if I had any interest in taking voice lessons. Her best friend had a niece who was starting a career in vocal training. I was her first student and I trembled for hours trying to complete my first assignment: Sing for my parents (OUT LOUD). Five years later, mom held my hand as I auditioned for 13 music conservatories around the world as a double major in Jazz Voice and Music Recording Technology. The rest is history, as they say. 

 

     "Originally built as a post office in early 1950, Barefoot Recording was eventually converted to Crystal Industries Recording Studio in 1967 by Andrew Berliner. Through Andrew's innovative acoustic and electrical design, the studio quickly became one of the premier recording facilities in Southern California. The extensive client list reads like a who's who of the 60s and 70s. Artists ranging from Barbara Streisand to Jimi Hendrix and with a high point being the recording and creation of Stevie Wonder’s "Songs in the key of Life". Other notable artists include: Supertramp, Jackson 5, War, The Doors, James Taylor, Eric Clapton, Marvin Gaye, and The Byrds.

     

Barefoot Recording Studios in Hollywood, California (image from their website)

      As of the summer of 2018, Eric Valentine and studio manager and long time friend of the studio, Tim O'Sullivan, along with the staff, have re-opened Barefoot in its full capacity to outside bookings. Barefoot Recording combines the tradition, service and professionalism of big LA commercial studio with the vibe and creativity of a world-class producer's private studio. Barefoot is a truly inspirational and special place to make music."

Our Producer, Joe Napolitano, being interviewed by Produce Like a Pro about Barefoot Recording Studios

 

                 

The longer I make music, the more I learn about myself as an artist. I work most productively when I am able to collaborate and bounce ideas off of other artists I trust. I am confident that my songs deserve professional musicians, an innovative producer, and skilled mixers in order to be the best it can be for you! 

                         

​@josephsocks

As a producer and engineer he strives to incorporate a sympathetic, collaborative approach to his sessions. Joe started recording music as a teenager in his parents’ garage in Brooklyn NY. He later moved to Los Angeles to study recording and the music business at USC. After graduation Joe began playing with and recording bands around LA. He landed a job at Capitol Studios where he worked as an in-house recording engineer. His previous assignment at Capitol has him working with EMI Music Publishing’s roster of producers and writers in a number of genres.

Now Joe works at Barefoot Recording! There, he's worked with artists such as Neil Young, Mary J Blige, and more...

                            
@beatnikwolfgirl
 
"Kaitlin Wolfberg is a significant part of the Los Angeles music community and she is highly respected. She appeared on stage playing violin with H.E.R at the 2019 Grammy Awards. It is Wolfberg’s versatility and her ability to shine that have seen her garner praise for her playing (violin and viola), as a conductor, arranger and composer. Oh and did we happen to mention recently she donned the producer’s hat and she also sings." - Riveting Riffs Interview 
 

                        

​@evaboneva

This is Eva Toorenent, (AKA Eva Boneva) and she is an artist of the weird and the wonderful. She loves to create curious creatures and other weird stuff. Eva 's art style is described as pop-surrealism with a touch of creepiness. She's inspired by her favorite artists Rien Poortvliet, Brian Froud and Tony Diterlizzi.

Eva works with all different kinds of materials, styles and mediums, 2D and 3D. Her favorite is a combination between watercolor and digital. With her art and stories, she focuses on blurring the lines between our world and the other world.

                         

Meet @Johnfurth :  a freelance photographer based in Los Angeles. A few years ago he took Photo 1 at SMC and started shooting city-scapes.   Now John works in a full range of photographic styles; although, he finds himself drawn towards lifestyle branding and the ability to blend beauty, story, and functionality.  John fully believes that great photographs are driven by the stories they tell. 

 

In this process, we will be hustling to promote the album and campaign.  I will be giving away free records from my favorite female singer-songwriters to promote other women who love and appreciate audio! We will also be collaborating with local artists, photographers, and local businesses who love the new album and want to show their support! 

Be sure to check out the perks on the right. We are definitely working for every penny you donate and offering some pretty cool swag. Be sure to look at our Release Party option because it's going to be such a blast! 

Here's a breakdown of what we will use the funding for: 

  • Recording Studio Fee: $5900

    • This will cover the cost of the studio, engineers, and mix/master process

  • Session Players Fee: $4500

    • This is to pay all of the talented, professional musicians that join us in the recording process

  • Distribution: $2600

    • Creating the Wren-Merchandise after we record to start sending out to you! 

Let me start with this so you can understand who I am as a human. I don't think of hurdles as problems. There are no problems but only solutions. That's my mantra and it's done me good this far! That being said, here are the hurdles I'm preparing for along the way.

  • Hypothetically Let's Say: There's some reason I can not record at the studio (natural disaster, act of God, what have you). In this situation, my first instinct would be to hire another studio out and keep the creative team that has been with me on this journey. Being a sound designer for film, I have a vast network of studios in the Los Angeles area to facilitate on short notice.
  • Hypothetically Let's Say: The team for some reason becomes unavailable (family emergencies, act of God, let's hope not!). Thankfully, I have talked to a few teams about this project and they are all very familiar with my work and expectations. If, for some reason, I have to, I will pull on those awesome folks to save the day. 

 

 

Thank you so much, little wrens. I love you all so much for reading. Please follow me on instagram for updates every day @wrenwildermusic ~WW

story:
About

 

The JMI Youth Big Band presents Jewish music as you’ve never heard it before. This is the next generation of musical superstars, breaking ground and redefining music of Jewish origin.
 

“A radical revelation! They play with an assurance, fluency and confidence rarely seen from such youthful ensembles.” – Max Reinhardt, BBC Radio 3

 

At the Jewish Music Institute we’re passionate about music and passionate about the development of our flagship youth project - the JMI Youth Big Band.

The band - made up of 12 - 18 year olds who play drums, bass, guitar, piano, tuba, saxophone, trumpet and trombone - was created in Summer 2017 to bring a contemporary edge to music of Jewish origin and enable talented young musicians from a wide variety of different backgrounds to explore a rich musical and cultural heritage whilst performing at the highest level. 

Tzadik label artist, composer, trumpeter and band leader Sam Eastmond (Spike Orchestra, Gulgoleth) has expertly honed the ensemble to a remarkable degree in the short time since its formation. The debut album - featuring an array of expert musicians from the jazz and cutting edge new music scene including; Jon Madof (guitar), Moss Freed (guitar), Josephine Davies (saxophone), Mike Wilkins (saxophone) and Andy Watts (Trumpet) - is a true testament to Sam's talent as an arranger, collaborator, educator and inspirational figurehead. 

We are all eager to document the band's momentous journey but we need your help to realise this project.

Recording an album is an expensive business, rehearsing, recording and preparing a band this size is a labour of love for us but we can’t pay the studio fees with love alone. The money raised in this campaign will turn our ambitious plans into a reality.

 

Why now?


In the two years since it first formed, the band has gone from strength to strength. They have performed to crowds of more than 5000 people (Klezmer in the Park), recorded and released their debut single "Stronger Together" for charity in December 2018, and are currently being requested for gigs at prestigious venues all over London and throughout the rest of the UK.

We feel the band are ready to take the next steps to becoming a fully established and recognised ensemble with the release of their first studio album. None of the members had ever had any experience of recording before they joined the band, and only a small number had any experience of performing in a large ensemble in front of huge crowds. We strongly believe that this is an incredible opportunity for young talented musicians to make their first steps in the world of professional music making, and we want to push them to reach their full potential in every way we possibly can. 

 

How you can help
 

By signing up to a perk, from pre-ordering a copy of the album to having the whole band come and play in your sitting room (!) you can enable us to fund production (mixing, mastering) studio hire, album art work and printing costs.

  • We need £2500 to finish mixing and mastering the music, pay for the art work, manufacturing of CDs, digital release and track licensing. The additional £1,500 will go towards PR for the album release as well as covering the cost of the album launch performance fees. 
  • If we raise more than the goal, we will put the money towards touring the album around the country in order to push the project further. All donations will be greatly appreciated. 
  • You do not need to claim a perk to make a contribution
  • ...and you can always contribute a higher amount than the perk level you wish to claim

 

 

Our thanks


We are so grateful for your support to help us mix and release the debut album.  Any way you feel that you can get involved is massively appreciated – pre-ordering the album or even sharing this campaign with friends and family on social media is a huge help!

Thank you,

The JMI team

 

More about the Jewish Music Institute 


The JMI is unique in the world of Jewish Music. We are dedicated to the celebration, preservation and development of the living heritage of Jewish music for the benefit of people of all ages, faiths backgrounds and cultures.

Our goal is to inform and inspire students and audiences with an exciting, original programme of educational projects, events and live performances, and to support musicians playing Jewish music across the UK enabling them to preserve this traditional heritage, create new work and reach the widest audiences.
story_txt:
About
 
The JMI Youth Big Band presents Jewish music as you’ve never heard it before. This is the next generation of musical superstars, breaking ground and redefining music of Jewish origin. 
“A radical revelation! They play with an assurance, fluency and confidence rarely seen from such youthful ensembles.” – Max Reinhardt, BBC Radio 3
 
At the Jewish Music Institute we’re passionate about music and passionate about the development of our flagship youth project - the JMI Youth Big Band.
The band - made up of 12 - 18 year olds who play drums, bass, guitar, piano, tuba, saxophone, trumpet and trombone - was created in Summer 2017 to bring a contemporary edge to music of Jewish origin and enable talented young musicians from a wide variety of different backgrounds to explore a rich musical and cultural heritage whilst performing at the highest level. 
Tzadik label artist, composer, trumpeter and band leader Sam Eastmond (Spike Orchestra, Gulgoleth) has expertly honed the ensemble to a remarkable degree in the short time since its formation. The debut album - featuring an array of expert musicians from the jazz and cutting edge new music scene including; Jon Madof (guitar), Moss Freed (guitar), Josephine Davies (saxophone), Mike Wilkins (saxophone) and Andy Watts (Trumpet) - is a true testament to Sam's talent as an arranger, collaborator, educator and inspirational figurehead. 
We are all eager to document the band's momentous journey but we need your help to realise this project.
Recording an album is an expensive business, rehearsing, recording and preparing a band this size is a labour of love for us but we can’t pay the studio fees with love alone. The money raised in this campaign will turn our ambitious plans into a reality.
 
Why now?
In the two years since it first formed, the band has gone from strength to strength. They have performed to crowds of more than 5000 people (Klezmer in the Park), recorded and released their debut single "Stronger Together" for charity in December 2018, and are currently being requested for gigs at prestigious venues all over London and throughout the rest of the UK.
We feel the band are ready to take the next steps to becoming a fully established and recognised ensemble with the release of their first studio album. None of the members had ever had any experience of recording before they joined the band, and only a small number had any experience of performing in a large ensemble in front of huge crowds. We strongly believe that this is an incredible opportunity for young talented musicians to make their first steps in the world of professional music making, and we want to push them to reach their full potential in every way we possibly can. 
 

How you can help 
By signing up to a perk, from pre-ordering a copy of the album to having the whole band come and play in your sitting room (!) you can enable us to fund production (mixing, mastering) studio hire, album art work and printing costs.


We need £2500 to finish mixing and mastering the music, pay for the art work, manufacturing of CDs, digital release and track licensing. The additional £1,500 will go towards PR for the album release as well as covering the cost of the album launch performance fees. 
If we raise more than the goal, we will put the money towards touring the album around the country in order to push the project further. All donations will be greatly appreciated. 
You do not need to claim a perk to make a contribution
...and you can always contribute a higher amount than the perk level you wish to claim

 
 
Our thanks
We are so grateful for your support to help us mix and release the debut album.  Any way you feel that you can get involved is massively appreciated – pre-ordering the album or even sharing this campaign with friends and family on social media is a huge help!

Thank you,
The JMI team
 
More about the Jewish Music Institute 
The JMI is unique in the world of Jewish Music. We are dedicated to the celebration, preservation and development of the living heritage of Jewish music for the benefit of people of all ages, faiths backgrounds and cultures.
Our goal is to inform and inspire students and audiences with an exciting, original programme of educational projects, events and live performances, and to support musicians playing Jewish music across the UK enabling them to preserve this traditional heritage, create new work and reach the widest audiences.

story:
Aiutaci a realizzare il nuovo singolo LIBERA

Come?

Contribuire è semplice!

Puoi fare un'offerta libera aiutandoci nella raccolta fondi a copertura spese, o attenderti ad una delle ricompense a quota obbligatoria, che ti permetterà di ricevere qualcosa in cambio della tua generosità!

oppure, condividi sui tuoi profili social la nostra campagna affinchè raggiunga quanta più gente possibile!

In ogni caso, grazie per aver speso del tempo per noi!

story:
STORY
Hi I´m Christopher, a Swedish independent composer/artist/producer with the mission to bring peace to the stressed & heavy hearted. I have been writing music for the last 10 years and I have now found my calling. Instrumental music. I have a bachelor's degree in Songwriting & Musicproduction and many years of experience composing and performing.

There are so many opportunities being an independent composer/artist/producer today. At the moment I compose, record, arrange, mix & master everything by myself. The difference between me and a major label is that I don´t have funds to get me started. That's why I need you <3

 

PROJECT
SO! I´m on a mission to bring peace to the heavy-hearted! My prayer is that my music will pierce hearts and make them a little bit softer than they were before. 

It´s quite simple. I wanna be able to reach as many people as possible, so I´m raising funds to be able to MARKET my instrumental peaceful music. In 2020 I released 30 songs (here is my portfolio HERE) and those are all added to my different instrumental playlists. My focus is now to market these playlists and to release more music during 2021.

Marketing will take place with ads on social media and influencer marketing on Instagram. Your funds will help me reach more people and at the same time you´ll support many other composers that I've added to my playlists. 

Your support will make it possible for me to release more peaceful music during 2021!

If you´d like to listen to my music, here is a list of the songs I released 2020.
HERE

CHALLENGES
I really need your support to be able to reach as many people as possible and to be able to release more music this year. I can not say exactly how many people will respond and listen to the playlists. My goal is to have 50K people listening to my playlists twice a month.

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Short Summary

ABOUT ME...

 Hello Sound Traveler my name is  Jay Rodriguez  born Hernan Ramiro Rodriguez-Sierra in Colombia, South America.

My family brought me to NYC/Tristate area at the age of 3.   NYC is my home.

 I have had the distinct pleasure and honor of creating  music and to have  performed all over the world. My first professional jobs began in  8th grade in Latin scene. By the time I was 18 I had worked with Latin Legends like Celia Cruz and Ray Barretto . I went on to work with artists like Prince , Elvis Costello , The Mingus Big Band, Guru among many others.

 Suffice to say music marked every aspect of my life in the most beautiful unique way.  Where other's  memories were visual mine were auditory.  Pitches and rhythms had tangible colors and shapes in my minds eye.

 I performed with some of the most amazing artists known and unknown from almost all genres. My first musical  experiences were in the Latin music scene. Nonetheless I was exposed to  Bird , John Coltrane, Cannonball Adderley to name a few  by the age of 10. I fell on love with all music. The father of the great Jazz Legend Paquito D Rivera took me under his wing. I went on to study with the great Joe Allard, and Phil Woods among many.

For a time, I believed that music was the only thing that mattered. As time passed, I came to the realization  that the opposite was true. It was the beginning of a deeper understanding and mission as an artist. It was life that gave birth and dispersed  it's light and casted shadows onto the tapestry of the song and sounds that live within  and around us all.

Although it may seem to some, that  I have waited a longtime to release a solo recording as a leader, it is not entirely accurate. I actually have played quite a lot  as a leader and composer. This is the first time that I am attempting to do it correctly with an awareness and experience.  I did not possess this  before. It has been an interesting  journey for me as an artist to have a level of self acceptance as i evolved as an artist.

       Reasons for needing your support.....

The record has had the highest chart debut on record in the nation in a long time. It hit 22 on its second week. The New York Times  music critics  Nate Chinen and Giovanni Russonello have given it their  blessings .  Renowned jazz journalist Howard Mandel blessed me with  the liner notes.

 I have taken it as far as I can with the help of some really amazing people and friends in this field and others that have shown me how much they really wanted to hear my first solo recording as a leader. Their compassion towards me and my vision/sound have left me besides myself.

​ I am moved deeply in my heart by the great generosity  of my peers ,colleagues and fans.

This is for all of you.

They know all too well that the recording may fall by the way side without ever reaching its full potential without your support.. 

 This campaign's funds  will be used  for PR ,marketing, promotional materials, radio promotion, mailings and tour support .

I have a lot of great perks to share ,amazing  beautiful signed posters signed by myself and the artist , I can record on your latest track or perform a solo concert distance allowing,  I can send you special remixes  and unedited versions of the music on the record. I can give you  flute ,saxophone ,theory and or composition lessons.  check the perks .

 I  have varying levels  from  $5.00 to  $1000.00

 I need your help and contributions to spread my music and message. It will be close to impossible to do it without you. The music  industry has changed drastically for many reasons and other  inevitable factors. It has its pros and cons, but doesn't everything?

With the music industry of today ,I  now have to  do all the things that a record company would have done  such as  pay for  radio and publication promotion and ads, marketing ,management and basic touring costs. I never had to do this in the past. I never imagined that I would have had  to ask  people to be patrons of the arts.Which you will surely be if you donate and or spread the word about my campaign .

My Evolution as an Artist......

 I personally have been an optimist all my life.  As long as I create and work at being a part of the solution I so desperately seek in everyday life , the music and the world around me will take care of me and my family.This has been my experience. I have had a bit of that which I am eternally grateful for.

That is more then enough.This awareness has given me so much to live and strive for.Without the right support  emotionally and spiritually, I would not have been  able to accomplish anything as a human being or an artist.

I often wondered to myself , where do I belong as a composer, musician and a channel of this wonderful gift of music  ? With all the pain , injustices and disparities in this big blue world of ours , what is my purpose? Why should this matter so much to anyone ?

   I had arrived to a place inside myself where playing music was not be enough. What use was it to play,compose and perform ? What I did seemed empty and shallow in the midst of our human sufferings and struggles.  I could no longer accept music for music's sake.  I could not bare to play or feel knowing that my brothers and sisters all over this world would be suffering.There had to be more to what I did as an artist besides trying to inspire change. I wanted and needed to be the change not just to inspire it. I began working and doing volunteer work  in between my performances and musical obligations with foster kids of all ages with young men and women coming in and out of incarceration and other adversities.  I have done this now for a little over 20 years . It has been a part of my life . It was not ever planned. I just did what was in front of me.

The music of life was at hand ! It was bigger then I could have ever fathomed. It was always a part of me as it was a part of the world around me . In conclusion I came to the realization that I was not teaching others anything that they already did not  know.

 It was my job to shine a light on those things that made us human. It was a lesson of  awareness , consciousness , compassion and blind faith in the process of the universe.

The deeper my ability to tell my story through my art the closer the relationship to the music of life was achieved . My purpose became clear.

 

About this Recording...

This record has been a cathartic experience. Never did I realize how important it was to do what I did as a saxophonist,flautist and composer.

This record is dedicated to all  of humanity . Your Sound is the music that lives within all of us. That thing within us that makes us ponder on the hues of the sky at dawn upon awakening  or at dusk that say i am going to tell and show you that this world and its life all encompassing is worth living for ,no matter how hard  it may seem to be .  It is about us dreamers and conjurers of beauty ,empathy and hope in action.

I was told once that there was a time when you could hear the murmur of the stars.

" Your Sound " is about that murmur. After all when we look up at stars don't we realize that we are of them and they are of us. Life is breathtaking and music is one beautiful way to make a difference.

I believe now that the sound of the humanity is the thing that flows through me , you and all things. 

Being a soloist and composer  is a sacred beautiful thing.

I have  studied life through music and music through life. I have become a respected artist in my field. It has never been easy. The music matured as I matured, at least this was my case.I had my ups and downs like all human beings. I have a feeling that is what makes life a sound. After all musicians are people too. 

Music is the noblest of professions. I found this to be part of my message on this record. Although I have played an integral part of many great artist's music, I had never really done a real solo recording as leader in the jazz idiom. I have played many  solos on many records and performances . It has been a privilege and always will be. This  recording is my statement and story to you.

I was a cofounder of a great  band from NYC called  Groove Collective. They heralded in the fusion of jazz, hip hop and other urban genres .  I feel that I have played an important part in the aesthetics of the music scene in NYC.

​This live recording at Dizzy's Club Coca Cola  featured some of the world's jazz masters . It was an honor to have some of my friends and colleagues on this journey. The artist are   Billy Martin on percussion known as part of the groundbreaking trio Medeski, Martin and Wood , then there is Jazz legend tenor saxophonist Billy Harper as my tandem reed player known for his work with the great Lee Morgan among others, followed by none other master pianist Larry Willis known for his work with everyone from Roy Hargrove to Blood Sweat Tears then there is  the young lion Eric Wheeler on Bass known for his work  DD Bridgewater and Trumpet star Theo Croker .and to finish the line up as if that were not enough ,we have the dynamic Jt Lewis on drums known for his work with Herbie Hancock to  Vanessa Williams among others.

This is quite  a recording and band.

 I really wanted to let everyone tell their story . It was a tough feat given time restrictions of  making a live record.I wanted to make a live recording that spoke to all people  past , present and future.

It had to have  peaks and valleys. I wanted it to reflect our times sad and joyous. I did not want my music to be about music . I wanted  the recording and statement to be about life .I think we achieved something very close.  This may be perhaps  why some radio stations around the nation have received it so enthusiastically.

The record has had the highest chart debut on record in the nation in a long time. It hit 22 on its second week. The New York Times  music critics  Nate Chinen and Giovanni Russonello have given it their  blessings .  Renowned jazz journalist Howard Mandel blessed me with  the liner notes.

 I have taken it as far as I can with the help of some really amazing people and friends in this field and others that have shown me how much they really wanted to hear my first solo debut as a leader. Their compassion towards me and my vision/sound has left me besides myself.

​ I am moved deeply in my heart by the great generosity  of my peers and colleagues. I am doing this for them and all of you.

They know all too well that the recording may fall by the way side and perhaps forgotten without ever reaching its full potential without your support . Or maybe not, Hey I am an optimist right ?!

 This campaign's funds  will be used  for PR ,marketing, promotional materials, radio promotion, mailings and tour support .

I have a lot of great perks to share ,amazing  beautiful signed posters signed by myself and the artist , I  can record on your latest track or perform a solo concert distance allowing,  I can send you special remixes  and unedited versions of the music on the record. I can give you  flute ,saxophone ,theory and or composition lessons.  check the perks...!  

I  want to thank you from the deepest part of my heart for  reading  all this.

 Hey my people help me make some noise and  get the word out  about my campaign.

Don't forget to use the  indiegogo share tools ! 

If you can't donate just spread the word ,If this campaign just made you smile then I have done my job.

  I wish you Your Sound and your awareness of it..

sincerely , Jay Rodriguez

 

Quotes about my playing and recording thus far.

“Whatever compelled Rodriguez to avoid putting his name out front for all these years, he stands proud here.” – NATE CHINEN, WBGO’s TAKE 5 PICK OF THE WEEK  - 2018

“Mr. Rodriguez moves between idioms and energies as easily as he switches instruments.” – GIOVANNI RUSSONELLO, THE NEW YORK TIMES Critic’s Pick- 2018

“ He could be breathy and insinuating on a ballad and brawny and extroverted in an uptempo- Jon Pareles - The New York Times

"Mr. Rodriguez is more than a musician. He is a visionary. 

- Arnie Lawrence (artist, saxophonist and founder of the New School of Jazz and Contemporary Music.) -

Some of Jay Rodriguez's achievements were recently recorded in Leonard Feather-Ira Gitler's The Biographical Encyclopedia of Jazz.

I have played many  solos on many records and performances . It has been a privilege and always will be. This  recording is my statement and story to you.
I was a cofounder of a great  band from NYC called  Groove Collective. They heralded in the fusion of jazz, hip hop and other urban genres .  I feel that I have played an important part in the aesthetics of the music scene in NYC.
​This live recording at Dizzy's Club Coca Cola  featured some of the world's jazz masters . It was an honor to have some of my friends and colleagues on this journey. The artist are   Billy Martin on percussion known as part of the groundbreaking trio Medeski, Martin and Wood , then there is Jazz legend tenor saxophonist Billy Harper as my tandem reed player known for his work with the great Lee Morgan among others, followed by none other master pianist Larry Willis known for his work with everyone from Roy Hargrove to Blood Sweat Tears then there is  the young lion Eric Wheeler on Bass known for his work  DD Bridgewater and Trumpet star Theo Croker .and to finish the line up as if that were not enough ,we have the dynamic Jt Lewis on drums known for his work with Herbie Hancock to  Vanessa Williams among others.
This is quite  a recording and band.
 I really wanted to let everyone tell their story . It was a tough feat given time restrictions of  making a live record.I wanted to make a live recording that spoke to all people  past , present and future. 
It had to have  peaks and valleys. I wanted it to reflect our times sad and joyous. I did not want my music to be about music . I wanted  the recording and statement to be about life .I think we achieved something very close.  This may be perhaps  why some radio stations around the nation have received it so enthusiastically.
The record has had the highest chart debut on record in the nation in a long time. It hit 22 on its second week. The New York Times  music critics  Nate Chinen and Giovanni Russonello have given it their  blessings .  Renowned jazz journalist Howard Mandel blessed me with  the liner notes. 
 I have taken it as far as I can with the help of some really amazing people and friends in this field and others that have shown me how much they really wanted to hear my first solo debut as a leader. Their compassion towards me and my vision/sound has left me besides myself.
​ I am moved deeply in my heart by the great generosity  of my peers and colleagues. I am doing this for them and all of you.
They know all too well that the recording may fall by the way side and perhaps forgotten without ever reaching its full potential without your support . Or maybe not, Hey I am an optimist right ?!
 This campaign's funds  will be used  for PR ,marketing, promotional materials, radio promotion, mailings and tour support .
I have a lot of great perks to share ,amazing  beautiful signed posters signed by myself and the artist , I  can record on your latest track or perform a solo concert distance allowing,  I can send you special remixes  and unedited versions of the music on the record. I can give you  flute ,saxophone ,theory and or composition lessons.  check the perks...!  
I  want to thank you from the deepest part of my heart for  reading  all this.
 Hey my people help me make some noise and  get the word out  about my campaign.
Don't forget to use the  indiegogo share tools ! 
If you can't donate just spread the word ,If this campaign just made you smile then I have done my job.
  I wish you Your Sound and your awareness of it..
sincerely , Jay Rodriguez
 
Quotes about my playing and recording thus far.
“Whatever compelled Rodriguez to avoid putting his name out front for all these years, he stands proud here.” – NATE CHINEN, WBGO’s TAKE 5 PICK OF THE WEEK  - 2018
“Mr. Rodriguez moves between idioms and energies as easily as he switches instruments.” – GIOVANNI RUSSONELLO, THE NEW YORK TIMES Critic’s Pick- 2018
“ He could be breathy and insinuating on a ballad and brawny and extroverted in an uptempo- Jon Pareles - The New York Times
"Mr. Rodriguez is more than a musician. He is a visionary. 
- Arnie Lawrence (artist, saxophonist and founder of the New School of Jazz and Contemporary Music.) -
Some of Jay Rodriguez's achievements were recently recorded in Leonard Feather-Ira Gitler's The Biographical Encyclopedia of Jazz.

story:
Hi All!

Namorados Da Lua here. After 5 years of bringing live Brazilian music to the Bay Area, we are heading to the studio to record and spread our music to a wider audience.

Originally from Bahia, Brazil, we now have members from all over the world - USA, England and the Ivory Coast. We play Afro-Brazilian music to get you dancing, and want to capture that energy in our first album!

We are raising $5000 to help cover the costs of:

  • 7 days studio time - covering engineering/producer costs to record, mix and master the album
  • Graphic design for the album artwork
  • Physical production of the album

It would mean the world to us if you be willing to help make this happen. Any support you can give is appreciated, either with financial donations and/or social media promotion. Without the funds we can't get it done. 

In return, we have different gifts depending on the size of the donation including:

  • Professional quality MP3 downloads
  • Autographed CDs
  • T-Shirts
  • Thank you credit in the liner notes
  • A full band house gig anywhere in the San Francisco Bay Area

Anything you can do to help us share our music is hugely appreciated - Obrigado!

story:
Meet LightHouse

LightHouse consists of Katya Richardson and Logan Nelson, two Los Angeles based classically trained composers. Katya has been composing since she was eight years old. She has an extensive resume including commissioned works for the LA Philharmonic and The Royal Ballet in London. Since the age of five, Logan has studied piano and soon began composing music. He has been internationally recognized as an ASCAP Morton Gould Finalist and National YoungArts Winner. Both Katya and Logan have scored numerous short films and commercial works. The two are branching out and are now exploring all realms of being an artist.

The duo started LightHouse to put a unique spin on modern, electronic pop by combining both cinematic acoustic sounds and synth-based textures. Their first single, “Ships,” was released on March 02 and generated buzz from notable blogs such as Electronic North and Popmuzik. Their second single, “Lost & Found,” was a collaboration with neo-soul singer, songwriter Moira Mack who just recently worked with Wyclef Jean. 

LightHouse will be releasing a highly anticipated third single in May. The duo’s artistic ventures see them continuing to push boundaries and combining the two worlds of cinematic music and pop.

 

Our Debut EP 

We need your help funding our debut EP! The EP will consist of 6 tracks that include extensive collaboration with other musicians and instrumentalists. We will begin writing and recording our EP in mid-May and continue the whole month of June. The record will be mixed/mastered in July, and the projected release date for the EP will be early or mid-August. The EP will be available worldwide on all streaming services and digital stores, such as Spotify, Apple Music, iTunes, etc. If you donate, you can unlock exclusive perks such as early release and free digital download, as well as a free music lesson with us or a custom beat made just for you by LightHouse!

 

How the Funds Will Be Used

Since we produce and write our own music, our recording costs are dramatically reduced. The funds raised through this Indiegogo campaign will go primarily towards mixing the EP. Hiring an audio engineer to mix and master sound recordings is an incredibly expensive and necessary part of releasing music. Mixing and mastering involve the technical aspects of sound recordings such as adjusting and combining the individual tracks to form a unified and polished stereo file. We will be working with 2x Grammy and 1x Oscar-nominated mixer, Brian Bender, who we have a very close relationship with. Brian has mixed both of our two previous singles.

We also need funds to help pay for session musicians and instrumentalists, as well as minimal graphic design and marketing expenses. Here is a breakdown of our costs:

 

 

Perks

You get to support indie musicians and be a part of a great record! And, we would like to reward you for your generosity.

Fan - $10

As one of our “Fans,” we add you to our email list and keep you updated with all of our progress and behind the scenes footage.

DJ - $25

As a “DJ,” you will get early access to our new EP as a digital download. You will be sent an email link with the record. 

Artist - $50

As an “Artist,” you will be receiving a digital download of our EP before it is released to anyone else. You will be sent an email link with the record, along with special unreleased bonus content.

Manager - $75

As a “Manager,” you get all the “Artist” perks and we will also be providing you or your business with a shout out on our Facebook or Instagram pages. You will also be credited in our future music video. 

Music Video Director - $100

As a “Music Video Director,” you will get all the “Artist” and “Manager” perks and can also be on set with us when we shoot our music video this fall. Come hang out with us and be an extra in the film! We will also send you a handwritten thank you letter.

Executive - $200

As an “Executive,” you get all the “Artist” and “Manager” perks and will also receive a personalized musical sketch on staff paper that is signed by both of the members of LightHouse. We will frame this sketch and send it to you. This is an exclusive perk and is only offered in this category. We will also send you a handwritten thank you letter.

Music Producer - $300

As a “Music Producer,” you will get all “Artist,” “Manager,” and “Music Video Director” perks as well as a custom beat created exclusively for you by LightHouse. We can include your name, make a ringtone for you, or whatever vibes you’re feeling. This is an exclusive perk and is only offered in this category. We will also send you a handwritten thank you letter.

Music Guru - $400

As a “Music Guru,” you will be able to schedule a 1-hour long music lesson with LightHouse. We are happy to look over your music, show you our workflow, give you a studio tour, or just chat. These can also be provided over Skype if you do not live in Los Angeles. This is an exclusive perk and is only offered in this category. We will also send you a handwritten thank you letter.

Beyoncé - $500

As “Beyoncé,” you get all the perks of “Artist,” “Manager,” “Music Video Director,” and you can join us for a recording or mix session on one of our tracks. We will be recording in May and June, and we’d love to have you. We can also Skype you into the session if you do not live in Los Angeles. We will also send you a handwritten thank you letter. Thank you so much for donating this much!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you do not have the means to make a donation, you can still help us by sharing the campaigning with your friends! Email them this link or use the share tools on the top of this page. Share on your socials and use the hashtag #LightHouse

 

Click the Icon & Follow Us!

            

 

Press

story:
Hello Everyone,

SuperMorgan here, I just wanted to take a moment to thank everyone who has been a part of this crazy roller-coaster ride I've been on for the past twelve years. I always say, "I can't do it without YOU," and I mean it. The people that attend and take part in F*Bomb have given me the energy to keep producing this event month in and month out for over 140 shows. It is exhausting but rewarding, and it is one of the most-important things I have ever done in my life. I want to thank all of my business partners, co-producers, musicians, burlesque performers, go-go dancers, deejays, club staff, graphics designers, friends, family members, and especially the audiences who come to F*Bomb and give us the support and loyalty we feed off of to keep the engine running.

In the past year my business partners (Mike SOS, Rob Castoria, Craigman, King Morgan, and Tommy Von Voigt) and I have made a concerted effort to raise our public profile so we may continue to bring you the particular brand of live music that F*Bomb has become known for going forward for many years to come. We have big dreams, and big ideas, and sometimes these projects require the one thing we don't have and that is, sadly, financing.

That brings me to this point asking those of you that can afford to contribute to open up your hearts and your wallets and help us complete the documentary we have been working on since we moved to Arlene's Grocery in June, 2014.

The documentary film details the history of F*Bomb, from its earliest days as a dj party at The Delancey, chronicling our nine years of triumphs and failures at that venue, through our time at Arlene's Grocery, and will culminate at our show at the Gramercy Theatre on Saturday, September 8th, 2018. There are tons of amazing interviews, lots of footage from live performances, as well as historical information about the changing landscape of the East Village rock scene.

As you may well imagine, producing these shows, keeping the admission fees affordable, and making a documentary are not free endeavors, and for six working-class guys to fund these events every month, well, let's just say, it takes a financial toll. Sometimes we make a few bucks that we reinvest in the show, sometimes we break even, and sometimes we get taken to the cleaners! Nevertheless we all feel passionately that these challenges are worth it. The feeling of fulfillment and the joy we experience every time we put on an F*Bomb is something we all love. Please help us to keep going…….

If you can make a contribution it will be greatly appreciated and every little bit does help towards reaching our goal. We are offering a tiered system to reward you for your contribution depending upon the amount of the contribution. Don’t forget to include your name with your donation if you wish to take advantage of these exciting perks!

Even if you are not in a position to help us out now, we invite you to attend one of our upcoming shows this summer. 

Thank you sincerely to everyone out there that took the time to read this, and especially to those who have generously decided to part with some of their hard-earned dough.

With the deepest of gratitude,
Morgan, Mike SOS, Craigman, Big Rob, King Morgan and Tommy Von Voigt

Here are the tiered rewards:

$25 donation - 1 ticket to F*Bomb: Decades at the Gramercy Theater, September 8th, 2018

$50 donation - 1 ticket to F*Bomb: Decades at the Gramercy Theater, September 8th, 2018 and one ticket to The F*Boat Party, July 13th, 2018

$75 donation - 1 ticket to F*Bomb: Decades at the Gramercy Theater, September 8th 2018, one ticket to the F*Boat Party, July 13th, 2018, and one official F*Bomb t-shirt

$100 donation - Pass good for one year (12 shows) of F*Bombs

$125 donation - Pass good for one year (12 shows) of F*Bombs, and one official F*Bomb t-shirt

$150 donation - 1 ticket to F*Bomb: Decades at the Gramercy Theater, September 8th 2018, pass good for one year (12 shows) of F*Bombs, and one official F*Bomb t-shirt

$200 donation - Free graphic design work on a flyer or poster of your choosing by F*Bomb producer King Morgan

$250 donation - Free photo shoot with Maria Vullo, producer of the F*Bomb documentary

$500 donation - You pick the theme of an F*Bomb, and the producers will put on that show for you

$1000 donation - A lifetime pass to any and all F*Bomb productions

$1500 donation - Two lifetime passes to any and all F*Bomb productions

Any merchandise offered will be presented at the Gramercy Theatre show or by arrangement.

Thanks again to EVERYONE!  This truly means the world to me.  We couldn't do it without YOU!!!

story:
It's been a long and winding road leading up to the release of my debut album, "Pyramids & Street Corners". Although I've been playing and performing music since I was a kid, this is the first time I've recorded an album of only my songs. It covers a wide range of personal experiences as well as a variety of musical styles including ragtime, Texas country, rock n roll, and gospel.

 

I'm almost there! I just need a little push to get over the finish line...

I already recorded the tracks for the album thanks to M.P. at 4th Corner Studio in Hayfork, CA (check out his band Merit Parcel's new record "Out for Delivery"). Thanks also to the wonderful musicians who volunteered their talent and time to make this project happen
Drums - Eric Fiscus
Bass - Timmy Puke
Harmonica - Miner
Violin and backup vocals - Danielle Aslanian
Electric Guitar - Asshat
and the Hayseed Harmonaires

that said, I need to raise some money to get the tracks mastered and the physical CDs printed. I'm sure the engineer would like to get paid at some point too. If I raise more than enough to print the albums, I would love to also do a run of double-LP vinyl for your heads.

Any donation amount is welcome, and every cent is much appreciated. I want to give you some exclusives for helping me out:

20$ - A copy of the CD when it comes out and 1 of 12 unreleased poems on cover-art stationary
50$ - The above, plus a T-shirt
100$ - The above, plus a collectible cassette of unreleased jams (or vinyl record, if possible) 
500$ - The above, plus a producer credit on the album
4,200$ - The above, plus a private concert held at the location of your choosing with full band (subject to local laws, codes, and ordinances)

Even if the total goal is not reached, rest assured that your donation will still be used to produce this record.

 

Why I need your help

While this has been a do-it-yourself kind of project from the beginning, for many of us it's hard to save enough from our jobs to throw down the required cash to get a batch of CDs printed in a timely manner. I can't take food off the family table for my passion project so I give it up to you, and the universe, to help bring these songs into the world.

Luckily, there's not a lot standing in our way, as these songs are crafted, recorded and ready to go. Your help in making them go will be treasured by many, but mostly by me. Thank you very much for considering my project worthy.

 
Other ways to help
If you would like to share my campaign on social media that would also be very helpful. I'm kind of a social media rookie but there are Share buttons all over this website so I'm sure you know what you're doing better than I can tell you. Thanks again, if you got all the way down here, I laud your thoroughness and commitment to finishing things you start. We can all take a lesson from you.
