I'm kind of a social media rookie but there are Share buttons all over this website so I'm sure you know what you're doing better than I can tell you. Thanks again, if you got all the way down here, I laud your thoroughness and commitment to finishing things you start. We can all take a lesson from you.

story:
Who We Are

Akoobooks Audio is a leading publisher and digital distributor of African audiobooks. We want to transform books in Africa and get them to as many readers as possible on mobile devices.

We are a dedicated group of passionate African book lovers and creative professionals with over 25 years combined experience in the publishing, technology, entertainment and acting industries, pulling our skills together to make African voices heard in new and powerful ways. Our first audiobook, 'Kenkey for Ewes' & Other Very Short Stories, is a collection of 50 contemporary Ghanaian stories that are considered to be some of the best published works on the Flash Fiction Ghana Blog. 'Kenkey for Ewes' is based around themes of modern African identity, love and respect for the dead, cruelty and greed and the enigmatic influence of fate and fortune.

The 'Suma Went Walking' Audiobook

'Suma Went Walking' was written by my mother Nana Dadson and published by Afram Publications in 2002. She went blind ten years ago and is the reason I set up AkooBooks Audio-marrying my passion for books and technology, providing print disabled persons anywhere with access to more African writers and stimulating a 'digital reading' culture among African young people.

The story was written in English and has been translated into 8 languages. It tells the story of a girl Suma who takes a walk and meets animals who compare themselves to her. She gets tired of all the different things she is and eventually goes home where she is always little Suma. The story is written in English and has been translated to 4 different African languages and in French.

The idea of a pan-African symphonic story was inspired by Prokiev's 'Peter and the Wolf' which I love. I wanted to make a composition that would bring the magic and excitement of African musical instruments to children and provide an exciting new way to engage them with the performance of African music in schools. The duration is  approximately 30 minutes.

We have a stellar ensemble of Ghanaian musicians: 

Suma is represented by an ensemble of flutes (Atentenben and Odurogyra)  played by Dela Botri
The Elephant is the Fontomfrom Drum played by Dela Botri
The Bird is the Atentenben Flute played by Dela Botri
The Snake is the Odurogya Flute and Shekere played by Dela Botri and Worlali Konu
The Giraffe is the Prempensua & Gome Drum played by Dela Botri and Worlali Konu
The Mouse is the Seperewa played by Baffuor Awuah Kyeremanten
The Hedgehog is the Kalimba ('Thumb Piano') played by Worlali Konu

The Pig is the Talking Drum played by Dela Botri
The Tortoise is the Gonje played by the German violinist Thomas "Kwame" Woernle

Click  to listen to Suma's theme music!

But, I don't know any of these instruments! What's the difference between an Antenben and a Odurogya Flute you may ask? You can click on the links above to read more information, or watch a great 'how to' or demo video on each instrument.

If you are able to contribute to our audiobook, everyone on the team sincerely thanks you – you are helping bring our vision of digital transformation to the African publishing industry to fruition and also to enhance the performance of African musical instruments in schools worldwide!

The Impact

Many African writers and  publishers have expressed their frustration with getting their books to readers due to expensive production costs. limited print runs and the lack of channels for distribution. Digital distribution provides new channels and opportunities for accessing new readers.

A growing group of passionate African parents and educators all over the world  are asking important questions and demanding more African music and culture be reflected in our school curriculum.  We want to bring the best performing artistes to our local schools and 
and provide children with direct access to outstanding African performers in workshops,
classes, participatory and related community events.

The performances of Suma Went Walking will help enrich the knowledge of our own indigenous African musical instruments and educate the next generation of young African musicians and music lovers. We provide support to African musicians by supplying instruments to schools and bring communities together who enjoy African arts and music.

You can help by being a part of that change!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $30,000 to make this dream a reality.  We have funded the pre-production and composition work for Suma Went Walking, but we need your help to get the audiobook through recording, mastering, post production and out to children in the world through our Workshops.

Any money raised in this campaign will go to the post production costs of Suma Went Walking and related activities to promoting the audiobook and getting it into the classroom, specifically:

  • Music and Sound Mix - We have the incredibly talented Ghanaian composer and 'flute magician' Yaw Dela Botri (https://www.facebook.com/yaw.botri) on board to compose the music for the 'Suma Went Walking audiobook' together with collaborating composer & music therapist Mawyurami Ocloo. We need to fund the recording, mix and production of the score they created and played with 7 other master musicians/performers listed above.
  • Narration, Studio Recording & Post Production. The money we raise will go to paying for the studio recording and post production. This will also pay our amazing multi cast Narrators  who will narrate in three languages including master story tellers: Amowi Philips, Mmofra Foundation  and singer Veronica Bain-Derby (English), film actor Adjetey Annang  and singer Alexia Quartey (Ga) and  spoken word artistes Nana Asase and Akua Safo (Twi) and of course our fabulous children.   We also plan to produce the book in as many African languages and other languages as we can too.
  • Suma Went Walking Enhanced Book and Music score (Limited Edition). This Enhanced book with the complete music score for Suma Went Walking will give background information and activities which directly engage children with Suma Went Walking and meet the learning objectives for English and Music curriculum at Key Stages I & II.  Children will learn to identify instruments and instrument families of the pan-African ensemble and about musical parameters - pitch, rhythm, dynamics, tempo, timbre, texture and structure of African music.  This  limited edition copy (100 copies  only) will be signed by the author Nana Dadson, the  main composer flute magician Dela Botri, collaborating composers Mawu Ocloo, Kweku Aacht, Thomas Woernle & the original musicians. (100 copies only)
  • Suma Went Walking Workshops/Live Performance (3 Inaugural).  The aim of these workshops is to bring different schools, parents and families to plan three inaugural  performances of Suma Went Walking (in English, Twi and Ga languages) in collaboration with the Pan African Youth Orchestra.   The workshops will give children from three lucky schools, the opportunity to sing, play, explore perform music from by Suma Went Walking with the original composers/musicians, culminating in three live performances to be held at the National Theatre, Accra in November-December 2018.
  • The Making of Suma Went Walking Documentary Film – Shooting the making of the audiobook and the performance with interviews with key musicians on the various roles played by each instrument and tips for playing each theme.  We need to take the documentary into post production, the money raised will help cover editing costs, so that our film can be used as a powerful teaching tool to supplement the book.
  • Translation of Suma Went Walking into other languages. Help support the African publishing industry and sponsor the translation and printing of Suma Went Walking into other African and European languages,

These elements are very important in making Suma Went Walking. Any support from backers is hugely appreciated.

By contributing to this campaign, you will  be part of something extraordinary, We have some fantastic perks available for varying levels of contributions, from your AkooBooks Audio Membership and your name listed as a donor in the inaugural Live performance of Suma Went Walking to funding a full pan-African ensemble for schools in Ghana. Other 'Perks' include: 

  • A full digital download of 'Suma Went Walking' audiobook
  • A Special Thanks on social media and your name listed on our website and on our program as a donor for one of three Inaugural Live Performance
  • A signed photo of the performers and musicians of the inaugural Live performance
  • Be our Special Guest and enjoy behind-the-scenes experience of the recording process for the inaugural Live Performance
  • A special 'Suma Went Walking hoodie or jersey from Wear Ghana
  • A signed Limited Edition of the Enhanced Suma Went Walking print book with all the music score
  • VIP tickets to the first inaugural Live Perfomance of Suma Went Walking
  • Purchase lovely handmade African instruments featured in the music production
  • AkooBooks will come to your school and teach a Workshop on the Suma Went Walking audiobook and the African musical instruments
  • Request for a translation and recording of Suma Went Walking in your language
  • Be an Executive or Associate Producer and purchase a full pan-African ensemble of musical instruments to be delivered to three lucky schools in Ghana
     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We appreciate that not everyone can support financially, but there are other ways you can help!

    If you like what you’ve seen, and want to help out you can share this fundraising page on social media. Help us shout about Suma Went Walking and spread the word to friends and potential backers.

    You can find AkooBooks Audio on these social media platforms! Check out our links to find us and follow our progress.

    • Akoobooks Audio on FaceBook
    • On Twitter @akoobooks  
    • On Instagram @Akoobooks
    • On the Suma Went Walking page on our website www.akoobooks.com

    Every share helps us out – so please use the convenient Indiegogo share tools, and help spread the word!

story:
Quick Note from WorshipMob's Director

Hey WorshipMob fam!
My name is Sean Mulholland - I'm the founder and director of WorshipMob - thank you so much for worshiping with us!  We've produced over 250 worship videos for you over the last 7 years, with about 30 million views, globally.  Our heart has always been to give you FREE Holy Spirit inspired intimate worship videos, so you'd feel the passionate love of Father God, Jesus & Holy Spirit, as if you were right here worshiping along with us.
But we need YOUR help to continue!  

 

WorshipMob YouTube Channel Overview



A YouTube Testimony:


YouTube doesn't pay the bills... 

Many people assume we're covering our costs through YouTube income, but we only make about $15-20 per day off of YouTube, whereas the audio/video production costs to our ministry are about $1500 per song, and $5000-$7000 per extended multi-song video.  Each song we've produced costs more than 4 times as much to produce as we ever receive back from YouTube & all digital sales revenue. The picture below is a screenshot of a single months income from YouTube.

Daily YouTube Revenue:

A YouTube Testimony:


We're a non-profit ministry...

We're not doing this for financial gain - we just want to bless you with the power of worship!

We have a bunch of AMAZING songs to produce, and have been doing studio work at nearly minimum wage, but we're out of capital, and greatly needing YOUR partnership in prayer, finances, and excitement - to continue!

We want YOU to be a key part - help us pick which songs to produce next, and help us cover the $1500 audio & video production cost per song.  Your financial seed into a particular song becomes a powerful vote for that song, and allows us to actually get it fully produced at the excellent quality we've always maintained!  When a song reaches the $1500 minimum production budget, we'll start working on that song, and get it out to you as soon as we finish beautifying it for your enjoyment & connection with God!

What do you get?  You get free limitless worship on YouTube - to your FAVORITE songs, plus inspired spontaneous worship, after many of them!

A YouTube Testimony:


Vote for your favorite songs by funding them!

Here is the first set of song options, by popular (Facebook poll) demand:
(Make sure to purchase these songs from these amazing writers & artists!)

Come To The Altar - by Elevation Worship
Endless Hallelujah - by Cory Asbury
Great Is Thy Faithfulness - by Thomas Chisholm
I Breathe You In God - by Bryan & Katie Torwalt
Let It Happen - by United Pursuit
Lover of My Soul - by Jonathan McReynolds
Never Going Back - by United Pursuit
Open Up Let The Light In - by Steffany Gretzinger
PEACE - by Hillsong Young & Free
What A Friend I've Found - by Delirious / Martin Smith
You Made A Way - by Travis Greene
You Say - by Lauren Daigle
Original WorshipMob Songs

A YouTube Testimony:


The Impact

When you commit to helping us produce these songs, you will bless hundreds of thousands of people around the world through your partnership.  Just read the comments on our videos, to understand your amazing impact to our over 140,000 subscribers.

WE CAN'T WAIT to share these amazing worship sessions with you, and we would love to honor you by putting your name in our YouTube credits for each song you help us fund!

Thank you - for your tangible impact on both our local and global worship communities!

A YouTube Testimony:


The Challenge

Help us raise $1500 for each of your favorite songs - to cover the audio editing, mixing & mastering, & the full video production expenses.

All funding over the minimum will go to general funding of ministry costs and administration. Our long term desire is to be able to fully honor everyone who contributes their time and talents to this ministry!

We'd love your help!  Working together, we can change the world through powerful worship!

A YouTube Testimony:


Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the finances to seed one of your favorite songs, make sure to share this campaign with your friends & family - and tell them what WorshipMob has meant to you!

Also - the most important thing - please pray for us - for our leadership team & musicians.  We want to share God's heart with you, and need discernment and protection to do this well <3

Thank You For Being Part of our Worldwide Worship Family!
 

More YouTube Testimonies...

story:
Bringing Music To Seniors To Improve Mental Health and Family Life.

Big Shot Records thanks everyone who has contributed to Phase I of The Sinatra for Seniors campaign. We have now launched Phase II in our efforts to "use music to help improve the mental health and family life of senior citizens." Your continued support will help us achieve our goal. Learn more about The Sinatra for Seniors campaign and/or make a donation by clicking here.
story_txt:
Bringing Music To Seniors To Improve Mental Health and Family Life.
Big Shot Records thanks everyone who has contributed to Phase I of The Sinatra for Seniors campaign. We have now launched Phase II in our efforts to "use music to help improve the mental health and family life of senior citizens." Your continued support will help us achieve our goal. story:
Hello,


Can i tell you a story?

Once upon a time there was a musician who worked very hard. he believed that music was the best medicine for the people of the world and gave music from a place deep in his heart. Many other musicians called him names and treated him like he didn't belong, but he kept on because he believed in making music for the betterment of mankind.

The human race became spoiled with free commodities and music became a less valued part of life in the modern society. They created machines that made music by pressing a button and all of a sudden ,music was free and any one could make it. The boy kept strumming his guitar and singing his notes like it was doing something good for the world. The rest of the world looked at him like he was a fool.

Then one day, a sad thing happened and one of his guitar playing friends was sent to the heavens on short notice. After this occurrence, the boy decided to get in touch with one of his favorite Australian musicians and ask if he would help him to make a great musical journey on CD before he himself got called to the heavens.

After 100'000 Bananas and a truckload of Goji berries..
The story continues to unfold, thankfully, gratefully, he moves through the universe with his guitar, his skateboard and his dreams.

Life's too short not to live your dreams,
Bless.
Before the train comes.
The Boy.

A new journey begins. The creation of a new musical body and capture of sound in time and space. This is sure to be a great adventure that sets off new ideas, dreams and inventions in new directions. Join us for the journey through...

"It was 12 months ago I decided to contact Nicky Bomba and ask him if he'd help me make a full length album. I didn't know what he would say, but i took the plunge and asked him anyway.  Now, 12 months later,  I am sitting in the studio after our 6th day of recording. So i am quite literally in the moment i dreamed of, making this album.



About Nicky and Robin (these are the guys helping to bring this album to life).

Nicky Bomba : http://nickybomba.com/
Nicky Bomba fronts the amazing 28 piece, ARIA Nominated, Melbourne Ska Orchestra, as well as 'Bustamento' and Bomba. And many other projects, including 'John Butler Trio'.  Nicky is already a legend with so much experience and success in the music industry world that i have to direct you to his website to find out all the Planet Juiciness. He is helping a lot of artists in the world music scene and creating a great movement and community for the arts in Australia.
Check out Nickys website here : http://nickybomba.com/


Highly acclaimed producer/engeneer Robin Mai. http://www.robinmai.com/
Robin is the go-to producer for many well respected musical artists from Australia and around the World. Including Melbourne Ska Orchestra, Nicky Bomba, David Jones, John Butler Trio, Joe Camaleri and many others. Check out the MEGA list of world class artists on Robins website. http://www.robinmai.com/


Then there's me, Ben Kelly : http://www.benkellyaustralia.com/
I'm just an independent artist with big dreams. I'm currently living from street performance and touring around in my van. I grew up on a farm in a town called Silvan. I love being a musician and making music for people and aim to do this at the highest level possible and give the songs the life they deserve. Your part in this project is helping me achieve music at a higher level, so i thank you with all my heart.

 I set out with 3 goals in 2016.
1# Record an album with Nicky Bomba
2# Skateboard around Australia
3# Shift Paradigms (this is more psychological than anything else, a change in mind set).

  For now its on with The Music !!

BK

Costs

Project costs : A project like a full album recording can cost as much as you have to throw at it. Ill be paying with my street performance income if i dont reach the mark on Indygogo, so your really are helping a business start up by helping me record this album.

Risks : There aren't really any risks associated with this project. Its simple really. Make an album, Pay for the time of the studio , producer and musician, then print and release the album to the beautiful world.


50'000 People

  • Ben Kelly – A local to the Dandenong Ranges. Ben immediately struck me as an extraordinarily gifted musician who has crafted his talent to create sound that is truly energizing.  Ben’s music played a profound role in my own journey, and now that of many of my clients.
    Ben is passionate about the use of 432Hz frequency and his instrumental pieces are widely used amongst those seeking real transformation.
    Ben’s music has also proved truly effective in its calming qualities for children with ADHD and also those with Autism Spectrum Disorder.  As a Paediatric Occupational Therapist I highly recommend it as a powerful tool for parents of children with special needs.  
    Angela Russo
    Mental Health Practitioner/Holistic Counselor
    Paediatric Occupational Therapist.
  • ##################################################

Note, dollars are in US.
$8 US = $11Au 
$20 US = $27Au etc.

Banana smoothies are ACE !!!!

Thanks for your consideration, please enjoy your days and live your dreams,

Blessings,

Ben
story_txt:
Hello,

Can i tell you a story?

Once upon a time there was a musician who worked very hard. he believed 
that music was the best medicine for the people of the world and gave 
music from a place deep in his heart. Many other musicians called him 
names and treated him like he didn't belong, but he kept on because he 
believed in making music for the betterment of mankind.

The human race became spoiled with free commodities and music became a 
less valued part of life in the modern society. They created machines 
that made music by pressing a button and all of a sudden ,music was free
 and any one could make it. The boy kept strumming his guitar and 
singing his notes like it was doing something good for the world. The 
rest of the world looked at him like he was a fool.

Then one day, a sad thing happened and one of his guitar playing friends
 was sent to the heavens on short notice. After this occurrence, the boy
 decided to get in touch with one of his favorite Australian musicians 
and ask if he would help him to make a great musical journey on CD 
before he himself got called to the heavens.

After 100'000 Bananas and a truckload of Goji berries..
The story continues to unfold, thankfully, gratefully, he moves through 
the universe with his guitar, his skateboard and his dreams.
Life's too short not to live your dreams,
Bless.
Before the train comes.
The Boy. A new journey begins. The creation of a new musical body and capture of sound in time and space. This is sure to be a great adventure that sets off new ideas, dreams and inventions in new directions. Join us for the journey through..."It was 12 months ago I decided to contact Nicky Bomba and ask him if he'd help me make a full length album. I didn't know what he would say, but i took the plunge and asked him anyway.  Now, 12 months later,  I am sitting in the studio after our 6th day of recording. So i am quite literally in the moment i dreamed of, making this album. 
About Nicky and Robin (these are the guys helping to bring this album to life).
Nicky Bomba : http://nickybomba.com/Nicky Bomba fronts
 the amazing 28 piece, ARIA Nominated, Melbourne Ska Orchestra, as well 
as 'Bustamento' and Bomba. And many other projects, including 'John 
Butler Trio'.  Nicky is already a legend with so much experience and
 success in the music industry world that i have to direct you to his 
website to find out all the Planet Juiciness. He is helping a lot of artists in the world music scene and creating a great movement and community for the arts in Australia.Check out Nickys website here : http://nickybomba.com/

Highly acclaimed producer/engeneer Robin Mai. http://www.robinmai.com/Robin is the go-to producer for many well respected musical artists from Australia and around the World. Including Melbourne Ska Orchestra,
 Nicky Bomba, David Jones, John Butler Trio, Joe Camaleri and many 
others. Check out the MEGA list of world class artists on Robins 
website. http://www.robinmai.com/
Then there's me, Ben Kelly : http://www.benkellyaustralia.com/I'm just an independent artist with big dreams. I'm currently living from street performance and touring around in my van. story:
Once Upon a Time...

...There lived a creative organization called Boston Rock Opera. It provided the fair city of Boston with magical performances inspired by musicians from many backgrounds. They worked together to ensure that everyone involved, performer and audience member alike, would behold the grandeur of the Boston music scene - while also having a rocking good time, of course. Then, after 10 years of shows, BRO was cast under a dissolution spell and has been sleeping ever since. 

In recent days, the spell was lifted and the sleeping people of Boston Rock Opera awakened in haze of happy memories. However, they soon realized that the more things change, the more they stay the same. Believing in the power of music to inform and transform, BRO is refreshed and more ready than ever to unite the forces of Boston musicians to generate enchanting new productions for audiences and performers alike. 

It was time to rock again! So, the BRO joined forces with G-Rock Music's Kameelah Benjamin-Fuller to begin telling a new story with an old one, to return to the stage with the revolutionary 1960s rock musical HAIR.  

Why HAIR? HAIR is the story the generation on the front lines of the social overhaul of 1960s America; the Vietnam cannon fodder, the out-of-work kids, whose histories reverberate today. Media overload, fear of technology, disgust with authority, sexual curiosity and drug use drove the alternative reality they created to keep the spectre of the draft and death away. The BRO passionately believes this musical will remind us that history forgotten repeats itself as politics, race, class and gender continue to stratify our society.  

Be a part of this real life fairy tale! Boston Rock Opera has started this campaign to allow us the space to create a vision that is singular and sends a message to the world that we are all together on this journey. 

What We Need  

In our effort to support all things local, we have chosen to work with locavore restaurant Once/Cuisine En Locale as our performance venue. This is an intimate hall (275 seats) that will allow everyone to have the best seat in the house. However, this decision comes at a cost. Tickets sales, even if all the shows sell out, will not cover the full costs of presenting HAIR. Boston Rock Opera had years of experience staging theatrical rock, every dime raised in this campaign is already allocated to this production. The licensing for HAIR alone costs more than $3,000 and we have a lengthy budget of any typical musical production including lighting, sound, costumes, sets, rehearsal space and publicity.  

Furthermore, we are committed to allowing those who make this show happen - the cast, musicians and crew - to be paid for the amazing performance and service they provide!  When you help us, you help create a sustainable community through the arts.  In fact, you aren't just helping, you become a part of that community! 

What You Get

By donating to this campaign, you are showing the rest of the world the strength of Boston, its vibrant music scene and most importantly, its people. 

But wait there's more! Pledging will allow you the chance to be involved at multiple levels. Everything helps and we want to show our appreciation for believing in our story.  Be a part of HAIR as little or as much as you can (the more people in the tribe, the better). Check out our Perks! We've got BRO collectables, special events, ticket packages and more to share with you. 

The Impact

The people of BRO are reuniting out of mutual love and passion for music and its impact and commentary on the human experience. Boston Rock Opera has a long history of successfully and creatively producing ground-breaking modern musicals and rock operas. Past shows included Jesus Christ Superstar, Ray Davies' Preservation, The Point!, SF Sorrow, The Rocky Horror Show and original works written and produced by Boston artists. With your help, we'll entertain you once again.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn't everything! If financially contributing is not within your wallet space, then we would love you to participate in other ways! Here are some suggestions: 

  • Social Network!
    Spread the word and share the love. Any and all is appreciated.
  • Send an email to those you love and encourage them to join our cause
  • Send us a message directing us towards others you think could help
  • Be a part of the team! Think you have something to offer that will make HAIR great? Message us to join the tribe. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Come see us perform!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Heyhihello!

So, for anyone that doesn't know me, my name is Lewis Murphy, and I'm a young singer/songwriter for a traditional town known as King's Lynn, Norfolk. I've been working in the music industry for about 4 years now, but recently, something has changed. 
I started my career off as a solo artist, playing at pubs around my local area. I thoroughly enjoyed this, but have recently changed my sound to an indie-pop sort of sound; think Two Door Cinema Club with a hint of pop. This change has really kicked my career off, allowing me to hit #20 in the iTunes charts, performing UK tours and play huge festivals such as Latitude, Sundown and The Great Escape. Now, we need your help.
With the change of sound, I've formed a band & a team. Matt and Declan, my band members, have become so important to the development of my artist, and now we are working so closely together that we are all in need of YOU. 

The Campaign

2016 is going to be a huge year for us. Following from last year, with the success of national radio play, huge UK festivals and shows up and down the country, we are looking to push on even further. We have a lot planned for 2016, with a massive EP release & campaign, pushing the music around to all sets of ears. There's also as DEBUT MUSIC VIDEO, which is going to be part of our campaign to really throw us into the deep end. Following the release, we're then heading around the UK, doing a university tour. This is going to be the biggest tour for me to date, constantly on the road for about 3 weeks. This is where you guys step in.
In order to carry out all of our plans, we are running a fundraiser, so that everything can be achieved. We are looking to try and get everyone involved, and help us towards our big goal. If we could get everyone involved to donate just £1 each, our opportunities would be endless. We'd be able to achieve our goal and more, extending our campaign and tour hopefully.
In return for your help with our fundraising, there are a few things on offer for you. For the big prize, the person who donates the most money will get a DAY IN THE STUDIO with me and the band, getting behind the scenes action with how we write and record our songs!! SOUNDS GOOD RIGHT? We then have some t-shirts that you'll 80% off for if you donate £3!! You'll also get a PREVIEW for our DEBUT MUSIC VIDEO, meaning you'll get to see the video before it's even released!!!! HOW CRAZY IS THAT??!! On top of all that, you'll also get a meet & greet with me and the band (if that's what you're into?!?!) THAT'S SO EXCITING?!?!
I hope that you've enjoyed reading this, and I sincerely hope you get involved, because I'm so excited to really kickstart this year with you guys by my side. If you've been supporting us from the start, I can't thank you enough for everything that you guys do. If you're new to us, then hi hi, thank you for taking your time to get involved, and welcome to the team. You guys are great, and with your help, I know we can do anything.
Lx

story:
Le projet, c’est quoi?

En gros, l'objectif du projet, c’est de produire un mini-album (EP) qui reflète l'évolution du Billy Love Band depuis le lancement de son premier EP, en juin 2013. Au cours des 3 dernières années, le BLB a énormément évolué, et c’est le cas de le dire. Croyez-moi, c’est pas le changement qui manque.  Le BLB en 2016, c'est la collision entre la douceur d'un punch aux fruits et l'amertume d'un café pas de lait.

Le projet, c’est qui?

Le Billy Love Band c'est

William Lamoureux - Violon et Voix

Marianne Dumas - Claviers

Benaias Lemma - Guitare

Jean-Philippe Lapensée - Basse électrique

Andrew Ferderber - Batterie. 

Pour l'album, la musique est écrite par William Lamoureux, et les paroles sont un travail collaboratif entre William et la plume de Fred Abel, un parolier de la région de Gatineau.  Les arrangements sont un travail d'équipe impliquant tous les membres du groupe et les deux co-réalisateurs, Drew Jurecka  et Joshua Van Tassel (plus de détails à leur sujet ci-bas).

Le projet, pourquoi on s’y met?

Depuis 2013, le Billy Love Band s'est retrouvé lauréat de plusieurs concours, que ce soit Gatineau Prend la Scène, L'école du Rock de Musique Plus ou la bourse Desjardins du Festival de l'Outaouais Émergent.  On a aussi atteint aussi la demi-finale du Festival International de la Chanson de Granby en 2014.  Avec le nouveau EP, on aimerait tenter notre chance dans les grands festivals du Canada français en 2017, et aussi participer à quelques vitrines qui nous aideront à mettre notre nom sur la map. On voit clairement les possibilités d’atteindre nos objectifs se multipliés avec la sortie du mini-album. La production du EP, ainsi que la planification de ce que nous voulons réaliser, nous laissent croire que la fougue du BLB ne fait que commencer.

Le projet, y coûte combien?

Évidemment, un projet comme celui-ci, ça coûte un bras. Malheureusement, personne dans le groupe s’est porté volontaire pour nous en donner un. Donc, on a besoin de votre aide financière pour ce qui est du travail de production, post-production et la mise en marché de l’album.  Le coût total du projet est estimé à 10000$. C'est le coût de travailler avec la crème de la crème. On cherche à recueillir 5000$ avec le financement social.  Le reste des fonds viendra de la vente d'albums, la vente de marchandise, ainsi que des spectacles de levée de fonds.

Les dépenses sont distribuées plus ou moins comme suit (ne vous en faites pas, ce n’est pas les musiciens qui ont fait le calcul): réalisation 30%; musiciens 25%; studio et ingénieur 11%; mixage et mastérization 16%; design de la pochette et reproduction de l'album 18%.

Y’a plusieurs façons de nous donner un coup de main.

Effectivement, vous pouvez contribuer sur cette page-ci, mais vous pouvez aussi partager notre campagne avec vos amis! Ah, pis vous pouvez aussi venir nous voir jouer au Brasseurs du Temps à Gatineau le 29 mai (levée de fonds pour l’album) et finalement, gâtez-vous avec un t-shirt du BLB, une affiche ou encore pré-acheter l'album en version numérique ou physique. On vous dit merci 1,000 fois, et bienvenu chez les Billy Lovers.

Quelques mots au sujet des co-réalisateurs

Drew Jurecka est un prodige du violon jazz! Il est aussi saxophoniste, chanteur, et vétéran du très populaire  Jeff Healey and The Jazz Wizards. Il est souvent en tournée comme membre du groupe de la chanteuse Jill Barber , Il joue aussi  avec le groupe Jazz Bohème de Nicole Stoffman, le Hot Jazz String Quartet, les Hogtown Syncopators, et mène son propre ensemble manouche Continental Rhythm.  Il s'est présenté sur scène avec la symphonie de Canton, a joué au Hollywood Bowl avec Diana Krall, Shirley Horn, et Dianne Reeves, a improvisé avec le Dave Brubeck Quartet, joué avec  Stevie Wonder et Jim Cuddy, et pendant neuf ans, il a agi comme directeur du festival de musique Jazz at the Northern Lights à Guadalajara, Mexique.

Joshua Van Tassel est un réalisateur, compositeur, multi-instrumentiste qui a collaboré avec les Great Lake Swimmers, Justin Rutledge, Doug Paisley, et David Myles parmi plusieurs artistes de renom. Sa musique a été en vedette à plusieurs émissions de télévision,et il a été acclamé par les critiques de la CBC, du Toronto Star, de NOW Magazine, et de Exclaim! entre autres. Son dernier album, Dance Music: Songs For Slow Motion, a remporté le prix du Electronic Album of the Year aux East Coast Music Awards et aux Music Nova Scotia Awards

Festival de l'Outaouais Émergent.  On a aussi atteint aussi la demi-finale
du Festival International de la Chanson de Granby en 2014.  Avec le
nouveau EP, on aimerait tenter notre chance dans les grands festivals du Canada
français en 2017, et aussi participer à quelques vitrines qui nous aideront à
mettre notre nom sur la map. On voit clairement les possibilités d’atteindre nos
objectifs se multipliés avec la sortie du mini-album. La production du EP, ainsi
que la planification de ce que nous voulons réaliser, nous laissent croire que la fougue du BLB ne
fait que commencer.
Le projet, y coûte combien?



Évidemment, un projet
comme celui-ci, ça coûte un bras. Malheureusement, personne dans le groupe
s’est porté volontaire pour nous en donner un. Donc, on a besoin de votre aide
financière pour ce qui est du travail de production, post-production et la mise
en marché de l’album.  Le coût total du projet est estimé à 10000$. C'est
le coût de travailler avec la crème de la crème. On cherche à recueillir 5000$
avec le financement social.  Le reste des fonds viendra de la vente d'albums,
la vente de marchandise, ainsi que des spectacles de levée de fonds.
Les dépenses sont
distribuées plus ou moins comme suit (ne vous en faites pas, ce n’est pas les
musiciens qui ont fait le calcul): réalisation 30%; musiciens 25%; studio et
ingénieur 11%; mixage et mastérization 16%; design de la pochette et
reproduction de l'album 18%.


Y’a plusieurs façons
de nous donner un coup de main.




Effectivement, vous pouvez
contribuer sur cette page-ci, mais vous pouvez aussi partager notre campagne
avec vos amis! Ah, pis vous pouvez aussi venir nous voir jouer au Brasseurs du
Temps à Gatineau le 29 mai (levée de fonds pour l’album) et finalement,
gâtez-vous avec un t-shirt du BLB, une affiche ou encore pré-acheter l'album en
version numérique ou physique. On vous dit merci 1,000 fois, et bienvenu
chez les Billy Lovers.

Quelques mots au sujet des co-réalisateurs

Drew Jurecka
est un prodige du violon jazz! Il est aussi saxophoniste, chanteur, et
vétéran du très populaire  Jeff Healey and The Jazz Wizards. Il est
souvent en tournée comme membre du groupe de la chanteuse Jill Barber , Il
joue aussi  avec le groupe Jazz Bohème de Nicole Stoffman, le Hot
Jazz String Quartet, les Hogtown Syncopators, et mène son propre ensemble
manouche Continental Rhythm.  Il s'est présenté sur scène avec la symphonie
de Canton, a joué au Hollywood Bowl avec Diana Krall, Shirley Horn, et
Dianne Reeves, a improvisé avec le Dave Brubeck Quartet, joué avec  Stevie
Wonder et Jim Cuddy, et pendant neuf ans, il a agi comme directeur du festival
de musique Jazz at the Northern Lights à Guadalajara, Mexique.
Joshua Van Tassel est
un réalisateur, compositeur, multi-instrumentiste qui a collaboré avec
les Great Lake Swimmers, Justin Rutledge, Doug
Paisley, et David Myles parmi plusieurs artistes de renom. Sa
musique a été en vedette à plusieurs émissions de télévision,et il a été
acclamé par les critiques de la CBC, du Toronto Star,
de NOW Magazine, et de Exclaim! entre autres. Son dernier album, Dance Music: Songs For Slow Motion, a remporté le prix du Electronic Album
of the Year aux East Coast Music Awards et aux Music Nova
Scotia Awards

story: This will be my very first studio album. Completing this project will mean the world to me. For all of you who have believed in my work, been to my shows and even sing my songs, nothing will make me more proud than to give them all back to you in a fully produced album.
story_txt: This will be my very first studio album. Completing this project will mean the world to me. For all of you who have believed in my work, been to my shows and even sing my songs, nothing will make me more proud than to give them all back to you in a fully produced album.

story:
Hi, I’m composer and pianist, Michael Carter Jr. Welcome to my fundraising page. Your support will make it possible for me to produce and distribute my second full-length album, The MJR Generation. The songs are written and the musicians are ready, but I need funds to pay my musicians, rent studio time, and produce a high-quality album that can be distributed on a national scale. I need backers like you!

Your support can take the form of a direct donation or the purchase of one or more of my perks.

My Mission:

I’ve found that music has the power to bring people together, despite our differences. My vision is to bridge generational gaps with timeless music that can be appreciated at any age.

In a time when popular music often has a negative or violent tone, I hope to cut through the pessimism and bring a message of positivity and inclusivity to the music world. I believe music shapes our culture and influences our outlook. My dream is to be part of a movement—a new generation of artists who aim to create a better world through music.

It has always been my personal goal to present a positive image for my generation and serve as a role model for younger kids. With my second album, I’m aiming to expand my influence and spread my message to a larger, national audience. 

My Music:

My sound combines elements of jazz, hip hop, and classical music. I was exposed to a variety of music from a very young age and developed an appreciation for Jazz and R&B artists, like Stevie Wonder, George Benson and Usher.

Motivated by these early influences, I began composing my own music at the age of 12. My style has evolved and developed since my debut album at age 14, but I still stay true to my roots and strive for a sound that is contemporary and dynamic, with plenty of movement and creative jazz riffs. My music has been called, “a refreshing entry into the jazz genre that will start to bring the younger generation into this style of music.”

5 years old, First Performance, 2004

My Story:

My journey started at the age of four when I was introduced to music with my first drum set.  I started piano lessons and performing in front of an audience at age five. 

Although I am an accomplished pianist, my passion is composing songs.  I dream of composing classics as my skills improve and aim to build a music legacy that has a positive effect on others. 

My professional career started at age 14 with my first album, The Future.  It has been very successful in the Minneapolis area, but more importantly I learned a great deal about the power of music and the music industry.  Since my first album, I have given dozens of live performances in the Twin Cities area.

14 years old, First Album: The Future, 2013


At age 17, I am now ready to really go after my dream and deliver my music to a national audience. I have a strategy in place, but need additional funds to take the next steps forward.

17 years old

My next album, The MJR Generation, scheduled for August 2016 features deep bass lines with distinctive piano and saxophone melodies. At the core of this album is a message of love, harmony, and enjoying the presence of others. It aims to bring people of many backgrounds and generations together.

Where Will The Funds Go?

Recording, producing, and marketing an album is a costly endeavor. In order to create a polished, professional second album, I will need all the support I can get.

All the songs for my next album are composed and ready to record! I also have been blessed to have an amazing national recording artist agree to play on my album.  In addition to paying my supporting musicians, I’ll need to rent studio space, hire a producer, hire a graphic designer to create the cover art, and spend money on distribution and marketing.

Your Support:

In order to make my second album a reality, I need your help. If you’re like me and believe in the power of music, I urge you to make a donation to my campaign. It’s not only an investment in my music, it’s an investment in the next generation of music.

I believe that The MJR Generation represents a huge shift in music tastes and standards. It’s part of a movement to reshape the culture of music.

With your generous support, we can build something beautiful, together. Please give whatever amount you can today. Join me and let’s make The MJR Generation happen!

MJR working in the video studio

story:
Short Summary

My name is Rigel Thurston, and I am a  full-time musician living in Austin Texas. I recently made a major life change from: disillusioned realtor and half-hearted musician, to full-hearted full-time musician. This change was largely catalyzed by the birth of my son Oswald.

I realized that I was playing it safe by putting a mediocre effort into two things. “Out to Sea” is about cutting ties to both the internal and external distractions that keep me from facing my own heart and my own potential.

While this campaign is a practical vehicle for paying all the recording and producing costs, it will also launch me into what I believe is my calling–where I can more fully express all the love in my heart and share it with the world. Over the last 10 years, an accumulation of core beliefs and values have been stewing—building community and family, leaping into the unknown, forming habits of creativity, facing my fears, and following my heart–these are all part of the Rigel Thurston Band, and by participating in this campaign, you will be joining me in this vision.

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $20,000:

  • $15,500  -  Album Creation         
  • $1,804    -  Perks
  • $1,705    -  Fundraising fees   
  • $1,039    -  Licensing

$15,500 will go towards the Album Creation portion:

The vast majority of these funds will go towards producing and mixing the album. This is what sets the pro apart from the amateur. Technically I could do this entire album in my own home studio and get an okay sound. But I want to make something that I will truly be excited about—don’t want to be making excuses the moment I release it. And based on the quality of my first recording, it has already exceeded my expectations!

Perks

I am super excited about all the perks and swag. Each perk is infused with my love and personal touch, and the donation levels range from $5–$1,000. Each level corresponds to a gift, a token of my gratitude, that becomes more personalized the higher the level.

If you contribute at any level, you will get immediate access to my first completed song—a little tide-me-over until the full album is released. I paid for this one out of my own pocket, and is a gift to you. Free download here.

  • Sock Tribe: Anyone who knows me well, knows that I am deeply committed to building community in my own neighborhood. One of the ways I do this is by walking the streets sporting bright colored whimsical socks, like, dinosaurs with golden unicorns, pink elephants, or bright polka-dots. I believe this brings positive energy to the streets and gives others permission to do the same. Now you can too!
  • My Mug on a Mug: I am at a stage in life where I start every morning with a pot of french pressed coffee. A local artist and dear friend of mine, John Bell, volunteered to do a line drawing portrait of me. This will be screen printed upon a white porcelain mug which will allow us to break the proximity barriers of our linear dimension and commune together in a singular shared caffeine high. It might be the most expensive coffee mug you ever buy, but a very inexpensive joy ride into the Eternal Present. Namaste.
  • Polly’s Patterns: My wife Polly has an extraordinary gift with art and design. In addition to being my own personal art director for everything associated with Rigel Thurston Band, she has also volunteered to create an “Out to Sea” pattern that will be used for thank you cards, socks, and whatever else needs a little love. You can check out more on her blog.
  • Original Artwork: For the last 10 years, I have been block printing my holiday greeting cards. I am offering original art to my contributors, which will also be used in the album cover.
  • Happy Birthday Video: I have a fun bluesy version of happy birthday that I would love to customize just for you!

 

If I raise more or less than my goal.

If I don’t hit my goal, I will do an EP and some single releases depending on the final numbers. If I exceed my goal, the extra funds will go towards album expenses incurred prior to the campaign, additional CD duplication, and album promotion. Anything over that will go into my next project.

The Impact

I believe music transcends concepts, and heals things we didn’t even know needed healing. Music makes us better listeners. One of the ways I know how to bring positive change into the world is by making beautiful music. And with your help, I will do just that.

Challenges

One very real obstacle is that I am a stay-at-home dad with a toddler. All of my music projects have to fit around his schedule, which is mostly predictable. But there are times when it’s not, like when he gets sick, or doesn’t stay down for his nap. Being flexible in organizing my life is as much an art form as the music making itself.

Another aspect to this adventure is that I don’t have a fancy artist-development department molding me into a jewel of perfection. I stumble around in the dark banging into what works, and what doesn’t. It’s a process of trial and error that can be a bit time consuming. However, the benefit is I get to have complete control over my music and image. I plan on being transparent about all of this–my victories and my “learning experiences.”

Other Ways You Can Help

Share it with your friends! I need all the help I can get. If you have friends who would love my music, please invite them to join in.

If you’re not big on social media, you can always send good vibes my way, or a nice email: rigelthurstonband@gmail.com. I need lots of encouragement!

I can only do this with your help. From the bottom of my heart, thank you for supporting me.

story:
Pop Obscure brings you Records and Art!

Help support our shop in the Fashion District near the Historic Core in downtown Los Angeles and we’ll hook you up with Tote Bags, T-Shirts, Stickers, Pins, Original Artwork, and In-Store perks!

What is Pop Obscure?

A new independent record store in downtown Los Angeles! We carry new and used vinyl - (there's nothing like being surrounded by thousands of pieces of music and art).  We also have an art gallery where we feature single artists as well as curated group shows. Did I mention we have a small stage? Can't wait for those great drop-in jams! Secret shows? Fingers crossed!

Who is behind Pop Obscure?

Hello Everyone. My name is Sherry Lee and together with Dustin Lane, we've just opened Pop Obscure Records and Art Gallery.  We are two creative people who love - you guessed it - music and art! (and motorcycles too!)  Our passion from early on has always been a love for vinyl and music.  We both grew up as record store kids.  We found each other, started a band, got married and have been together ever since.  Dustin has spent the last 2 decades in retail and entertainment production industries. Independently, he’s made a few music videos, 2 movie shorts, a full length feature and has even written a book and a few scripts.  I’m currently enjoying my 16th year at Freestyle Photographic Supplies where I embrace my art-making side with unique prints. As a freelancer, I have shown my work in various galleries, commercial print and continue to collect and create images. I am now pulling double duty as we get back to our roots, become independent and create an opportunity for our community to experience the fruits of our dreams and enjoy our favorite things right along with us. 

Location Location Location!

Downtown Los Angeles is enjoying a boom of new growth and renovation. We’ve read that we are in the midst of some 90 projects just in the downtown area alone. New buildings ranging from a new Federal Courthouse and Wilshire Grand Tower (to be the tallest building on the West Coast) to various hotels, retail spaces and over 5000 new housing units are all being constructed in a very small area.

We have been lucky enough to find a great space right in the middle of all of it. We are a new independent record store in downtown and we are within easy walking distance of The Ace Hotel, Orpheum Theater, Clifton’s Cafeteria and Grand Central Market, to the galleries on Spring Street to the Regent Theater and Nickel Diner on Main, to the Fashion District and Flower Mart. Did I mention we are right next to a yummy Mexican restaurant and a parking lot?

Instead of heading to a coffee house where everyone is plugged in and all alone; come visit us! We would like to offer you a place to decompress. A place to enter a zen zone, while flipping through new and used records; a place to enjoy art, good company and friendly conversation; a place to meet new friends, and collect and build your life’s soundtrack; and, if you’re a visual artist, we would like to offer you a chance to be seen, too. We believe in supporting the arts and are looking forward to in-store events and gallery openings to show off some of the best local talent in the world.

Look, living in a big city can be overwhelming. We know first hand. But it can also be amazing! Ultimately, we will offer an opportunity to escape the daily grind, if only for a little while. You’ll find yourself in a place of discovery and inspiration. And you’ll have a chance to score cool Record Store Day releases – That’s right, because we’ll be "the" record store in “downtown”! We hope Pop Obscure Records will be your place to collect or contribute something tangible. With your support we can all be successful.

Remember – Music and Art make everything better!

Why WE need YOU.

While we had hoped to bootstrap our entire enterprise on our own, the project, and interest in it has grown. The reality is we do need your help. It's time to fight for our dream.  We’ve cut costs as much as possible by electing to design, build, and try to do everything ourselves. We gutted the building, relied on the generosity of a few friends to help paint and lay carpet and we've opened the doors to our welcoming neighborhood. But, some of the unexpected costs and setbacks have added up. We are behind and we still need to continue to fill the bins and properly outfit the gallery.

Why should you help?

Together we can make art happen! When you support our project you are supporting the opportunity for creatives and the collectors who both share a love of audible, visual and tangible art, to come together in a single space. We hope that our perks are something cool you would like to purchase. All physical items were designed by us and produced by local artists and businesses. We believe in supporting our community and we know you do too. All monies raised through this project will get our store off the ground and into the community. Thank you for being a part of our team!

Other ways You can Help.

If you can't contribute, we understand, but that doesn't mean you can't help. We are just 2 people, but with you behind us we can create an army of evangelists and angels. We need you to make some noise and get the word out on your social media accounts, emails and even when you are talking to people on your phone - don't forget to use the Indiegogo Share tools!  Every little bit helps and will get us closer to our goal.   If you will spread the word, we would be forever grateful.

Rewards and Cool Perks

In exchange for your support, we have various rewards ranging from stickers, totes and t-shirts to having your art shown in a gallery. Contributing at any level will earn a permanent place for your name to appear as a supporter of Pop Obscure Records and Art Gallery. Help us with our journey for as little as $5.

$5 I support Vinyl

A sincere Thank You with a Shout Out on Facebook!  Every Dollar Helps!  Come in for a handshake and a hug. See your name - a legacy - on permanent view in the store, on a piece of art that Sherry will create as a tribute to everyone who contributed to the project’s success.




$15 Pins & Sticker Pack

All designs by Sherry. These vinyl stickers are great on bumpers and laptops. Then let everyone know you’re one of the cool kids by wearing your Pop Obscure Pins. (Your contribution includes shipping in the U.S.  Please add $5 for international shipping).





$30 Record-Toting Tote Bag & Sticker Pack

Carry your favorite records to and from your home in this reusable cotton canvas tote. Great for the grocery store too! Design by Sherry. Final design and colors may vary slightly. PLUS your name written on our “I Support Vinyl” permanent display, a tribute to everyone who contributed to the project’s success. (Your contribution includes shipping in the U.S.  Please add $10 for international shipping).  




$45 Cool Record Store T-shirt + 1 Sticker Pack

Hey, you’re off the clock. Time to don your new, favorite record store t-shirt! All shirts are American made in men’s and women’s sizes. Designs by Sherry.   Final design and colors may vary slightly. We' ll ask your style#/size/sex preference after the campaign ends.  PLUS your name written on our “I Support Vinyl” permanent display, a tribute to everyone who contributed to the project’s success. (Your contribution includes shipping in the U.S. Please add $10 for international shipping).  

 




$85 Vinyl Wall Clock & Sticker Pack

Can’t find your phone? Power Out? No worries! Your battery run vinyl wall clock will keep time for you and make sure you’re not late to the next gallery opening! Made from a real vinyl record and made into a clock by Sherry herself. Final design may vary slightly. PLUS your name written on our “I Support Vinyl” permanent display, a tribute to everyone who contributed to the project’s success. (Your contribution includes shipping in the U.S.  Not available for international shipping).  (5 available)



$100 Combo Pack. 2 Pin & Sticker Packs. 1 Tote and 1 T-Shirt

Own a complete set of wearable merchandise with one click!  Final design and colors may vary slightly. We' ll ask your style#/size/sex preference after the campaign ends.  PLUS your name written on our “I Support Vinyl” permanent display, a tribute to everyone who contributed to the project’s success.  (Your contribution includes shipping in the U.S.  Please add $10 for international shipping). 






$175 Art Call Entries, Gallery T-Shirt & Sticker Pack

Want to enter our Call for Art? Entry fees are $40 for submission of up to 3 pieces in each call for art. This perk will pay for entry into 3 different shows.  Calls for Art will be announced on our website and through various email services, however, we will contact YOU directly. Submittal does not guarantee acceptance in the show. Art must be original works. Currently, only 2 dimensional work will be displayed. T-shirt final design and colors may vary slightly. We' ll ask your style#/size/sex preference after the campaign ends. PLUS your name written on our “I Support Vinyl” permanent display, a tribute to everyone who contributed to the project’s success. (Your contribution includes shipping in the U.S.  Please add $10 for international shipping).    (5 available)




$245 Two(+) Combo Packs! - 4 Pin & Sticker Packs. 2 Totes and 3 T-Shirts.

Own TWO complete sets of wearable merchandise (and a bonus tee!) with one click.  Final design and colors may vary slightly.We' ll ask your style#/size/sex preference after the campaign ends.  PLUS your name written on our “I Support Vinyl” permanent display, a tribute to everyone who contributed to the project’s success.  (Your contribution includes shipping in the U.S.  Please add $15 for international shipping). 

 




$500 Personal Shopper/Headhunter, T-Shirt, Tote & Sticker Pack

Limited to the FIRST FIVE backers. Looking for something special? We never know what will come through our doors. We’ll keep a listing of your top 5 desires and notify you immediately if one of them should show, giving you first crack at its purchase (psst…at our cost!). This does not apply to any Record Store Day releases. Don’t forget to wear your new, favorite shirt when you come to pick up your special request and put it in your tote.  Final design and colors may vary slightly. We' ll ask your style#/size/sex preference after the campaign ends.  PLUS your name written on our “I Support Vinyl” permanent display, a tribute to everyone who contributed to the project’s success. (Your contribution includes shipping the shirt within the U.S. Does not include shipping of any other items. Not available for international shipping.) (5 available)

 

                                          




$1000 Print Collector/Hero

THANK YOU SO MUCH! YOU are our Hero! We’ve got something very special for you – VERY limited edition signed silkscreened solo show gallery posters. You’ll receive one of each of the first 5 shows, sure to be collectibles. Only the supporters in this category, the featured artist and the curator will receive these silkscreened prints. All other prints will be giclee reproductions without the special color variant. PLUS, your name or company logo will be prominently displayed in our store on the “I Support Vinyl” permanent display, a tribute to everyone who contributed to the project’s success. PLUS, A Combo Pack: 2 Pin & Sticker Packs, a Tote and T-Shirt.  Designs by Sherry.   Final design and colors may vary slightly. We' ll ask your style#/size/sex preference after the campaign ends. (Your contribution includes shipping in the U.S. Not available for international shipping.) (10 available)

 

  

         




$2500 Assistant Curator/Angel

THANK YOU SO MUCH! You truly are an Angel in the city of Angels. Ever wanted to know what it was like to curate a gallery show? Now you can assist Sherry in everything from art selection to the opening of one show, getting a behind the scenes look and personal experience. PLUS, your name or company logo prominently displayed in our store on the “I Support Vinyl” permanent display, a tribute to everyone who contributed to the project’s success. 2 Combo Packs. 4 Pin & Sticker Packs. 2 Totes and 2 T-Shirts.  Designs by Sherry.  Final design and colors may vary slightly. We' ll ask your style#/size/sex preference after the campaign ends. (Your contribution includes shipping in the U.S. Not available for international shipping.) Curator travel expenses are not included. (3 available)

 

                 




$5000 Royal Founder/Rock Star

THANK YOU SO MUCH! You truly are a ROCK STAR! Feel like Elton John in Tower and shop privately! Let us treat you like royalty. We’ll open the store early or stay late just for you (Does not apply to Record Store Day, the day before or the day after). Also, your name or company logo will be prominently displayed as a FOUNDER in our store on the “I Support Vinyl” permanent display, a tribute to everyone who contributed to the project’s success. PLUS receive 3 Combo Packs - 6 Pin & Sticker Packs, 3 Totes and 3 T-Shirts. Designs by Sherry.  Final design and colors may vary slightly. We' ll ask your style#/size/sex preference after the campaign ends. (Your contribution includes shipping in the U.S. Not available for international shipping). Royal Founder travel expenses are not included.

  



Please share our campaign on your social media sites and email lists. Thank you all for your interest and support!


FAQ (Frequently Asked Questions)

When will I get my cool stuff?  Our fundraising campaign ends August 23rd. We will begin production immediately afterward and anticipate delivery of most items before November.

How do I let you know my T-shirt style#, size and sex?  After the campaign ends, we will contact you for this information.

What if my shirt doesn't fit. Can I send it back? Unfortunately, shirts (and other perks) are nonrefundable and no exchanges can be made.
story_txt:
Pop Obscure brings you Records and Art!
Help support our shop in the Fashion District near the Historic Core in downtown Los Angeles
and we’ll hook you up with Tote Bags, T-Shirts, Stickers, Pins, Original Artwork,
and In-Store perks!What is Pop Obscure?A new independent record store in downtown Los Angeles! We carry new and used vinyl - (there's nothing like being surrounded by thousands of pieces of music and art).  We also have an art gallery where we feature single artists as well as curated group shows. Did I mention we have a small stage? Can't wait for those great drop-in jams! Secret shows? Fingers crossed!

Who is behind Pop Obscure?
Hello Everyone. My name is Sherry Lee and
together with Dustin Lane, we've just opened Pop Obscure Records and Art
Gallery.  We are two creative people who
love - you guessed it - music and art! (and motorcycles too!)  Our passion from early on has always been a love for vinyl and music.  We both grew up as record store kids.  We found each other, started a band, got married and have been together ever since.  Dustin
has spent the last 2 decades in retail and entertainment production industries. Independently, he’s made a few music videos, 2 movie shorts, a full length feature
and has even written a book and a few scripts.  I’m currently enjoying my 16th
year at Freestyle Photographic Supplies where I embrace my art-making side
with unique prints. As a freelancer, I have shown my work in various galleries, commercial print and continue to collect and create images. I am now
pulling double duty as we get back to our roots, become independent and create an opportunity for
our community to experience the fruits of our dreams and enjoy our favorite things right along with us.  Location Location Location!Downtown Los Angeles is enjoying a boom of new growth
and renovation. We’ve read that we are in the midst of some 90 projects just in
the downtown area alone. New buildings ranging from a new Federal Courthouse
and Wilshire Grand Tower (to be the tallest building on the West Coast) to
various hotels, retail spaces and over 5000 new housing units are all being
constructed in a very small area.We
have been lucky enough to find a great space right in the middle of all of it.
We are a new independent record store in downtown and we are within easy
walking distance of The Ace Hotel, Orpheum Theater, Clifton’s Cafeteria and
Grand Central Market, to the galleries on Spring Street to the Regent Theater
and Nickel Diner on Main, to the Fashion District and Flower Mart. Did I
mention we are right next to a yummy Mexican restaurant and a parking lot?
Instead of heading to a coffee house where
everyone is plugged in and all alone; come visit us! We would like to offer you
a place to decompress. A place to enter a zen zone, while flipping through new
and used records; a place to enjoy art, good company and friendly conversation;
a place to meet new friends, and collect and build your life’s soundtrack; and,
if you’re a visual artist, we would like to offer you a chance to be seen, too.
We believe in supporting the arts and are looking forward to in-store events
and gallery openings to show off some of the best local talent in the world.
Look,
living in a big city can be overwhelming. We know first hand. But it can also
be amazing! Ultimately, we will offer an opportunity to escape the daily grind, if
only for a little while. You’ll find yourself in a place of discovery and inspiration.
And you’ll have a chance to score cool Record Store Day releases – That’s
right, because we’ll be "the" record store in “downtown”! We hope Pop Obscure
Records will be your place to collect or contribute something tangible. With
your support we can all be successful. 
Remember – Music and Art make
everything better!
Why WE need YOU.
While we had hoped to bootstrap
our entire enterprise on our own, the project, and interest in it has grown. The
reality is we do need your help. It's time to fight for our dream.  We’ve cut costs as much as possible by
electing to design, build, and try to do everything ourselves. We gutted the
building, relied on the generosity of a few friends to help paint
and lay carpet and we've opened the doors to our welcoming neighborhood. But, some of the unexpected costs and setbacks have added up. We are behind and we
still need to continue to fill the bins and properly outfit the gallery. 
Why should you help?Together we can make art happen!
When you support our project you are supporting the opportunity for creatives
and the collectors who both share a love of audible, visual and tangible art, to
come together in a single space. We hope that our perks are something cool you
would like to purchase. All physical items were designed by us and produced by
local artists and businesses. We believe in supporting our community and we
know you do too. All monies raised through this project will get our store off
the ground and into the community. Thank you for being a part of our team!Other ways You can Help.
If you can't contribute, we understand, but that doesn't mean you can't help. We are just 2 people, but with you behind us we can create an army of evangelists and angels. We need you to make some noise and get the word out on your social media accounts, emails and even when you are talking to people on your phone - don't forget to use the Indiegogo Share tools!  Every little bit helps and will get us closer to our goal.   If you will spread the word, we would be forever grateful.
Rewards and Cool Perks
In exchange for your support, we
have various rewards ranging from stickers, totes and t-shirts to having your
art shown in a gallery. Contributing at any level will earn a permanent place
for your name to appear as a supporter of Pop Obscure Records and Art Gallery. Help us with our journey for as little as $5.
$5 I support Vinyl
A sincere Thank You with a Shout Out on Facebook!  Every Dollar Helps!  Come in for
a handshake and a hug. See your name - a legacy - on permanent view in the
store, on a piece of art that Sherry will create as a tribute to everyone who
contributed to the project’s success. 
$15 Pins & Sticker Pack
All designs by Sherry. These
vinyl stickers are great on bumpers and laptops. Then let everyone know you’re
one of the cool kids by wearing your Pop Obscure Pins. (Your contribution includes shipping in the U.S.  Please add $5 for international shipping).$30 Record-Toting Tote Bag & Sticker Pack
Carry your favorite records to
and from your home in this reusable cotton canvas tote. Great for the grocery
store too! Design by Sherry. Final design and
colors may vary slightly. PLUS your name written on our “I Support Vinyl” permanent display, a tribute to
everyone who contributed to the project’s success. (Your contribution includes shipping in the U.S.  Please add $10 for international shipping).   
$45 Cool Record Store T-shirt + 1 Sticker Pack
Hey, you’re off the clock. Time
to don your new, favorite record store t-shirt! All shirts are American made in
men’s and women’s sizes. Designs by Sherry.   Final design and colors may vary
slightly. We' ll ask your style#/size/sex
preference after the campaign ends.  PLUS your name written on our “I Support
Vinyl” permanent display, a tribute to everyone who contributed to the
project’s success. (Your contribution includes shipping in the U.S. Please add
$10 for international shipping).   
 
$85 Vinyl Wall Clock & Sticker Pack
Can’t find your phone? Power
Out? No worries! Your battery run vinyl wall clock will keep time for you and
make sure you’re not late to the next gallery opening! Made from a real vinyl
record and made into a clock by Sherry herself. Final design may vary slightly.
PLUS your name written on our “I Support Vinyl” permanent display, a tribute to
everyone who contributed to the project’s success. (Your contribution includes shipping in the U.S.  Not available for international shipping).  (5 available)

preference after the campaign ends.  PLUS your name written on our “I Support Vinyl” permanent display, a tribute to
everyone who contributed to the project’s success.  (Your contribution includes shipping in the U.S.  Please add $10 for international shipping).

story:
Short Summary

My name is Thom Shepherd and I am the 2016 CMA of Texas Songwriter of the Year.  Originally from St. Louis, MO, and a graduate of George Mason University in Virginia, I moved to Nashville soon after to pursue a music career. Five years ago, I moved to Austin, TX to tour full time and share my songs and stories with the world. Along with my wife Coley and our dog Odie, we perform and travel the country from Florida to Washington State in our American Dream coach.

This project has been my passion and has taken over a year in the making.  I can't wait to get it out and into the hands of all the fans who have already heard many of these songs at our live shows. "Saltwater Cowboy" defines who I am as an artist - one who loves the tropical and Western lifestyles.  

What We Need & What You Get

My goal for this project is $6500. That should cover recording the vocals on about 7 of the remaining songs, mixing and mastering all 12 songs, taking photos and doing graphics for the project, and getting CDs manufactured. 

I'm basically asking folks to pre-order the CD now to help cover the costs.  But if you'd like to contribute more, there are other packages you can get with a larger donation. 

The Impact

Our album projects are our life. They are what drive our success as artists. The excitement of a new project opens the door for us to reach new markets, as well as return to our tried and true favorite venues with something new and interesting to fuel our live shows, and are the building blocks of career longevity. 

New projects allow us to grow as artists. My goal is that this project will be Album of the Year at the 2017 TRMA Awards. 

Risks & Challenges

Touring is expensive but worth it. It takes a lot of money to complete a project without any definite guarantee of making your investment back, in addition to all the costs associated with traveling cross country.   

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help out on this project financially, please tell a friend or share it on social media, and let as many people know about it as you can.
