story:
Porch Stomp was conceived in the spring of 2014 when Nicholas Horner, a charismatic, straw-haired singer from the wilds of Central Pennsylvania began working with Make Music New York (MMNY) to produce their annual celebration of outdoor music all around New York City on the summer solstice.  Brought on as a fellow, Horner was suggested to create and promote a special project with the goal of connecting to the NYC folk community.

As classically trained vocalist, this feat would surely be somewhat of a stretch- he threw himself into the folk music world, frequenting bluegrass and old time jams, open mics and folk music concerts all around the city.  It was at Sheriff Bob’s “Good Times” jam, one of the longest-standing jams in NYC, that he met Theo Boguszewski, a dancer and music-appreciator who was learning to play fiddle.

Nick enlisted Theo’s help to recruit musicians to take part in the festival. The first annual Porch Stomp took place on a beautifully sunny Saturday, and was viewed by many as a great success. Musicians, dancers and music-lovers travelled from across the city to Governors Island for the free, participatory celebration of the summer solstice and american folk music. The stately old officers’ houses in Nolan Park felt more like a neighborhood than a festival venue, and folks walked away feeling more connected to each other and to some of the musical traditions that have shaped our country.

Over the past four years, Theo and Nick have continued to grow the festival by partnering with committed, relevant community organizations such as the City Stompers, Brooklyn Bluegrass Collective, Brookladelphia, Cowgirl Seahorse, and community leaders such as Hilary Hawke and David Harvey, among many, many others.

Porch Stomp has also grown to have a national reputation amongst artists and music lovers alike  (In fact, Theo and Nick literally drove cross-country in the summer of 2016 to spread the good word)! Last year, Porch Stomp 2017 boasted over 70 performers on 10 “stages” (or porches) in spite of torrential rain, serving as yet another testament to the one-of-a-kind experience that the Porch Stomp provides each year!

Philosophically speaking, Porch Stomp focuses on inclusivity rather than hierarchy. There are no stars performers or headlining slots, but rather a space where musicians and music lovers of every age, background and ability level are invited to share and engage ( a mission closely aligning with both MMNY and their predecessor, the French Festival “Fete de la Musique”). Porch Stomp is the place where artists get to share their music with folk communities around NYC and beyond, and make connections that will sustain them throughout their musical career.

We’ve been amazed and humbled by how this festival has grown over the past five years!  In the tradition of folk music expression, we will continue to carry the torch of inclusive celebration while looking back upon our shared musical heritage as a framework for moving forward.  

In the past, the Porch Stomp team has produced the festival on a budget of less than $1500 (often from contributions made by fellow artists and festival goers), money which has been immediately funneled back into the Porch Stomp community by way of marketing and outreach costs, micro-stipends for curators that have to hire house bands, and upkeep fees such as website hosting and other incurred expenses.  Furthermore, Porch Stomp is entirely volunteer run- Nick, Theo and an incredible team of staff all give their time and energy because they believe in the mission of Porch Stomp. However, as our community continues to grow, so does our need for financial support! Besides--- we got to wondering what a little more money could really do...

Well, here’s what we figured out:

We could invite even more curators to Porch Stomp, meaning more artists! We could offer amenities like free food and free beer for performers! We could market the festival city-wide, and produce mini concerts leading up to the festival to increase exposure and make sure our artists get seen by the most festival-goers possible! We could create really cool Porch Stomp swag and giveaways! We could have every folk community that is important to anyone in New York City represented at our festival! We could spread so much joy and love through music and dance that just maybe, for 5 sweet hours on Governors Island, we would all forget about the long winters, broken down subways, unusual smells, high rent, leaky pipes… you get the idea!

As corny as it all sounds, Porch Stomp allows us to cultivate something tangible and incredibly important in New York City: community.  We believe that strong communities have a real impact on peoples’ lives. Community has the power to bring us peace and sense of mind in what can be an otherwise uninviting and isolating city.  In supporting Porch Stomp, you are supporting a dance and music tradition that brings people together! Please donate to our campaign, and we can’t wait to see you this year on June 24th!

----

Aren’t able to contribute financially? Help us out just by spreading the word! Share our campaign with your friends, and tell them why Porch Stomp is meaningful to you!
story_txt:
Porch Stomp was conceived in the spring of 2014 when Nicholas Horner, a charismatic, straw-haired singer from the wilds of Central Pennsylvania began working with Make Music New York (MMNY) to produce their annual celebration of outdoor music all around New York City on the summer solstice.  Brought on as a fellow, Horner was suggested to create and promote a special project with the goal of connecting to the NYC folk community.
As classically trained vocalist, this feat would surely be somewhat of a stretch- he threw himself into the folk music world, frequenting bluegrass and old time jams, open mics and folk music concerts all around the city.  It was at Sheriff Bob’s “Good Times” jam, one of the longest-standing jams in NYC, that he met Theo Boguszewski, a dancer and music-appreciator who was learning to play fiddle.
Nick enlisted Theo’s help to recruit musicians to take part in the festival. The first annual Porch Stomp took place on a beautifully sunny Saturday, and was viewed by many as a great success. Musicians, dancers and music-lovers travelled from across the city to Governors Island for the free, participatory celebration of the summer solstice and american folk music. The stately old officers’ houses in Nolan Park felt more like a neighborhood than a festival venue, and folks walked away feeling more connected to each other and to some of the musical traditions that have shaped our country.
Over the past four years, Theo and Nick have continued to grow the festival by partnering with committed, relevant community organizations such as the City Stompers, Brooklyn Bluegrass Collective, Brookladelphia, Cowgirl Seahorse, and community leaders such as Hilary Hawke and David Harvey, among many, many others.
Porch Stomp has also grown to have a national reputation amongst artists and music lovers alike  (In fact, Theo and Nick literally drove cross-country in the summer of 2016 to spread the good word)! Last year, Porch Stomp 2017 boasted over 70 performers on 10 “stages” (or porches) in spite of torrential rain, serving as yet another testament to the one-of-a-kind experience that the Porch Stomp provides each year!
Philosophically speaking, Porch Stomp focuses on inclusivity rather than hierarchy. There are no stars performers or headlining slots, but rather a space where musicians and music lovers of every age, background and ability level are invited to share and engage ( a mission closely aligning with both MMNY and their predecessor, the French Festival “Fete de la Musique”). Porch Stomp is the place where artists get to share their music with folk communities around NYC and beyond, and make connections that will sustain them throughout their musical career.
We’ve been amazed and humbled by how this festival has grown over the past five years!  In the tradition of folk music expression, we will continue to carry the torch of inclusive celebration while looking back upon our shared musical heritage as a framework for moving forward.  
In the past, the Porch Stomp team has produced the festival on a budget of less than $1500 (often from contributions made by fellow artists and festival goers), money which has been immediately funneled back into the Porch Stomp community by way of marketing and outreach costs, micro-stipends for curators that have to hire house bands, and upkeep fees such as website hosting and other incurred expenses.  Furthermore, Porch Stomp is entirely volunteer run- Nick, Theo and an incredible team of staff all give their time and energy because they believe in the mission of Porch Stomp. However, as our community continues to grow, so does our need for financial support! Besides--- we got to wondering what a little more money could really do...
Well, here’s what we figured out:
We could invite even more curators to Porch Stomp, meaning more artists! We could offer amenities like free food and free beer for performers! We could market the festival city-wide, and produce mini concerts leading up to the festival to increase exposure and make sure our artists get seen by the most festival-goers possible! We could create really cool Porch Stomp swag and giveaways! We could have every folk community that is important to anyone in New York City represented at our festival! We could spread so much joy and love through music and dance that just maybe, for 5 sweet hours on Governors Island, we would all forget about the long winters, broken down subways, unusual smells, high rent, leaky pipes… you get the idea!
As corny as it all sounds, Porch Stomp allows us to cultivate something tangible and incredibly important in New York City: community.  We believe that strong communities have a real impact on peoples’ lives. Community has the power to bring us peace and sense of mind in what can be an otherwise uninviting and isolating city.  In supporting Porch Stomp, you are supporting a dance and music tradition that brings people together! Please donate to our campaign, and we can’t wait to see you this year on June 24th!
----
Aren’t able to contribute financially? Help us out just by spreading the word! Share our campaign with your friends, and tell them why Porch Stomp is meaningful to you!

story:
MOUNTAIN TIME 

Thank you for your interest in my new release, Mountain Time.  I can't tell you how excited I am for you to finally hear it.  

I mentioned in my campaign video, "I'm not trying to find a new sound.  I'm just trying to sound like myself".  That's where my journey to the mountains and Mountain Time began. 

I've always been a songwriter.  Ever since the first time I placed pen to paper, it's all I've ever wanted to do.  Everything I've done musically has been an extension of the songwriting process.  I moved to Nashville when I was 21 years old because I wanted to see and learn how great songs were written and how great records were produced.  I worked an unpaid internship and lived off the studio's leftover catering until the studio manager decided I was good enough to be paid something minimal.  


                                                                        Me at 21 years old, 2005

 

I never released a solo album while living and working in Nashville.  Why not?  Well, I just didn't have the songs.  See, as a songwriter, you're only as good as your experiences.  What I mean by that is, how can you write a love song if you've never been in love?  Or how can you write a song that tells a story if you don't have a story to tell?  So you see, I couldn't have written the songs for Mountain Time at any previous point in my life.

It took moving to the Catskill Mountains to write these songs.  It took an engagement being canceled.  It took a 14-hour drive through West Texas without air conditioning.  It took losing a sense of purpose and rediscovering who I am.  It took finding a way to hang on to dignity with dirt on my face.  It took being able to smile when reminded of painful subjects.  It took learning how to be unapologetic about who I am.  And it took looking at who I've been and realizing it was past time to be better.

Giving the songs on Mountain Time the sonic representation they deserved was just as daunting as overcoming all of the above.  I worked with Hudson Valley Producer and Engineer Tod Levine for two years to complete this album.  I stressed over every guitar tone, every part I played, every lyric I sang and every new instrument I picked up.  By the time the album was halfway done, it had begun guiding me towards the sound it was demanding.  It guided me to purchase new instruments and try gauges of strings I'd never used.  It asked for tunings I'd never tuned and made me borrow other people's instruments and effects pedals to create the sounds the album needed.  

Instruments played on Mountain Time

                                                                                                            All the pedals used to make Mountain Time

I'm not trying to show you all the instruments and effects pedals I used and played during the creation of this album to impress you.  What I'm attempting to illustrate is a picture of how this album consumed me and all of my creative energies, to their furthest parameters.  It presented challenge after challenge and required a nuanced thoughtfulness I didn't know my creative consideration was capable of executing.  This album was not an experiment, as in... I did not enter the studio wondering what sound I would achieve and arrive at an end result.  I entered the studio with a hazy vision I could only imagine being clear and committed myself towards bringing that vision into focus.  

I was fortunate to have an amazing engineer and co-conspirator with me on this project, and Tod Levine and Magnetic North Studios have been instrumental in bringing this album to life.  

The other side of this story is that I live in a small mountain town called Saugerties, NY, and every bit of inspiration needed to complete this project was taken from the Catskill Mountains that surround it.  This little town and the greater Hudson Valley has been so supportive of independent music that you can't help but want to give back in any way you can.  

That's why I've decided to hold the release show for Mountain Time in Saugerties, right in the heart of the village.  The place where all the local shows used to happen was in a little place called "Dave's Coffee Shop", and folks in town still talk about how awesome that place was for live music.  The truth is that Saugerties just hasn't had the same vibe without that place serving as a venue.  




Saugerties and the area around Woodstock, NY (Ulster County) has a wealth of talent in the form of musicians, artists, sculptors, and that talent itself serves as a continual source of inspiration for myself and other artists.  My hopes are that the release party for Mountian Time is successful enough to encourage the owners of Love Bites (formerly Dave's) to host live music on an ongoing basis.  I have no doubt that Love Bites will benefit from regular shows and I have no doubt that the village of Saugerties will be there to support Love Bites with their future events.




With this release party, I'll be showcasing two other local Folk & Americana groups whose music I thoroughly enjoy.  If you haven't seen Hallow Dog or The Mead Mountain Resonators, I have no doubt you'll enjoy their sound as much as I do.  The release party on May 19th is going to be a Roots music event that will keep the village of Saugerties buzzing for days and weeks to come.  

 


So now that I've told you all there is to know about Mountain Time and the album release party, I should tell you about the marketing efforts I've committed towards this project.  These days, it’s a video-centric world out there and as a musician, it’s become increasingly difficult to spread your content online without the power of video.  Given that I did not have the financial resources to hire a cinematographer, I self-produced the campaign video and two lyric videos I’ll be releasing before the close of this campaign.  This has been a blessing in disguise as in the process of producing these videos, I’ve pretty much learned Adobe Photoshop, Premiere and After Effects and now I can bring you videos in the future. 

All of my merchandise and my first two album copies are printed and packaged by small businesses local to Saugerties, NY (Turning Mill).  

By pledging to this preorder campaign, you are supporting all the following:

  • Local business in Saugerties, NY (Magnetic North Studios, Turning Mill, Love Bites)
  • The local music scene in Saugerties, NY
  • The next album
  • Future events
  • Future videos

The Impact

Being a songwriter has meant certain things to me at certain points in my life.  The one thing I know for sure is that I have to listen for and honor this voice inside of me that whispers and urges to express itself through lyrics, melody, and chords.  Any pledge towards this campaign helps me towards the next big inspiration.  My creative endeavors will only get more ambitious and I am actively working towards streamlining a workflow that will video document them along the way.  By supporting this campaign, you are helping me bring you along for the journey, every step of the way.  

Risks & Challenges

May 10th is a big day for me.  That's a Thursday, and I'll be mailing everything out that day so that local folks will get their shipment the following day.  Feel free to send me a message to see how things are coming along.  julestaylormusic@gmail.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign on all social media platforms!  :)

Come to the album release show and bring your friends! 

Subscribe to my mail list to keep in touch:  www.JulesTaylorMusic.com/subscribe

Like my page on Facebook:  www.facebook.com/julestaylormusic 

Find me on Spotify or YouTube.  Follow me on Instagram.

Thank you for supporting local music, and independent musicians.  I would not be able to do any of this without your support.  <3

story:
Short Summary

Hello!

My name is Flavio Silva, and I am a Brazilian guitarist and composer based in New York. I've had the opportunity to live and work in a few different countries during the past 9 years, including Belgium, the Netherlands and most recently, NYC. 

These years abroad gave me a lot of great experiences such as playing several festivals in Europe, such as the North Sea Jazz Festival, Delft Jazz fest, Gronau Jazz Festival, Langnau Jazz nights, Koektebell Jazz party, among others.

Since leaving Brazil in 2009, I learned a lot and my music transformed into something very personal and with a very clear goal: To be able to communicate with the public through instrumental music. With that in mind I want to present to you my newest project, entitled Break Free.

This project is my call for joy, hope, love and justice through music, and consists of 7 authorial songs and one cover by the Brazilian composer Chico Buarque. I had the privilege of working with some of my best friends and amazing musicians in the New York scene, including Curtis Nowosad on Drums, Alex Apolo Ayala on Bass, James Francies on Piano and Rhodes, Michael Mayo on Vocals and the great Seamus Blake on Saxophone.

This project is almost finished and I'm launching this Indiegogo campaign in order to complete it.

The main idea of Break Free is to connect the music and musicians with the public in a different way. Jazz and instrumental music can be often very complex and hard to follow by the listener, creating a gap between the listener and the music.  As I normally say, my main goal was to have my mother (who is not a musician) to feel good, enjoy, clap or tap her foot while listening to Break Free, so, I found a way to write music that has a strong musical content and can still be enjoyed by both musicians and people with no musical background. With your help, I will be able to bring this record alive and connect with more people than you can ever imagine!

 

What I Need & What You Get

 

In order to finish this project, I need $5000.

This amount will be divided into the following aspects:

-Mastering the album in May 2018

-Cover Design

-Marketing/PR

-Printing of physical CD's

-Distribution of the album

I prepared a few rewards for the backers. As usual, the more you help me, the better your reward will be!

We will have digital downloads, signed physical copies of Break Free, signed charts of one of the songs in the album, Skype/private lessons, an unreleased bonus track(not included in the record), a solo guitar house concert and a full band house concert.

You can find the actual amounts right next to this text!

What happens if I don't achieve the total amount?

In case the entire amount is not achieved, I will focus on the finishing the audio part of the record, the cover design and the printing part, those are the priorities in order to complete this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

I completely understand that sometimes it is hard to help fund this type of vision/project, so, even if you can't help me financially, you can still help me by sharing the link to this project and tell your friends about it. That will be of great value as well.

I wish you the best for reading this project and if you feel like it, help me make Break Free a reality!

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Daryl Boyer. I am a Christian singer/songwriter and recording artist with a heart to deliver music to people that is inspiring and filled with hope to navigate life and the struggles we all face each and every day. As an independent recording artist, it is very difficult to manage and take on the huge cost involved to produce and record a major album release that will make it out onto the airwaves and TV where the songs can impact the listener on a daily basis. Daryl Boyer Ministries was founded in 2015 with the sole purpose of getting music and the hope of a life in Jesus out to the world with whatever tools and resources we could assemble. Music is a powerful tool that cuts straight to the soul and core of us all as people. It can often reach out to us when other avenues can not. Since our minds are so receptive to song, it is often one of the best places we are influenced to receive a message of help, hope, and truth. In addition to working hard daily to provide for my family as a carpenter and part-time Worship Leader, I have dedicated my life's spare time to reaching the broken hearted, hopeless, oppressed, and afflicted. The opportunity to have access to a person's heart and mind for a few moments through song can be a powerful opportunity to make a lasting difference for so many.
  • So the question comes... What are we able to accomplish by releasing a high quality music release? In short we achieve much greater access and success to minister to the needs of people when it is done right and done well. Fact is, we all know presentation and quality is important so that people will take interest in what is put in front of them by ensuring it sounds good and carries a strong relatable message. Second, ministry requires investment. It is crucial to be able to afford paying for the platform from which we are able to deliver the message/songs so that people can hear it worldwide with a wide range of access to it. The cost of marketing and getting the songs firmly established with radio and media is not without significant cost. We have worked hard to establish a path to be connected in the music industry for getting it out there on radio, tv, and into stores. Having these connections is awesome, but these connections also require the funds to make it happen. Let me just be clear that this campaign is not a money making opportunity for us directly. All funds go directly to the cost of this ministry. We are interested in reaching people with a message of hope they can connect with and have full access to. This music ministry is a labor of love, one that exists to be a blessing to others. We truly need your help and contributions to help us make this happen. There are many hurting and searching people all around us that need the message found within the music we are bringing to the world.

What We Need & What You Get

A few months back we raised the funds to cover the recording and release of the first single "Never Looking Back" for this new album using the platform Go Fund Me. The song went out to the world just as planned with great success and blessing on it. That first song currently sits at a #3 position in Christian music charts. By having our ministries music positioned well within the charts of the industry, it truly enables our current and future songs to be heard over and over by many across the world. What a wonderful opportunity to help in making a difference. We are thankful for those who helped in getting the ball rolling as the doors of opportunity opened for us to build momentum and establish a platform for ministry to happen on a large scale. We have prayed and worked hard in writing these new songs for this album. We are doing all we can to ensure the rest of the album will be just as powerful to make an impact. As you know getting most anything of value accomplished in life requires both money and hard work. Along with your prayers, what we really need are people with a heart to help us deliver our message and further open the door. By contributing financially, you assist us in raising the funds needed for this album release, thus furthering the work of the ministry. In addition to the album release, our hope and future goal is to get out on the road this year more as a ministry. In time as God enables this to happen more, we will be able to connect more deeply on a personal level using the music as an entry point for sharing more detail about the songs and what is behind them. This will give us opportunity to share further about the hope everyone can have as they navigate through what can be a very trying life with often very broken circumstances. Our music ministry philosophy is to reach people where they are at in life, right in the midst of the struggles they face. We want to honor Jesus Christ as we share His grace and love for each person we can connect with. For us and our ministry, there is nothing that holds greater value above seeing people restored and changed for the better. Nothing is more rewarding than seeing people set free from the things that have held them back and held them down. It is powerful and exciting to see Jesus move in their lives.

Supporting this project is an opportunity for you to invest in the music of our ministry, but most importantly you get a chance to help others as they find victory over the struggles they face each day. This is ultimately an investment into people's lives, that is priceless. Would you partner with us financially as we make this album and step out this year to accomplish reaching out to people all around the globe?

  • What we need to raise financially to make the album a success in both production and release to the radio/television is $15,000. This will be the base amount needed as a minimum to accomplish getting the job done professionally while making an impact and being at the level of quality required. These funds will pay the studio, producer, musicians, physical production, promotion & marketing, and all people required to get the job done. Again, there is no money in this for me, these funds will simply cover the cost.  We will trust the Lord for providing any additional funding that we may need as we step out to get out on the road to share in greater detail as the year moves forward for ministry.
  • You can hear what media and radio is saying about our project and learn more about our ministry and music at the following web site: www.darylboyer.com
  • As a way of saying thank you for your contribution we would like to give you something in return for your support. We will be setting up a rewards package for each one that contributes. We will be awarding gifts bundled together that will include things like free music CD's, an early digital download of the new album, social media perks and shoutouts, various clothing, personal time spent with the artist, Your name in the cd credits, and a free concerts to the higher giving tiers. (More details on this in the perks section)
  • We are believing in faith that we will fully fund our needed financial goal to be in full production by mid January 2018. As soon as the funds are raised we intend to begin in full swing.

Once again, we want to thank you for your contribution to our album project and the countless lives we look forward to reaching. 

Colossians 3:17New International Version (NIV)

17) And whatever you do, whether in word or deed, do it all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.

Colossians 3:23 New International Version (NIV)

23) Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for human masters,

Blessings,

Daryl Boyer (Daryl Boyer Ministries)

Additional Ways You Can Help

  • We are asking that you would also assist us in getting the word out to friends, family, and those you think may take interest in helping with our campaign via social media, email, and word of mouth.
  • Be sure to utilize the Indiegogo share tools to make sharing the campaign with others easier!

For Even More Artist And Ministry Information Visit Our Website:   www.darylboyer.com
story_txt:
Short Summary

My name is Daryl Boyer. I am a Christian singer/songwriter and recording artist with a heart to deliver music to people that is inspiring and filled with hope to navigate life and the struggles we all face each and every day. As an independent recording artist, it is very difficult to manage and take on the huge cost involved to produce and record a major album release that will make it out onto the airwaves and TV where the songs can impact the listener on a daily basis. Daryl Boyer Ministries was founded in 2015 with the sole purpose of getting music and the hope of a life in Jesus out to the world with whatever tools and resources we could assemble. Music is a powerful tool that cuts straight to the soul and core of us all as people. It can often reach out to us when other avenues can not. Since our minds are so receptive to song, it is often one of the best places we are influenced to receive a message of help, hope, and truth. In addition to working hard daily to provide for my family as a carpenter and part-time Worship Leader, I have dedicated my life's spare time to reaching the broken hearted, hopeless, oppressed, and afflicted. The opportunity to have access to a person's heart and mind for a few moments through song can be a powerful opportunity to make a lasting difference for so many.
So the question comes... What are we able to accomplish by releasing a high quality music release? In short we achieve much greater access and success to minister to the needs of people when it is done right and done well. Fact is, we all know presentation and quality is important so that people will take interest in what is put in front of them by ensuring it sounds good and carries a strong relatable message. Second, ministry requires investment. It is crucial to be able to afford paying for the platform from which we are able to deliver the message/songs so that people can hear it worldwide with a wide range of access to it. The cost of marketing and getting the songs firmly established with radio and media is not without significant cost. We have worked hard to establish a path to be connected in the music industry for getting it out there on radio, tv, and into stores. Having these connections is awesome, but these connections also require the funds to make it happen. Let me just be clear that this campaign is not a money making opportunity for us directly. All funds go directly to the cost of this ministry. We are interested in reaching people with a message of hope they can connect with and have full access to. This music ministry is a labor of love, one that exists to be a blessing to others. We truly need your help and contributions to help us make this happen. There are many hurting and searching people all around us that need the message found within the music we are bringing to the world.


What We Need & What You Get
A few months back we raised the funds to cover the recording and release of the first single "Never Looking Back" for this new album using the platform Go Fund Me. The song went out to the world just as planned with great success and blessing on it. That first song currently sits at a #3 position in Christian music charts. By having our ministries music positioned well within the charts of the industry, it truly enables our current and future songs to be heard over and over by many across the world. What a wonderful opportunity to help in making a difference. We are thankful for those who helped in getting the ball rolling as the doors of opportunity opened for us to build momentum and establish a platform for ministry to happen on a large scale. We have prayed and worked hard in writing these new songs for this album. We are doing all we can to ensure the rest of the album will be just as powerful to make an impact. As you know getting most anything of value accomplished in life requires both money and hard work. Along with your prayers, what we really need are people with a heart to help us deliver our message and further open the door. By contributing financially, you assist us in raising the funds needed for this album release, thus furthering the work of the ministry. In addition to the album release, our hope and future goal is to get out on the road this year more as a ministry. In time as God enables this to happen more, we will be able to connect more deeply on a personal level using the music as an entry point for sharing more detail about the songs and what is behind them. This will give us opportunity to share further about the hope everyone can have as they navigate through what can be a very trying life with often very broken circumstances. Our music ministry philosophy is to reach people where they are at in life, right in the midst of the struggles they face. We want to honor Jesus Christ as we share His grace and love for each person we can connect with. For us and our ministry, there is nothing that holds greater value above seeing people restored and changed for the better. Nothing is more rewarding than seeing people set free from the things that have held them back and held them down. It is powerful and exciting to see Jesus move in their lives.
Supporting this project is an opportunity for you to invest in the music of our ministry, but most importantly you get a chance to help others as they find victory over the struggles they face each day. This is ultimately an investment into people's lives, that is priceless. Would you partner with us financially as we make this album and step out this year to accomplish reaching out to people all around the globe?

What we need to raise financially to make the album a success in both production and release to the radio/television is $15,000. This will be the base amount needed as a minimum to accomplish getting the job done professionally while making an impact and being at the level of quality required. These funds will pay the studio, producer, musicians, physical production, promotion & marketing, and all people required to get the job done. Again, there is no money in this for me, these funds will simply cover the cost.  We will trust the Lord for providing any additional funding that we may need as we step out to get out on the road to share in greater detail as the year moves forward for ministry.
You can hear what media and radio is saying about our project and learn more about our ministry and music at the following web site: www.darylboyer.com

As a way of saying thank you for your contribution we would like to give you something in return for your support. We will be setting up a rewards package for each one that contributes. We will be awarding gifts bundled together that will include things like free music CD's, an early digital download of the new album, social media perks and shoutouts, various clothing, personal time spent with the artist, Your name in the cd credits, and a free concerts to the higher giving tiers. (More details on this in the perks section)
We are believing in faith that we will fully fund our needed financial goal to be in full production by mid January 2018. As soon as the funds are raised we intend to begin in full swing.


Once again, we want to thank you for your contribution to our album project and the countless lives we look forward to reaching. 
Colossians 3:17New International Version (NIV)
17) And whatever you do, whether in word or deed, do it all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.
Colossians 3:23 New International Version (NIV)
23) Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for human masters,
Blessings,
Daryl Boyer (Daryl Boyer Ministries)

Additional Ways You Can Help

We are asking that you would also assist us in getting the word out to friends, family, and those you think may take interest in helping with our campaign via social media, email, and word of mouth.
Be sure to utilize the Indiegogo share tools to make sharing the campaign with others easier!

For Even More Artist And Ministry Information Visit Our Website:   www.darylboyer.com

story:
Short Summary

 

We are San Francisco based rockers Alvie & The Breakfast Pigs! Our band has come a long way since we started three years ago in Tempe Arizona, but we have even greater distances to travel... and hopefully that distance will be traveled in our own tour van! To make this happen we need your HELP! 2017 brought us all over the western half of the United States to places like Austin and Denver; however, renting a van for each trip has become increasingly unsustainable for our budget. To continue this journey we need our own van. Each band member will be contributing a big portion of the total cost of the van, but being in a band is an expensive habit. We need your help to cover all the costs that come with owning including insurance, registration, and having a little money in the bank should we need to repair our new baby. We can't make this happen without your support!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $3500 to reach our goal. All of the funding will go to the purchase of this van first and foremost. 

We have some AWESOME perks that we want YOU to have for donating to us, including Limited edition tapes, CD's, Lathe Records of our music, custom prizes from tour, Etc. Check out the perks to the right of the page for a more complete list---->

We will be posting updates with some sweet photos of the custom artwork, and shirts, so make sure to keep checking this page!

The Impact

By donating to our campaign you will be helping us spread our music to a greater audience, as well as helping us get a van, where we hope to gain some momentum as a band. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We don't require a donation, we understand that times are tough. 
If you are unable to donate but would still like to contribute, please share our campaign with others!

story:
EVOLUTION REVOLUTIONARIES

We're Freerunner, a band formed in Austin, Texas with the goal of inspiring others through music. We've just finished tracking our newest record "Evolution Revolutionaries" in Nashville, TN, but we need a little help finishing it!

  • "Evolution Revolutionaries" is a concept about becoming the change you want to see. It's up to You to make the difference, and you're an Evolution Revolutionary just as much as anyone else. Because of this, All CD copies will be manufactured with 100% recycled materials. We hope this record will inspire you to get out there and create change!
  • "Evolution Revolutionaries" is the third record from songwriting team Todd Siff & Matt Live. Their collective goal is to create personal, heartfelt songs that inspire positivity and togetherness.
  • "Evolution Revolutionaries" was recorded at Cousin Bob's Studio in Nashville, TN with engineer Cameron Davidson. Cousin Bob's is a state of the art recording facility with an amazing instrument collection. Check out the studio for yourself by clicking HERE.
     

What We Need & What You Get
 

  • We are asking for $7000, as the services to create this album are not the most affordable. Mixing will cost us around $3500, $500 for Mastering (making it sound polished), $2500 for physical copies, and $500 for stickers & shirts and other physical merchandise to go along with the album.
  • We have some fun Perks for you! First off, we'll be releasing the first single "Come Alive" in the next two months, and every donation of $5 or more will get you a digital download of it as soon as it comes out. From there, the perks get better! Ranging from physical copies of the album, to meals with the band...you can even buy Matt's guitar! Browse through and see all the fun stuff we have in store for you.
  • We know we say "Kickstarter" in our video, but one benefit of Indiegogo is that if we don't make our goal, we still get to keep our funding. We'll use what we get to work on what we can, but it will take months and months longer for us to finish if we have to fund it all by ourselves.

The Impact

What difference will your contribution make?

  • We practice what we preach, and are Evolution Revolutionaries ourselves. In 2017 alone, Freerunner donated to five registered organizations including OXFAM and the ACLU. We can't wait to see what exciting charities we can help in 2018 as well!
  • Being real here, Freerunner isn't a hobby for us. We want this to be our career. We want to play music professionally for the rest of our lives, tour the world, and play stadiums, and with our hard work and persistance, we know we will. Supporting us here helps us support that dream and make it attainable for us!
     

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • If you could, please Share this campaign on your favorite social media! It would help us immensely if more people knew about our project.
  • Indiegogo has simple Share tools! Just click the icon of the network you would like to Share our campaign on.
  • Give us a LIKE on Facebook at www.facebook.com/freerunnermusic - Venues and record labels look at your number of Likes and make decisions to book you or not just based on that number!

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR TAKING YOUR TIME TO READ THIS. For more information, check out our website at www.freerunnermusic.com

story:
Who are we?

Hello! We are The End of Melancholy  - alternative | gothic metal band from St.-Petersburg, Russia. We combine in our music the emotions of gothic rock and energy of metal.  In 2016 we released our first EP "Playing with Shadows" and music video on the lyric ballad "Dolphins".

 
After this release, we have begun to move into heavier forms of genre and released in 2017 our new music video "The Demon" (video in the head of this page) with the single of the same name.
 
 

Answering the question of one metal magazine, what is this song about:

Olly Lex:

“The thing is that you shouldn’t run away from your Demons - you need to accept them. Finally accept yourself. I showed you mine in this video. You need to understand that it’s not an evil, he is just different. Thanks to his strong qualities, I can get what I want. Everybody has the same and it’s ok”

In 2017/2018 we have performed with such bands as Theatres des Vampires, Hanzel und Gretyl, Centhron and etc., and now we are ready to record and produce our new album.

We have already done a great work on songwriting, and now we are ready to begin the most responsible stage - work at the studio

What We Need & What You Get

The release of the album is not only a record and mixing, it's also a huge cost to promote the album. Without this, people won't hear our music.

What we need:

- Pre-Production days at the studio

- Recording, mixing, and mastering

- Artwork and Booklet design

- Promotion

We estimate 7000 $ - is the minimal sum of money we need to record the new album.

What Happens if We Raise Less?

If we raise less than $ 7,000, the album will be made, in any case, but it will take longer, because we will have to earn this money on our non-musical jobs.

What Happens if We Raise More?

If we manage to raise more than 7000 USD, we will release new music video (will depend on the amount of money collected).

What you get:

In return we offer you the best perks we could think of, which include the digital and physical versions of the album, various merch (special limited edition) and special limited perks - Olly's dresses from the videos "Dolphins" and "The Demon", include attributes, used in the videos.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute there are a lot other ways you can help us out!

Share the campaign on your social media channels, the Indiegogo share tools are great for this!

Tell your friends about the campaign, and ask them to spread the word too!

Contact options:

Contact us over here on Indiegogo

theendofmelancholy@gmail.com

Facebook: facebook.com/theendofmelancholy

Instagram: instagram.com/theendofmelancholy

Thank you for support and interest and stay tuned for updates!

story:
Thanks for Your Interest

A lot of artists are using crowdfunding for their CD projects these days, some far more established than me. The fact is, most indie CDs never even recover the investment but if you want to be taken seriously as an artist you have to keep putting out new music.

I had a great experience in crowdfunding when I broke the headstock off my beloved old Epiphone guitar a couple of years ago and it was suggested that I make an appeal through IndieGogo to get it repaired (it was an expensive repair and I couldn't afford it myself).  Anyway, I made my appeal, I raised $1200, the guitar was repaired and I am soooo grateful to have my baby back and she will be prominently featured on the new recording. 

I wondered aloud back then if these folks would have been so quick to donate to a new Brian Blain recording as they were to rescue a damaged instrument...Well, we'll find out now. With so much music coming out these days, I can only hope this old blues guy should get your support versus all those eager, hard-working young artists whose career is mostly ahead of them,

But I do have supporters, and I see them in the audience with a big smile on their face so I'm encouraged to keep putting my music out there. I haven't been gigging very much,  and maybe my touring days are winding down (I've got a song about that, too), but the creative juices are still flowing and as long as there are folks out there who want to hear my music, I will keep putting it out.

If you prefer to contribute without going through IndieGogo, send your donation to Brian Blain, 326 Woodfield Road, Toronto, ON  M4L 2X1   or e-transfer brianblain@brianblain.ca (and a big thank you to my first direct donor, Alice Brock of Provincetown, Mass)

If you're not able to contribute financially, but still want to lend your support, please consider these no-cost initiatives:

Blainreader - subscribe to the (mostly monthly) Blainletter by going to brianblain.com

Blainfollower - find me on Facebook or Twitter and give me a "like"  and check out my blog, www.torontobluesdiary.com

and, please forward the IndieGogo link to any mutual friend you think might want to help out.

 

Thanks, Merci, Muchas Gracias and see you out there,

BrianB (aka Stringbuster, Butch, Nappy, Shaker, Two-Lane Blain, Colorblind Brian, Buddha of the Blues)

story:
Short Summary

I have many passions: Composing (jazz music, Arabic music, musical theatre, cinema), singing and performance.


Your contributions will allow me to record this new album witch remark a new way in my career. 
As the funds will be put towards recording, producing and marketing the album to new fans online via advertising & PR.

Friends, family, music fans, I appreciate your love and support and cannot wait to share my new songs with you!

 

About me: 

i'm composer and pianist. i play mostly original compositions, which are strongly influenced by Arabic music and eastern rhythms, often using its scales and modalities. In addition to being inspired by his Arabic culture, my music is also influenced by tango and jazz traditions.

As an Arab musician trained in classical music, and as a pianist, i constantly search for new ways of offering piano works to "eastern ears". i composed several works which have placed the "eastern" piano in the centre, such as solo piano pieces, quartets, quintets, piano and four female voices and for a piano and orchestra.​

music projects :"login",  "Three Steps", "Mud", "Opening of the Palestinian Museum", "Al-Bashiq", "Love in the Cloud", "Once upon a City”, "Love without a story" and lately “Toy Box”.

i also composed music for a number of theatrical works and films.

​www.FarajSuleiman.com

story:
Why I need your support

 

  Welcome to our phase two fundraiser for my tribute CD to jazz singing legend Mark Murphy. I'm turning to you again hoping to raise funds for final vocals, mixing, and marketing. The generous donations from my original crowd funder were enough to record but not enough to do post-production. Nevertheless, I took the "build it and they’ll come" attitude. The cd tracks are now recorded.  We are very, very happy with the outcome. I can't wait for you hear it!  You can kinda catch a "feel" by watching the video taped by Tom Emmi in the studio as we recorded "Nightmood”.

As a young jazz singer, I was blessed to be supported by a well-run indie label that helped build my career and established my presence on the national and international jazz scene. Over the ensuing decades, I’ve seen the music industry mutate. Today the challenges of the digital age can put tremendous stress on the recording artist, but it has also brought new opportunities, such as crowdfunding. Although no longer a source of significant income, even for many established popular artists, the need for releasing new recordings is still essential for staying alive in the business. It’s important to document one’s artistry, and it’s a hook for getting booked and staying in the game. It heightens awareness, it generates work, and emotionally speaking, making recordings is what keeps artists alive, this ability to share their art of spontaneous creation and love.

Nancy Kelly: http://www.nancykelly.com

Artist representation and tour support: Jean-Pierre Leduc http://www.lunchedrecords.com/  

What We Need 

The CD is recorded. We need your help with post-production costs.

  • Promo photo $500
  • Vocal overdubs and mixing $1500
  • Marketing $3000
  • Disk duplication and artwork $1400
  • Video Production $2000 (We have a commitment from Tom Emmi, producer of the popular award-winning jazz television series Studio Jams. He will be producing a behind-the-scenes video feature on our making of the album.)

 

 

Dear Friends,

In the past few years I have teamed up with an international booking agent, Jean-Pierre Leduc http://www.lunchedrecords.com/. We met just after my last recording, "B That Way," had run its course. So much is about timing in this business. As it happens, Jean-Pierre was Mark Murphy's last manager, and we both continue to feel a very strong personal connection to him. We feel confident that this project will not only be a worthy addition to my discography, but will also create a demand for concerts worldwide.

Not only will your support honor the great Mark Murphy and his formidable legacy, it will also create awareness for my artistry, to continue my quest to keep creating great music for you, and for all that enjoy this great art form.

To quote one of Mark's most fabulous albums, "Love Is What Stays."

With much appreciation,

Musicians on this cd:

Nancy Kelly  Vocals , executive producer  http://www.nancykelly.com

John Dimartino, Piano, Arranger and Producer  http://www.johndimartino.com/

Carmen Intorre, Drums http:// https://www.facebook.com/carmenintorredrums

Bobbie Militello, Alto,Flute, http://02b1d2d.netsolhost.com/bobbymilitello/welcome.html

Randy Brecker, Trumpet, Flugal,  http://randybrecker.com/

Ed Howard,Electric and Acoustic Bass https://www.allmusic.com/artist/ed-howard-mn0000161279/biography

Paul Bollenback,  Electric Guitar https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Bollenback

Paul Meyers. Acoustic Guitar  http://www.paulmeyers.info/

Bonus tracks with:

Peter Mack Bass

Steve Brown Guitar

 

List of song titles on the CD:

  • Stolen Moments
  • One the Red Clay
  • Night Mood
  • Empty Faces (Vera Cruz)
  • I'm glad there is You
  • Sunday in New York
  • Body and Soul
  • Song for the Geese
  • Again
  • Bebop Lives 
  • This could be the Start of Something Big

Recorded October 16 and 17th 2017 Trading 8's  Studio Paramus NJ

story:
-FIND THE GERMAN VERSION BELOW-

Grown up in a family of musicians I had only one wish:

'Live my music dream'

Grew up in a little village in Germany, I was told to learn something "serious" and had a normal job. As no one could stop me from singing, I have become a professional session singer for different bands, which I did on the weekends, besides my "normal life". But I always dreamed of doing my own music. Therefore I gave it all up and moved to London in 2015 to pursue my dream. 

Since then I am working together with big names in the industry, such as Alan Glass (Producer of Aretha Franklin), Ace (Skunk Anansie) or Kieron Pepper (Prodigy). 

I've been very lucky to record and master my Debut single "Caught in the Blues" at the legendary Metropolis Studios, a recording studio where artists like Freddy Mercury, Adele, Amy Winehouse and more wrote music history with records produced at this magical place!

 Listen here:

https://soundcloud.com/cheri-lyn/caught-in-the-...

The project

To build up on my career, I would love to produce a music video for my second single, called 'Showman' which took me 3 years to finish and hope to reach as many music lovers as I can! 

I wrote ‘Showman’ in Chicago in a rush of inspiration from the blues music and the spirit of the city. My music is about love, passion and mostly about a women’s power with all its assets and charms.

"Showman" was originally a song about the pole dance. For me it is a sexy sports in which you can reveal and live your hidden attractions. 

My inspiration for the story developed, when I was in a Blues Club and I saw this dreamy looking man on stage.  An entertainer who - rumour has it - likes to give his fans private shows and knows how to play his games with women.

The ‘Showman’ didn’t get burnt until he met me. Well that happens when you play with fire….

The mission

With my music I want to bring back the spirit of 70's and 80's Blues/ Rock/ Soul music and deliver it with a modern swagger. My songs empower the benefit of being a woman and encourage to self- confidence and strength. I write about my own experiences, and the issues I had with love, friendship or life. How I have been grown as a woman and how I deal with deep situations, where I stay strong, positive and move on. 

The video should help me to reach a wider fan base. I want to launch it together with my EP in April 2018. Further I plan to tour around Europe and the States in 2018, therefore I would appreciate if you follow me and support me to get me for a show into your town :)!

The costs

The time has come and within one’s reach! I need your help for this! The production of my music video would cost around €5200. We need to pay the video production company (4300€), make up artist (100€), rent a venue (200€), requisites (200€), produce the song (recording costs 300€, mastering 100€). If the money I raise is above that amount, I will invest it into the production costs of my first EP, which I want to release in April 2018. Of course you would be rewarded for your big heart and I would be incredibly thankful for!

You can get free downloads of my singles, exclusive backstage materials, t- shirts, living room concerts, become a part of the video, become VIP guests, get your own song of your choice or be part of my upcoming EP, to be released in April 2018. It would mean the world to me, if you support me.

Here a little sneak peak to my second single ‘Showman’ which is currently in the production process and will be the material for my music video:

 https://soundcloud.com/cheri-lyn/preview-showma...

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends about my music video. 

Share on Twitter, Facebook and Instagram!

Also please follow me on all social media and if you know any venues where I can play with my band, please share :) 

With all my heart, 

thank you!

 

______________________________________________________________________________________

Leb deinen Traum

Aufgewachsen in einer Musiker Familie,

gab es für mich nur diesen einen Wunsch:

Meine Musik leben.

Ich bin Musikerin, Songwriterin  und Sängerin für Modern Blues/Rock/Soul. Nachdem ich jahrelang Front -Sängerin  bei verschiedenen deutschen Bands war, durch Europa, China und Japan touren durfte, entschied ich mich 2016 die Heimat zurück zu lassen ,  um mich in London mit meiner eigenen Musik zu etablieren.

Glücklicherweise bekam ich einen Studienplatz i m legendären Metropolis Tonstudio,  in dem Freddy Mercury, Adele, Amy Winehouse  und weitere namenhafte Künstler Innen ihre Hits produzierten.

Auch darf ich mit Größen  wie Alan Glass(ausgezeichnet mit Goldenen Schallplatten für Produktionen mit Aretha Franklin) oder Ace (Gitarrist Skunk Anansie) zusammen arbeiten.

Endlich konnte ich nun endlich meine erste Single "Caught in the Blues" veröffentlichen, welche in den Metropolis Studios aufgenommen wurde.

https://soundcloud.com/cheri-lyn/caught-in-the-...

Gefolgt wird das von einem Album,  und dazu möchte ich ein passendes Musikvideo drehen.

Das Projekt

Meine erste Single "Caught in the  Blues"  erschien im Dezember.  Darauf aufbauend möchte ich für meine zweite Single "Showman" ein Musikvideo machen, um noch grössere Reichweite  zu bekommen.

Der Song “ Showman” dauerte insgesamt 3 Jahre  bis zur Vollendung. Ich war in Chicago und wurde inspiriert  durch den Blues und Spirit der Stadt .

Diese verruchten Clubs, in denen legendäre Musiker  sich auf der Bühne leidenschaftlich dem Blues hingaben,  liessen mich nur staunen.

Zeitgleich zu meiner Chicago Erfahrung, begann meine Schwester mit Poledance.

Ja, meine Musik ist über Liebe, Leidenschaft und vor allem die Stärke einer Frau, mit all ihren Vorzügen und Reizen.

"Showman" war ursprünglich gedacht  als Loblied über den Tanz an der Stange: Zu viele prüde Vorurteile schockierten mich. Ich empfinde diese Sportart als sexy und befreiend.

Die andere Facette erhielt “Showman” durch eine Begegnung  in einem Blues Club : Da stand er plötzlich auf der Bühne, ein Traum von einem Mann,  der allen Frauen den Kopf verdreht, ein Entertainer, der bekanntlich auch gern mal private Zugaben  seinen Fans verpasste.

Der leibhaftige Showman lies nichts anbrennen, bis er zu mir gelang. Tja , wer mit dem Feuer spielt, sollte sich nicht verbrennen.

Die Zeit ist reif und der Traum zum  Greifen nah.

Hier die Zahlen:

Musikvideo: Kosten für Produktionsfirma ca 4300 Euro

Make Up Visagistin: 200 €

Requisiten: 100 €

Location mieten: 200 €

Produktionskosten des Songs: 300 €

Mastering des Songs: 100 €

Als Dankeschön könnt ihr freie Downloads meiner Singles erhalten, exclusives Backstage Material, T- shirts, Wohnzimmerkonzerte, im Video mitspielen, VIP Gäste werden, einen Song von mir aufgenommen bekommen oder auf meiner EP (kleines Album) drauf sein, welche im April 2018 erscheinen wird. Es würde mir wahnsinnig viel bedeuten, wenn ihr mich unterstützen würdet :). 

Hier ein Vorgeschmack meiner Single Showman, die derzeit noch professionell produziert wird:

https://soundcloud.com/cheri-lyn/preview-showma...

Sollten die Einnahmen die 5200 € übersteigen,  fließen die Erlöse in die Kosten meiner EP, um Produktion und CD- Pressung zu decken. Die EP erscheint voraussichtlich im April.

Die Mission

Mit meiner Musik möchte ich den Spirit der 70er und 80er Blues/ Rock/ Soul- Musik zurück bringen und zum Modernen verwandeln. Meine Songs handeln von der Stärke einer Frau,  mit all ihren Vorzügen und Reizen. Ich möchte zu mehr Selbstbewusstsein und Kraft ermutigen, vor allem wenn es um tiefe Lebensabschnitte geht. 

Mit dem Video möchte ich eine größere Fanbase erreichen. Es soll gemeinsam mit meiner EP im April 18 erscheinen. Außerdem plan ich meine erste Tour in Europa und hoffentlich in den Staaten. Daher wäre es super, wenn ihr mich unterstützt, damit ich auch bald in eurer Stadt spielen kann.

Wie ihr noch helfen könnt:

Geld ist nicht alles. Teilt die Kampagne mit euren Freunden auf Facebook, Instagram oder Email und folgt mir auf meinen Social Medias. Jedes Wort hilft. Auch wenn ihr weitere Locations wisst, in denen ich mit meiner Band auftreten könnte, sagt gerne Bescheid. Besten Dank.

Let's be legendary together.

Von tiefstem Herzen:

DANKE!

Eure 

Cheri
