story:
The Project

On this overcast, drizzly morning, two lives will collide. We as a country and people will never be the same.

          So began my stage play, Migrant Mother.

          The date was March 9, 1936. The location was Nipomo, California. Fate intervened and the paths of two women crossed. The result of the encounter was the iconic photograph, “Migrant Mother.” An image that still haunts us today.

          Dorothea Lange was taking photographs for the government, documenting the plight of migrants during the Great Depression. Florence Owens Thompson was taking care of her family, trying desperately to survive the hard times. These two women were very different, yet so very alike.

          In January 2017, the Prospect Theater Project in Modesto presented a full production of Migrant Mother.

          From the moment I began writing the play, I wanted a musical component and a musician/dramatic character to act as a Greek chorus. “Doc Guitar” was that character. I selected songs of the era for him to perform that reinforced the themes of the play – poverty, disenfranchisement, class struggle, the art of photography, the role of women in society, and the concept of framing reality. The songs I chose were powerful songs then and they still are today.

  

          Don Setaro, a Modesto native and music producer/audio engineer, attended the last show. He was inspired by the performance of Andrew Durr as “Doc Guitar” and Andrew’s arrangements of the classic songs. He approached Jack Souza, artistic director of the Prospect Theater, and myself with the idea of creating a compact disc of the performances. Thus was born “The Songs of Migrant Mother.”

          The first time I heard Andrew’s arrangements of these songs in rehearsal and then in production, I was impressed with their power and uniqueness. Don felt the same way, which is why he initiated this project. Once he and the musicians were in the studio, the magic continued, as they added even more memorable touches. For example, “Just the Way You Look Tonight” is a familiar standard from the American songbook. Andrew’s interpretation is like nothing you’ve heard before. His take on each of the songs and Don’s production make us realize how moving and timely these songs still are.

The Goal

Our goal is to raise $7,500 to cover personnel, production, and materials for the creation of the compact disc, as well as mastering and distribution costs for 1000 CDs.

All contributions to this project are tax deductible. A portion of the funds raised will benefit the Prospect Theater Project.

The Team

Andrew Durr

From punk clubs to country bars and weddings, Andrew has been playing music around Northern California for the last 20 years. In Migrant Mother, he used his own diverse musical history to incorporate songs of the 1930s. “As a descendant of Dust Bowl migrants myself, I feel a kind of connection with these stories. I’m really honored and proud to be a part of a show that illuminates so much about social progress.”

Don Setaro

Don has been involved in remote recording, live sound, and audio installation for more than 30 years. He owned and operated one of Modesto's first multitrack studios back in the mid-1970s. He was heavily involved in studio installations in the 1980s and 1990s working with such artists as Neil Young, the Doobie Brothers, the Grateful Dead, and George Lucas. Don has installed and operated studios and sound systems in the Central Valley, the San Francisco Bay Area, and as far away as Washington State and Canada. Don currently works as house sound engineer for the Gallo Center for the Arts and operates TRG Studios and IAC Records in Modesto.  

Jack Souza

As Founding Artistic Director of Prospect Theater Project, Jack has directed, designed, or appeared in nearly all of PTP’s 100 plus productions over the past 16 years. His theater credits include work in regional theater, New York, Seattle, the Bay Area, and Dublin, Ireland. Having trained with the American Conservatory Theater and Berkeley Repertory Theater, he also holds a Master’s Degree in Modern Drama with Honors from University College, Dublin. Apart from his duties as Artistic Director of PTP, Jack is a guest lecturer at California State University, Stanislaus, Merced College, and Modesto Junior College. He is the 2011 recipient of the Stanislaus Art’s Council award for excellence in theater.

Ken White

Ken retired from the worlds of advertising, corporate communications, and interactive entertainment to concentrate on writing and community service. He received his A.A. degree at Modesto Junior College, his B.A. and teaching credential at UC Davis, and his M.A. at San Francisco State University. He has taught mass communications and film appreciation at Modesto Junior College. Born in Lathrop and raised in Modesto, he continues to live in his home town. He has written novels, screenplays, short stories, stage plays, children’s and non-fiction books. Most of his stories are about his home town and the Central Valley heartland.

The Songs

"Hard Times Come Again No More" –Written by Stephen Foster.

"Are You Making Any Money?" – Written by Herman Hupfeld.

"Pastures of Plenty” – Music and lyrics by Woody Guthrie.

"Brother, Can You Spare a Dime?" – Written in 1930 by lyricist E. Y. "Yip" Harburg and composer Jay Gorney, this song was part of the 1932 musical revue Americana.

"Pennies from Heaven" – A 1936 American popular song with music by Arthur Johnston and words by Johnny Burke.

"Who’s Been Polishing the Sun?" – Words and music by Noel Gay.

"The Way You Look Tonight” – Written by Jerome Kern with lyrics by Dorothy Fields, from the film, Swing Time.

"Keep on the Sunny Side" – A popular American song originally written in 1899 by Ada Blenkhorn with music by J. Howard Entwisle.

"Can the Circle Be Unbroken (By and By)" – A country/folk song reworked by A. P. Carter from the hymn “Will the Circle Be Unbroken?" by Ada R. Habershon and Charles H. Gabriel.

"Life is Just a Bowl of Cherries” – A popular song with music by Ray Henderson and lyrics by Lew Brown, published in 1931.

The Musicians

Andrew Durr – Vocals, Acoustic Guitar

Ray Vazira – Percussion, Piano, Electric Piano, Organ

Steve Ashman – Electric Bass

Janet Baltzo – Piano, Electric Piano, Organ

Narayan Baltzo – Trumpet

Alexandra  Durr – Background Vocals

Patrick Durr – Harmonica, Background Vocals

Jeffrey McFarland-Johnson – Cellos

Kevin Pallotta – Drums

John Ady – Acoustic Bass

Melissa Dawn – Spoken Word

The Production

Produced by:  Don Setaro

Mixed by:  Don Setaro at TRG – Modesto

Mastered by:  Harold LaRue at Harold LaRue Mastering – Seattle

Recorded at:

Prairie Sun Recording – Cotati

Hyde Street Studios – San Francisco

TRG – Modesto

The Press – Stockton

25th Street Recording – Oakland

Engineered by:  Don Setaro, Nate Nauseda, Jaimeson Durr, Matt Young,
Diego Ayala, Gabriel Shepard

Photography by:  Eric Bjerke, Philip Johnson, Ashley Rose Tacheira.

Graphic design by:  Rich Koski 

Cover art and design by:  Rich Koski
story_txt: The ProjectOn this overcast, drizzly morning, two lives will collide. We as a country and people will never be the same.          So began my stage play, Migrant Mother.          The date was March 9, 1936. The location was Nipomo, California. Fate intervened and the paths of two women crossed. The result of the encounter was the iconic photograph, “Migrant Mother.” An image that still haunts us today.          Dorothea Lange was taking photographs for the government, documenting the plight of migrants during the Great Depression. Florence Owens Thompson was taking care of her family, trying desperately to survive the hard times. These two women were very different, yet so very alike.          In January 2017, the Prospect Theater Project in Modesto presented a full production of Migrant Mother.          From the moment I began writing the play, I wanted a musical component and a musician/dramatic character to act as a Greek chorus. “Doc Guitar” was that character. I selected songs of the era for him to perform that reinforced the themes of the play – poverty, disenfranchisement, class struggle, the art of photography, the role of women in society, and the concept of framing reality. The songs I chose were powerful songs then and they still are today.            Don Setaro, a Modesto native and music producer/audio engineer, attended the last show. He was inspired by the performance of Andrew Durr as “Doc Guitar” and Andrew’s arrangements of the classic songs. He approached Jack Souza, artistic director of the Prospect Theater, and myself with the idea of creating a compact disc of the performances. Thus was born “The Songs of Migrant Mother.”          The first time I heard Andrew’s arrangements of these songs in rehearsal and then in production, I was impressed with their power and uniqueness. Don felt the same way, which is why he initiated this project. Once he and the musicians were in the studio, the magic continued, as they added even more memorable touches. For example, “Just the Way You Look Tonight” is a familiar standard from the American songbook. Andrew’s interpretation is like nothing you’ve heard before. His take on each of the songs and Don’s production make us realize how moving and timely these songs still are.The GoalOur goal is to raise $7,500 to cover personnel, production, and materials for the creation of the compact disc, as well as mastering and distribution costs for 1000 CDs.All contributions to this project are tax deductible. A portion of the funds raised will benefit the Prospect Theater Project.The TeamAndrew DurrFrom punk clubs to country bars and weddings, Andrew has been playing music around Northern California for the last 20 years. In Migrant Mother, he used his own diverse musical history to incorporate songs of the 1930s. “As a descendant of Dust Bowl migrants myself, I feel a kind of connection with these stories. I’m really honored and proud to be a part of a show that illuminates so much about social progress.”Don SetaroDon has been involved in remote recording, live sound, and audio installation for more than 30 years. He owned and operated one of Modesto's first multitrack studios back in the mid-1970s. He was heavily involved in studio installations in the 1980s and 1990s working with such artists as Neil Young, the Doobie Brothers, the Grateful Dead, and George Lucas. Don has installed and operated studios and sound systems in the Central Valley, the San Francisco Bay Area, and as far away as Washington State and Canada. Don currently works as house sound engineer for the Gallo Center for the Arts and operates TRG Studios and IAC Records in Modesto.  Jack SouzaAs Founding Artistic Director of Prospect Theater Project, Jack has directed, designed, or appeared in nearly all of PTP’s 100 plus productions over the past 16 years. His theater credits include work in regional theater, New York, Seattle, the Bay Area, and Dublin, Ireland. Having trained with the American Conservatory Theater and Berkeley Repertory Theater, he also holds a Master’s Degree in Modern Drama with Honors from University College, Dublin. Apart from his duties as Artistic Director of PTP, Jack is a guest lecturer at California State University, Stanislaus, Merced College, and Modesto Junior College. He is the 2011 recipient of the Stanislaus Art’s Council award for excellence in theater.Ken WhiteKen retired from the worlds of advertising, corporate communications, and interactive entertainment to concentrate on writing and community service. He received his A.A. degree at Modesto Junior College, his B.A. and teaching credential at UC Davis, and his M.A. at San Francisco State University. He has taught mass communications and film appreciation at Modesto Junior College. Born in Lathrop and raised in Modesto, he continues to live in his home town. He has written novels, screenplays, short stories, stage plays, children’s and non-fiction books. Most of his stories are about his home town and the Central Valley heartland.The Songs"Hard Times Come Again No More" –Written by Stephen Foster."Are You Making Any Money?" – Written by Herman Hupfeld."Pastures of Plenty” – Music and lyrics by Woody Guthrie."Brother, Can You Spare a Dime?" – Written in 1930 by lyricist E. Y. "Yip" Harburg and composer Jay Gorney, this song was part of the 1932 musical revue Americana."Pennies from Heaven" – A 1936 American popular song with music by Arthur Johnston and words by Johnny Burke."Who’s Been Polishing the Sun?" – Words and music by Noel Gay."The Way You Look Tonight” – Written by Jerome Kern with lyrics by Dorothy Fields, from the film, Swing Time."Keep on the Sunny Side" – A popular American song originally written in 1899 by Ada Blenkhorn with music by J. Howard Entwisle."Can the Circle Be Unbroken (By and By)" – A country/folk song reworked by A. P. Carter from the hymn “Will the Circle Be Unbroken?" by Ada R. Habershon and Charles H. Gabriel."Life is Just a Bowl of Cherries” – A popular song with music by Ray Henderson and lyrics by Lew Brown, published in 1931.The MusiciansAndrew Durr – Vocals, Acoustic GuitarRay Vazira – Percussion, Piano, Electric Piano, OrganSteve Ashman – Electric BassJanet Baltzo – Piano, Electric Piano, OrganNarayan Baltzo – TrumpetAlexandra  Durr – Background VocalsPatrick Durr – Harmonica, Background VocalsJeffrey McFarland-Johnson – CellosKevin Pallotta – DrumsJohn Ady – Acoustic BassMelissa Dawn – Spoken WordThe ProductionProduced by:  Don SetaroMixed by:  Don Setaro at TRG – ModestoMastered by:  Harold LaRue at Harold LaRue Mastering – SeattleRecorded at:Prairie Sun Recording – CotatiHyde Street Studios – San FranciscoTRG – ModestoThe Press – Stockton25th Street Recording – OaklandEngineered by:  Don Setaro, Nate Nauseda, Jaimeson Durr, Matt Young,Diego Ayala, Gabriel ShepardPhotography by:  Eric Bjerke, Philip Johnson, Ashley Rose Tacheira.Graphic design by:  Rich Koski Cover art and design by:  Rich Koski

story:
About Us

Hi there!  We’re Oracle Blue, a Swank-Pop/Alt-Jazz band hailing from the Myrtle Beach area of South Carolina.  Oracle Blue began in the Music Department of Coastal Carolina University in the fall of 2013, when Zach Douglas, McKinley Devilbiss, Wade McMillan and Liz Kelley-Tavernier formed the first iteration of the CCU Jazz Combo (later joined by J.P. Taylor and Timothy Hardwick).

During our time at CCU we were given many incredible opportunities to learn from world-class musicians such as Victor Wooten, Steve Bailey, Jeff Coffin, Howard Levy, Quentin Baxter, and many others.  We also received a Student Music Award from DownBeat Magazine in the Pop/Rock/R&B category and were invited by Montreux, Vienne and Umbria Jazz Festivals in Europe.   We were shown overwhelming support from our neighbors across the Grand Strand area making it possible for us to travel to Europe to perform at these festivals!  After a warm response both on tour and in our hometown we decided that we wanted to stay together after graduation.  Thus began the era of Oracle Blue!

This group has been a community effort since the time we all began playing music together as students, and it has remained so to this day.  That’s why we are inviting you to join us on this creative journey as we record our very first album.  With your support we believe that we can make something truly special.

Plan & Perks

Our goal is to raise $5000 for the production of this album.  We have decided to hire professionals to record, mix and master our album as want to present our music in the most pristine way possible!  We will also be raising money to cover printing expenses for the physical CDs as well as merchandise.  Each member in the band will be taking turns to post updates and keep you involved along the way!  We’ll be streaming live, offering insight on the composition of some of our original music, and allowing exclusive access to the entire creative process.  All for you!  We will even be hosting private concerts for those who give at certain tiers, as well as an after-party at our CD release show.

If we are not able to reach our entire goal we will still be moving forward with the funds that we do receive, just at a much slower pace.  Regardless of the outcome of this particular campaign, what you give will be going directly to getting our music recorded and pressed.

Below is a list of where the funds will be going as we move forward with the production of the record.

  • Studio Time
  • Professional Mixing and Mastering
  • Printing CD’s
  • Merchandise Production / Shipping
  • Album Artwork/Design
  • Promotions, Ads, Getting our Music to the People!

Hopes, Dreams, & Goals

We have had a wild ride so far, but we’re just getting started.  It has been so special to share the past few years together in the Myrtle Beach area (and a few weeks in Europe!), but we are ready to see how far we can take our music.  That’s why it’s incredibly important to us that we pour our hearts and souls into making this album the best that it can possibly be.  We’ve taken time to apply the musical knowledge that we’ve gained along the way, and we’ve been working on building a strong business plan to prepare for the next steps.  Our hope is that with a strong, professional product we can launch our band into performing at more high-caliber festivals, that we can develop a strong sound/brand, and that we can get our music into the right hands.

Risks & Challenges

We realize that achieving our goal of $5,000 within a timeframe of 60 days may seem like a bit of a stretch.  This is not an all-or-nothing campaign, so we will still receive your donations even if we don’t reach our total goal.  That being said we will still be putting everything that we receive toward our recording fund, it will just move forward at a slower pace.  We have put an incredible amount of work and detail into composing our music and we plan to show the recording process the same level of respect and due-diligence.

You Can Help!

If you would like to help us spread the word, we would greatly appreciate it if you shared this campaign via social media!  You can do so by clicking on the icons at the top right corner of this page, right next to the welcome video.  The more buzz we’re able to generate, the more people hear about our album!  

Thank You

So many people have sat through our student recitals, shown us support at restaurants around town that we’ve played at, and really, really helped us along the way.  We have been truly moved by the community support that we have received through the years, and we are well aware that nothing is possible without our tribe.  Thank you for helping us make the music happen!

story:
NEW 2019 CAMPAIGN: Stormarea51 indiegogo campaign

FBI agent;

Hello friends of Earth, my name is Special Agent Hook and I am friend from the inside. The inside of Area 51 in Rachel, NV. We have a grave issue in front of us. Last year in July of 2018 our brothers from another mother ship, the intergalactic band Brothers of Alien Rock revealed themselves to the world and how they have been here on our planet in observance since 1947 , all the while learning to rock from the biggest legends of music for the past 70 years. Collaborating in Secret with Hendrix,Van Halen,Elvis,Sabbath,Nirvana,Zeppelin and decades more. 


So here is the The real issue; when the band landed in Roswell,NM last year to perform at the annual UFO fest for the first time in human history_ they showed themselves publicy and were quickly abducted by the US government, and for the last year have been held with intentions unknown!

So since i am one of the administrators that runs Alien Rock HQ in the states, we were finally able to intercept a signal from the band, INSIDE the AREA51 facility - asking for our help in a covert rescue mission. Thanks to the organizers of the FB storm area51 movement, we have been given an unprecedented opportunity to save our rocking E.T.s from the clutches of this oppressive government agency. The transmission that we received from The band implicity tells us NOT to storm the gates at area51 because the government will know we are coming, but instead another option is presented for a sneak attack. The plans are hidden within the lyrics of their latest song that came along with this transmission titled "Don't Storm The Gates!". And we have a small sample of it here...(2019 CAMPAIGN)


The plan is We will meet up with all of the other attendees outside Area 51on Sept20th to break the band out of the facility , and then upon their new freedom They can perform a rock show of epic proportions for the entire world to witness. Therefore finally revealing the truth of what all the world's governments have been hiding from the rest of us; that we are not alone! 

Also! we are stoked to be working on getting some REAL PLAYERS from the UFO research community, as well as true beings of Science and innovation to join us in the rescue!! Stay tuuuuuuuned 

This is where we need your help... We have To transport all the equipment and supplies necessary for the band to speak to our planet at this epic event. This means moving the drums, amps, guitars,sound systems and merchandise  from our secret HQ in Florida out to the desert of Nevada. No small task but we believe in you! 

Everybody here at Alien Rock Hq and the band wants to thank you in advance big time for the belief and support in making this happen. 

The world is depending on your alliance!! JOIN US 

************************************************************************

ORIGINAL CAMPAIGN 2018:

 

We are the Brothers of Alien Rock from the planet Rocktronamos, currently residing in sunny Orlando, Florida.

We came crashing here in New Mexico back in the late 40's with only our guitars on our backs. It was from there that we carried out a most passionate quest to learn the power of music through the greatest artists of your times; we played and wrote epic songs with Robert Johnson, Elvis,The Beetles, Led Zeppelin, Black Sabbath, Parliament, Van Halen, Nirvana and helped shape the face of Rock n Roll for 70+ years! 

However we realized it was time to record our own masterpieces. and that is just what we did. Our first release, "Landing " blew out onto the scene in 2013 and now with our latest release, "We Come From Outer Space" it is time to continue the saga! 

So now after 71 years, The City of Roswell have invited us to find our way back home and play the biggest and most recognized UFO festival on the planet! One epic show in the New Mexico skies along with several appearances and events to get us reacquainted with Roswell. There will be photo ops,meet n greets, parades & interviews with exclusive performances. Local rock radio in town is also ready to campaign together with us to make this a memorable experience. We are even shooting our next music video right on our original crash site from 1947!! We are so honored and humbled to be a part of this notable event!

We will be documenting every step of the way with all social media and also through an exclusive documentary named "Road 2 Roswell", The Experience - filled with all the madness only Aliens could get away with on such an epic journey in the deep southwest U.S.! This Doc will be available as one of the rewards, among so much more... we're sure that all of our terrestrial (and extra terrestrial) friends will love it. Join us in the journey home, the point of origin, the Road 2 Roswell! So what do we need to get to make this journey a reality?!??!

 

Our friends at MainStreet Roswell are covering the lodging and food for us when we arrive in town however, there is a much more to cover with expenses than just showing up:

We have a huge ensemble with a drum kit, amps and rigs for 2 guitars and bass, stage props, banners, merch and a crew of 7 (including the band) to tackle the driving, roadie and document the journey! 

In order to bring our crew, equipment and minor provisions we need a large vehicle and a trailer to roll out. We've whittled down the costs of food and hotels by deciding to pile into an RV, stocking up on eats and hauling alien arse out west! This is where we need your help;

The costs of transportation to get there (since our saucer is in the shop at the moment) include:

1) RV rental: 10 days - $200 per day and $700 for mileage = $2700

2) trailer 6x 12 cargo  = $300 

3) RV rest stops (not RV parks but we found out State parks are a 1/3 of the price!) $25 X 10 = $250 

4) Gas, tolls, general engine maintenance = $1000

Total = $4,250

Everything else we have covered like food,supplies, time off of the day gigs and the pure energy to rock!!

 

HEY THE PERKS! 

One of our favorite perks is a chance to be our official ROADIE FOR A DAY. This is really cool because we get to hang out with one of our Earthling friends as we go on interviews and perform at radio stations, then have dinner (on us!) and hang out back stage for the show. Now of course you have to perform your duty as a ROADIE and do some lifting to help out though!! This is available at any future show but If you are going to be in the Roswell area, there's even more surprises!

Another really awesome perk is a chance to come hang out on set with us while shooting our next music video at the original UFO crash site from 1947!!! The special access that we will be granted to the site will be the first time it has been open to anyone (except scientists and mainstream media) since the incident happened 7 decades ago!! CRAZY!!

 

The Impact

Joining us on this journey let's you become a part of history. Amazing things are already happening, like the opening of the crash site to the public. That was a direct influence of our presence and intent to create this campaign to bring the entire world with us! Its about you enjoying the experience like one of the crew that's riding right along with us. When we are on our way out to Roswell making stops to interact with humans, this will be an amazing time to reflect on what really makes earthlings tick, from an Alien's perspective! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

There is one more very important thing you can do to help, SHARING the word online and in person to make some noise about this epic ride to the UFO Motherland! There also some great Indiegogo share tools too, so LETS DO THIS!!!

Everything else we have covered like food,supplies, time off of the day gigs and the pure energy to rock!!
 
HEY THE PERKS! 
One of our favorite perks is a chance to be our official ROADIE FOR A DAY. This is really cool because we get to hang out with one of our Earthling friends as we go on interviews and perform at radio stations, then have dinner (on us!) and hang out back stage for the show. Now of course you have to perform your duty as a ROADIE and do some lifting to help out though!! This is available at any future show but If you are going to be in the Roswell area, there's even more surprises!

Another really awesome perk is a chance to come hang out on set with us while shooting our next music video at the original UFO crash site from 1947!!! The special access that we will be granted to the site will be the first time it has been open to anyone (except scientists and mainstream media) since the incident happened 7 decades ago!! CRAZY!!

 
The Impact
Joining us on this journey let's you become a part of history. Amazing things are already happening, like the opening of the crash site to the public. That was a direct influence of our presence and intent to create this campaign to bring the entire world with us! Its about you enjoying the experience like one of the crew that's riding right along with us. When we are on our way out to Roswell making stops to interact with humans, this will be an amazing time to reflect on what really makes earthlings tick, from an Alien's perspective! 
 
Other Ways You Can Help!There is one more very important thing you can do to help, SHARING the word online and in person to make some noise about this epic ride to the UFO Motherland! There also some great Indiegogo share tools too, so LETS DO THIS!!!

story:
Summary

Singing and making music is a calling for me. I was a very shy and introspective kid, yet my desire to sing was so strong that I when I began performing in elementary school, my legs would shake and my face would turn bright red from nervousness. But something drove me to continue. I've come a long way as a musician and performer since then, from classical and operatic training to a cappella to writing and playing my own music.

I am a singer-songwriter and bass player, and my songs interweave poetic lyrics (many originally written as stand-alone poems) with bass and melody lines that draw from a variety of genres. Soulful, jazzy, and lush, my sound has been described as "southern gothic," which I love. At a recent show, a friend who heard us play for the first time said the sound was unlike any other singer-songwriter he had ever heard, which I took as a huge compliment. 

I recorded and released my first record, Unbound, in 2004 while living in New Orleans, with my previous band, M.J. Baby & The Last Word. The last 15 years have been quite an amazing journey, and the songs on this new record, Beautiful Illusions, reflect upon both the joys and the depths I've navigated along the way. Some of them have been percolating since my time in New Orleans and the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina, which brought me to Austin and forced me to rebuild my life from the ground up. Others are very fresh, with themes touching touch on love and loss, spirituality, pilgrimage, and the often-painful path to awakening.

My musical collaborators in this venture are Miguel Walker on guitar and backing vocals, Michelle Schreiber on drums and percussion, and Engineer/Producer Jason Mabry of Tomorrow Studio in Austin. Together we have already recorded demo versions of three of the songs for the album, the title track Beautiful Illusions (which you are hearing now), Scorpion Kiss, and Orion’s Bow. You can listen to these demo recordings in full on my website: www.melindajoy.com. The album will contain 12 songs in all.

What We Need & What You Get

With your campaign donation you will receive a copy of the album once it is finished, plus a number of other fun gifts and goodies depending on the amount you contribute, including a ticket to our CD-Release party, a creativity retreat or series of creativity coaching sessions, a house concert, and more!

If we don't reach our goal, we will use whatever we are able to raise to pay for studio time to record and produce the album, and I will personally finance the difference. If we raise more than our goal, I will use the extra funds to support other creatives in their work through sponsored artist residencies and scholarships for creativity workshops and retreats.

The Impact

We need art and creativity in this world, now more than ever. Music and art can help us to heal, to make meaning in our lives, and to offer new possibilities for healing our world and the planet.

In addition to my music making, I also work as a creativity coach and consultant. I completed my Ph.D. in psychology with a specialization in creativity studies in 2018 and I have several books on creativity in development and pending publication. I also lead workshops and retreats focusing on mindfulness and creativity, and I have developed several dedicated retreat spaces in Austin and the Texas Hill Country focusing on mindfulness, creativity, and sustainable living.

My mission is to provide opportunities for other creatives (and I believe that everyone is creative) to do their own deep work and cultivate their creative dreams, both individually and in group settings. Your contribution to this crowdfunding campaign will help sow the seeds of creativity not only for me personally, but for many others as well

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not able to contribute financially to the campaign, you can help get the word out by telling others about it via social media and Indiegogo's sharing tools. 

And do take a moment to check out the other wonderful artistic and musical projects currently featured on this site.

With love,

Melinda

story:
Memphissippi Sounds

On a hot summer night in 2017, the paths of two uniquely talented musicians crossed in a club on the world famous Beale Street.  Called to perform on the same gig, Cameron Kimbrough, grandson of Mississippi blues legend Junior Kimbrough, combined his gritty vocals with the raw, stripped-down drum rhythms of his native hill country.  Damion “Yella P” Pearson added the soulful sound of his blues harp.  The end result was nothing less than musical magic.  

Their chance encounter led to an instant connection, with Cam and Yella teaming up to form what would eventually be known as Memphissippi Sounds.  Cam had grown up listening to the blues at his grandfather’s juke joint and later taught himself to play drums and guitar.  Yella P, also self-taught on the harmonica, first picked up the instrument at age 13, honing his style while listening to the blues on Beale Street. Their custom blend of North Mississippi hill country blues & Memphis soul, blues, rock, pop, and hip-hop was debuted at the New Daisy while opening up for guitar legend Eric Gales.  In the past year, they’ve taken the Memphissippi Sound on the road to places such as Thacker Mountain Radio Hour in Oxford, Clarksdale’s Juke Joint Festival, and Little Rock’s Whitewater Tavern, backing Grammy-nominated bluesman R.L. Boyce.  Memphissippi Sounds has made local appearances at the Levitt Shell, Radio Memphis, and the Indie Memphis Film Festival.  Between gigs, they can be heard busking on Beale Street, much like musicians did in the heyday of Memphis music.

 

 

Memphissippi Sounds Album

Your contribution will go towards the successful release of Memphissippi Sounds' first album    

Which includes:

  • Recording
  • Mixing and mastering
  • Album Art
  • Videographer
  • Website and Hosting
  • Copyrights

 

 What You Get

For your help we are offering:

  • Link to the Album
  • Social Media Shout out from the band
  • Music lesson from the band (guitar, harmonica, drums)
  • Porch Party (An unplugged acoustic experience) 
  • Private concert - Memphissippi Sounds in all of its glory

 

The Impact

Your support will help Damion "Yella P" Pearson and Cam Kimbrough of  Memphissippi Sounds to:

  • Release quality recordings 
  • Share the Memphissippi Sound with audiences around the world
  • Keep authentic Blues music alive for future generations

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are multiple ways you can help this campaign :

  • Share this campaign (and the YouTube video) on social media with your friends and family
  • Follow Memphissippi Sounds

Facebook: www.facebook.com/memphissippisounds/

          Instagram: www.instagram.com/memphissippisounds/

           Youtube: www.youtube.com/channel/UCiXtupPiEedVsDxjrFtlCj...

Indiegogo has tools to share this campaign as well. Be sure to use them!

story:
The story

In 1988, the Italian artist Al Aprile and his band recorded their first and last album. Al lived in Milan, he was a well known musician, a music journalist and DJ,  a music producer, and a bluesman.

The band had just completed the recording sessions, when the music label went bankrupt. After three years, guitarist and drummer found the money to buy the tapes. But Al Aprile had died in 1991, at the age of 31. His musicians released a limited and abridged version of the album, to remember him. This vinyl is very hard to find, today.

The album

This album by an obscure and forgotten Italian band can be considered the closing act of the Eighties. It's  a blend of dark, rock, wave, pop and blues music, with powerful lyrics describing a rich and enthusiastic world that is going to lose its compass. But in these songs, all the Eighties' darkest sides - money as the ultimate goal in life, heroin, AIDS, loss of hope... - are transfigured by the beauty of music: the farewell to the decade becomes a moving hymn to life.

 

What I Need & What You Get

  • To digitize and mastering the three tapes recorded at 30ips I need about 650 EUR.
  • Today, CD's are a no-go: they can't handle HD Audio, and it's more convenient downloading mp3 and FLAC files than ripping them. As for vinyl records, I can't find good vinyl pressing plants in central Europe using reel to reel tapes as source: making a vinyl plate from a digital file is a nonsense.
  • The album will be digitally released in audiophile quality: mp3 (320kb), FLAC, HD Audio and DSD.

Challenges

The main problem with this project is that the tapes were recorded at a very high speed - 30ips or 76.2cm/s. Finding a postproduction studio owning a perfect 30ips player and very high quality analog to digital (AD) converters was a challenge. After a quite long research and several audio tests, I found it in Berlin: excellent equipments and sound engineer, quite expensive service.

Other Ways You Can Help

I am a quite solitary man, and don't have much experience with social networks. But I would be very grateful if you could spread info about this campaign on Facebook and other platforms.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Marshall Jones, I am a composer living in Kalispell, Montana. I currently serve as Director of Music Ministries at Bethlehem Lutheran Church and as an adjunct professor at Flathead Valley Community College. 

In February 2020, my orchestral work "Paramnesis" was selected for inclusion on ABLAZE Records next volume in their Orchestral Masters series. ABLAZE Records is a label that works with and champions the work of living composers. Paramnesis will be recorded with the Brno Philharmonic in the Czech Republic during the summer of 2020 under the direction of Mikel Toms. 

What We Need 

This is a partially subsidized recording. However, the remaining costs for the recording session total $7218. That includes pre-production, recording with a full orchestra, mastering, album artwork, advertising, and distribution. 

The Impact

The recording of works by living composers is valuable to the world. 

For me, it would be a chance to have my creative work be distributed further into the world than I alone could do. It will also be a great line in the CV as I continue the search for that elusive tenure track position. 

Risks & Challenges

With the recording process there are always challenges that create possible delays, but I encourage you to check out the previous work of ABLAZE Records and the Brno Philharmonic. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute, please share and pass the word along. Every bit helps.

story:
Introduction / Introducción

Hi! I'm Hugo Selles, founder of Psychic Equalizer - an eclectic musical project featuring several styles such as classical, prog rock, pop, metal, ambient, jazz, etc. Our new album is called The Sixth Extinction and it's about the environmental crisis the world is facing. It is going to be the 5th release by Psychic Equalizer and we have created something so big that even blows my mind. In order to finish it, it would be amazing to have your support! :)

¡Hola! Soy Hugo Selles, miembro fundador de Psychic Equalizer. Se trata de un proyecto musical fusión de diversos estilos como clásico, jazz, rock, pop, ambient, etc. El nuevo disco, The Sixth Extinction, habla sobre la crisis medioambiental a la que el mundo se enfrenta. Será el quinto lanzamiento discográfico de Psychic Equalizer y me llega a impresionar hasta a mi mismo lo que estamos creando. Pero, para poder terminarlo, ¡sería fantástico poder contar con tu ayuda! :)

Listen to some Psychic Equalizer / Escucha un poquito de Psychic Equalizer

 

What we need /Lo que necesitamos

We need to complete the album and prepare all the promotional materials. It's been almost two years since we started this adventure and we want to finish by the end of this year. Your contribution will be used to cover the expenses of: 

  • A studio in Madrid where we will record the last bits of the album.
  • Mixing and mastering.
  • Promotional photo shooting of the band and one videoclip (potentially two).
  • Artwork and design of the album to be made by the incredible visual artist Marius Budu in Copenhagen.
  • Manufacturing and related costs of the perks.
  • Other promotional expenses and payment of taxes.

Necesitamos terminar el disco y preparar todos los materiales promocionales. Hace ya casi dos años desde que empezamos esta aventura y tenemos planificado terminar a finales de este año. Tu donación se usará para:

  • Un estudio en Madrid en el que grabaremos los últimos detalles del disco.
  • Mezcla y masterización.
  • Sesión de fotografía de la banda para usar en promoción y rodaje de un videoclip (o incluso dos...).
  • Diseño y arte del disco que será realizado por el magnífico artista visual Marius Budu en Copenhague.
  • Manufacturación y otros costes relacionados de las recompensas.
  • Otros gastos de promoción y el pago de impuestos.

What you will get / Lo que tú recibirás

Take a look at the perks on the right side and choose the one you like the best. Some of them include CDs, a USB with all of Psychic Equalizer discography and lots of bonus content, signed postcards dedicated exclusively to you, etc. But most importantly, what you will get is the satisfaction of being part of an amazing adventure. You can (and should!) feel really proud to help us out with your donation! Thank you!

Echa un vistazo a las recompensas que hay a mano derecha y escoge la que más te guste. Algunas de ellas incluyen CDs, un USB con toda la discografía de Psychic Equalizer y gran cantidad de material adicional, postales firmadas y dedicadas exclusivamente para ti, etc. Pero lo más importante de todo, la satisfacción de formar parte de esta maravillosa aventura. Puedes y deberías sentirte orgulloso de la gran ayuda que tu contribución ha supuesto. ¡Gracias!

The impact / El impacto

There is a lot of time, love, dedication, talent and hard work put into this album. The fact that we have been able to create something like this is already an achieved goal for all of us. But of course, the more people that listen to it the better. We aim to release The Sixth Extinction in the second half of 2019 and if everything goes well, work on a tour for 2020. 

Hemos invertido mucho tiempo, amor, dedicación, talento y trabajo duro en este álbum. El hecho de que hayamos sido capaces de crear algo de esta magnitud es ya un sueño hecho realidad para todos nosotros. Aunque, por supuesto, cuanta más gente pueda llegar a escuchar nuestro trabajo, pues mejor que mejor. Queremos publicar The Sixth Extinction hacia la segunda mitad de 2019 y, si todo va bien, trabajar en hacer una gira en 2020.

Other ways you can help / Otras formas en que puedes ayudarnos

Even if you can't donate, you can still help us by sharing on your social media platforms!!

Si no puedes donar nada, no te preocupes. ¡Aún puedes ayudarnos mucho si compartes en tus redes sociales!

Psychic Equalizer on Bandcamp
Hugo Selles' website
Psychic Equalizer on Facebook
Hugo Selles on Facebook

Psychic Equalizer:
India Hooi - vocals, wind instruments
Carlos Barragán - electric, acoustic and classical guitars
Hugo Selles - piano, keyboards, synths, percussion
Adrián Ubiaga - backing vocals, keyboards
Morten Skøtt - drums, percussion

Other ways you can help / Otras formas en que puedes ayudarnos


Even if you can't donate, you can still help us by sharing on your social media platforms!!
Si no puedes donar nada, no te preocupes. ¡Aún puedes ayudarnos mucho si compartes en tus redes sociales!
Psychic Equalizer on BandcampHugo Selles' websitePsychic Equalizer on FacebookHugo Selles on Facebook
Psychic Equalizer:India Hooi - vocals, wind instrumentsCarlos Barragán - electric, acoustic and classical guitarsHugo Selles - piano, keyboards, synths, percussionAdrián Ubiaga - backing vocals, keyboardsMorten Skøtt - drums, percussion

story:
Short Summary

Hello, and thank you for choosing to support us here at Etheric Entertainment! We are a brand new Media Production company here in Denver Colorado, and our goal is to help foster and grow the Denver art scene. This campaign is to help cover the expenses of our first couple projects, and to acquire one time donations to set a foundation for the early stages our growth. It would be a tremendous help if you could donate whatever you could to this starting campaign so we can begin doing this full time, and helping the Denver art scene grow and flourish into something special that the community can be proud of

What We Need & What You Get

This starting sum will being going towards paying the expenses of producing our first couple projects, and anything left over will be rolled over into other projects or purchases that will help grow the company! If we don't reach the goal we will still us the funds for the exact same purposes. 
 

With your donation you will get an Executive Producer credit on these first two projects, as well as the first ever Etheric Entertainment t-shirt! 

The Impact

Though this is our first project, with your initial help you'll be helping us usher in what we hope to be a Denver renaissance! With so much talent here, it's a shame for all of these artists to go unanswered when seeking opportunity, and with your help we can give them that!

Risks & Challenges

We understand that there is a lot of competition out there in this field. This industry also has a huge history with a lot of weight behind it, but, we are young and innovative with many new ideas we wish to bring to the table on how this industry should operate with artists. We look in the face of this great industry and say, "how can we do better, and move it forward?", and we have been thinking and innovating just that, with new forms of contracts that are friendly with all parties involved in making great productions for all to enjoy. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate at the moment, it's no worries! You can donate smaller sums on a monthly basis on our Patreon account! If you can't donate at all, that is also not a problem! You can help us by spreading the word of this campaign, and following us on our social media accounts on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter! You can also help by subscribing to our Youtube channel where we will upload all of our visual and audio content! You can also sign up for our mailing list on MailChimp so you will always be up to date on everything Etheric Entertainment! Thank you so much for all of your support!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! Thankyou for checking me out. I'm an independent artist in Los Angeles looking for funding for my next two projects, a 4 song EP "Nightmare" and a full album "Cool Girl". I write, perform, and produce every single song myself in my little bedroom studio. The genre of my music ranges from contemporary pop with jazz and rnb influences, to indie pop. My EP Nightmare will consist of Indie RnB Pop, and Cool Girl will be a mixture of RnB Pop and Contemporary Alternative Pop! I cut a lot of costs being my own producer. But your contribution will help me get all my songs professionally mixed, mastered, along with professional Cover art, Music Videos, and marketing ads. You will truly help me get my projects off the ground running and help me accomplish my dreams!!!!

What I Need & What You Get

  • Each song costs 500 dollars to have professionally mixed, Nightmare will have 4 songs, and Cool Girl will have 10, so 14x500= 7,000
  • Mastering cost's 200 for each song, plus an extra 50 for alternative "Radio" versions of each song (Most of my songs have explicit lyrics) so 250x14= 3,500
  • I need 2,500 for a good lawyer to make a good management contract deal with my Manager!
  • I hire professional musicians to play on songs that need live instruments, I want to allot 1,000 dollars for this
  • Marketing (Youtube ads, Facebook ads, Ads, on Instagram)  I want to allot 500 for this
  • 1,500 for a professional Music Video

What you'll get!

  • Anyone who makes a contribution of 50 or more will receive a personal thank you email from me 
  • Anyone who makes a contribution of 100 dollars or more will receive a handwritten personal thank you letter 
  • Anyone who makes a contribution of 500 dollars or more will receive a private link to one of the unreleased songs of "Nightmare" or "Cool Girl"!

The Impact

  • I want my music to inspire other artists and humans to be exactly who they are, and not put themselves in one genre box. And when I write my songs, I don't just write simple " I got my heart broken" or "why don't you like me" songs. I try to really describe exactly how I feel in real life situations that everyone faces. I want you to feel like yes, someone has been exactly here before, and I want to give you the way to feel better about these situations. So you can take a step back from your problem and appreciate that it's really just another situation out of hundreds that will all add up to be your wonderful life and journey.

Risks & Challenges

Challenges I may face will be unforeseen costs, and things taking longer then planned for

  • I'm extremely resourceful, and I will do everything I absolutely need to do to accomplish finishing these two projects and bringing them to you!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can share and play some of my already released music on Spotify and Apple Music! (Making playlists with my songs really helps me with the Spotify and Apple Music algorithms!
  • You can share this campaign with people you believe might be interested!

story:
A New Album is in the works!

On August 1st and 2nd, we went into the studio and got down to work on ten new original songs. Since that time we've added backup vocals, horns, hammond organ and percussion. I'll be putting the finishing touches on the songs this week and head to the mixing board in early October. We were all ready to record before the pandemic hit, so the process is going really smoothly now. I am hopeful that I can send you copies of the new album, tentatively titled Down Below, in time for the holidays. 

With a little money saved from the proceeds of our last album and the generous support of a local music patron, I was able to cover the studio costs as we went. Going forward our budget is as follows:

Mixing $1500

Mastering $600

Album Artwork $250-500

Manufacturing $3000

Promo in Radio and Print $1000-$3000

I'm really excited about this new set of songs and the musicians have done an amazing job bringing them to life. I can't wait to get these into your hands!

I'm keeping the incentives pretty simple this time around. They will include pre-orders of the new album, new Gas Station Guru T-shirts, albums and CDs from our back catalogue, and solo front porch or back yard concerts. 

My goal is to raise enough money to print albums and CDs with this campaign. I'll look to other sources for the remainder of the costs. 

I thank you in advance for your generosity in bringing this music to fruition. 

Ted Hefko

story:
Mo' Mojo is a female-led, Pardi-Gras, Zydefusion collective with diatonic accordions, rubboard, twin electric guitars, electric bass, drums, horns, and harmonica. And lots of vocals by everybody.
We've been keeping the homefires burning for a couple years now but prior to that we've taken the show across the states and the world (think Tajikistan - we know it was first in your mind!).
 

It's been 1,460 sunrises since our 4th and most recent album and we are OVERDUE! We have new blood in the band and that means new energy and new tunes. Anybody who appreciates Zydeco, Blues, Mardi Funk, twin guitar, all original writing, female musicianship, and adventure is gonna want this new material to be alive in the universe and not lost in a Flerken's belly. YOU can make that happen. We are in the studio NOW, needing to raise funds for recording, mixing, mastering, product, radio promo, and video. (One quick search on YouTube/Vimeo will tell you that we REALLY need your help on the moving pictures part!) Our fan base has been so wonderful and loyal through the years. You've always been there for us, something for which we're eternally grateful. Please be the foundation for this creative quest through your contributions to this campaign. We want to get this to you at light speed and we can't do it alone. We need your help to make it so.

Our hard goals are: recording 9 original tunes featuring  9 musicians, vinyl and digital download (now is your time to request CDs), 2 videos, and a targeted national radio promotion. As we raise money, it will be allocated in the order above. We're thinking out of the $10,000, it will ROUGHLY break down as follows:  $5K for album production (studio time, physical and digital products), $2K for video, $3K for radio promotion. And as we're looking at that math right now, we're thinking we're probably going to be $5K short! If we raise more than our goal, we'll apply it to more production, video, radio promotion, and... touring. 

We've created several reward levels to help with our campaign. We encourage you to explore all the options. If you can't help financially, even sharing this campaign (on social media, via email, or with Indiegogo's share tools) is of value to us. Please spread the word!

Personal message from Jen (the lone original member): "One of the hurdles bands face is having the right members at the right time. Right now we are on fire! Everybody's on board. We have a "Golden" alumnus back. We have two crazy good brand new members. We have an original member guesting on a couple songs.  We've got energy, we've got spirit, we've got drive. And so far, this is the most musically collaborative we've been in our multi-decade history. This is a recharged version of Mo' Mojo that needs to be out in the world..."
