story:
••• Cognizance •••

Awareness. Experience. Growth. My second full-length studio album, the best quality album I have created to date, and in depth art project! Exploring community, love, fear, & awareness. Pushing myself sonically beyond anything I have ever created and reaching into the depths of my soul to bring to life art with a message through music that keeps the mind guessing and the heart happy!

••• My Purpose •••

Hello! My name is Brenda Carsey. The art I create and what inspires me to the core is music and community.  

I find myself drawn to a path of service through creating safe spaces for people of all walks of life to come together, be themselves, and make friends. It wasn’t until recently that I accepted my passion for Creating and Holding space for others as part of my art. When my partner Will first told me that community was at the very center of who I am as an artist I didn’t believe him. I told him “Bringing people together is not art, it’s just logistics and planning and a fun hobby”. But now, two years down the line since he shared those words with me, I see what he truly meant. My art is community and the medium I work in and share that through is music. Music is my absolute joy and is my way of connecting with others.

Three years ago I opened myself and my art fully to you with my very first crowdfunding campaign. It was both a beautiful and intense experience. Sharing my story publicly, reflecting on myself, my life, what exactly my art was, how I wanted to grow, what my goals were to get there, and asking for help... the whole process was tremendously transforming for me and challenged me in ways I had never experienced. With the support of 168 people -- family, friends, and fans -- I was able to successfully meet and surpass my financial goal which truly kickstarted my advancement, my motivation, my business knowledge, and my willingness to make sacrifice to see something massive through to the end. I thank you all eternally for the push I needed to set my dreams and ambitions in motion!

From the support of that crowdfunding campaign, I went straight into the studio to record my first full-length studio album. In only six and a half days we tracked drums, bass, piano, lead vocals, harmonies, guitar, cello, violin, trumpet, tenor sax, and baritone sax for 10 songs of what would eventually become my album "Solitary Refinement". Working with engineer and co-producer Brian Frederick and a handful of talented and wonderful musicians, we created something truly unique and inspiring. After tracking, we went into mixing the album, leaving a full eight hour work day plus extra half day for notes for each song! After all of the tracking was done, we did mastering, another full 8 hour work day. All of this amidst juggling a day job, gigging in evenings, curating community events, spending time with family, friends, commuting, and all the other normal unexpected oddities life brings. After all of the beauty of creation and perfecting was complete, I then started working on album art, music video concepts, merchandise, fulfilling and packaging all of the rewards for everyone who had donated, and planning the album release show and album tour. 100% of the money raised from that first crowdfunding campaign went into the making of the album from capturing the music to compensating everyone who performed to mixing and mastering the album to packaging and distribution. Everything that came after the capturing and packaging of the album came out of my own pocket from expanding my band to touring to other merch to website building to PR.

In the past two years since the release of “Solitary Refinement” I have toured much of the US (all of CA, OR, WA, ID, UT, NV, AZ, NY, TN, KY, AK), played Lightning In A Bottle Festival, played larger and more reputable venues locally (Hotel Cafe, Bootleg Theater, Moroccan Lounge, The Satellite, Teragram Ballroom, and had a month long residency at Harvard & Stone and with Sofar Sounds LA), released three music videos (“Don’t Sell Yourself”, “Sad, Sad Moon”, “No More”), all the while continuing to advocate for art and music in my community through curating events and opportunities for independent artists and musicians to express themselves and share their art through Wonder & Awe Productions (the name used for my curated event experiences). These events include open safe spaces for singer songwriters, multi-genre live music events, festivals that partner with non-profits to support local music and visual art while raising awareness, funding, and collecting donations for these non-profit partners. 

In addition to all of the above, for the past two years I have continued to write new music inspired by my life as I know it and inspired by people and situations I observe around me -- family, love, breakups, public shootings, partying, fear, depression, isolation, the experience of being a woman in the music industry and in life at large, finding new love, and much more! All of these experiences inspired music that I am now ready to record! It is time to continue to grow, time to get back into the studio, time to make something more beautiful and unique than I have ever made before, and time again to reach out to you to ask for help. I truly cannot do this without you!

••• Past Projects •••

Here are my past albums to quench your curiosity and experience through sound my growth as an artist and human on this planet. I will continue to push myself to create ever-inspiring art with a message through music that keeps the mind guessing and the heart happy! With your help, I know we can truly create something that pushes boundaries and inspires!

Solitary Refinement (2017): https://brendacarsey.bandcamp.com/album/solitar...

Satya (2014): https://brendacarsey.bandcamp.com/album/satya

Lazy Daze (2012): https://brendacarsey.bandcamp.com/album/lazy-daze

Side Show (2011): https://brendacarsey.bandcamp.com/album/side-show

This is my heart and soul. This music is for YOU. This is what I do and how I can contribute to the world and connect with the fascinating souls in it. Learn more

••• The Album •••

COGNIZANCE. Awareness. Experience. Growth. A state of being aware with knowledge gained from personal experience.

I will record a full-length, 10 track (and possibly up to 12 track) album with the help of a talented team consisting of a talented a reputable audio engineer and co-producer, a talented mixing engineer, a professional mastering engineer, and my amazingly talented friends and band members of 'Brenda Carsey & the Awe' Matt Brundrett (drums), Sherome Petty (Bass), Nazim Chambi (Guitar), Rebecca Schlappich (violin), and Jean-Paul Barjon (cello) and more! 

Every element of this album will be played by a human on a real instrument. We will be experimenting with live capturing via mic placements, partitions, different rooms and locations, and beautiful amps, mics, and instruments. This will be my second full-length studio album and the best quality album with the most creative approach I have created to date! This album will be fluid and flexible, receiving perspective and input not only from myself but from the audio engineer and from the other musicians as well. In this way I can truly cultivate an environment where my team's collective strengths will contribute to the greater whole. I am so excited to reach out for help and to bring a team and a community together to be part of the creation of this album!

••• Real Piano •••

I have been playing piano since the age of 10. I began by messing around and writing on my family upright piano and would also use my clarinet sheet music and choir music to dabble deeper into the instrument that fills me with joy! I have not yet had the opportunity in my life to record an album featuring me playing on a real piano. As a pianist I feel I must have this experience. To capture my music on a real grand piano, in a room with beautiful acoustics, capturing every nuance, every overtone, every reverberating note, would truly be a dream and bring so much warmth and realness to the music and to the record.

••• The Sound •••

This album can sonically be described primarily as 'Alternative Soul’ and secondarily as "Progressive Pop", two genres that I have coined for myself after playing all across the country and locally in Los Angeles with a myriad of band set-ups for a wide variety of people. The songs are extraordinarily honest, exposed, and keep the listener guessing. There is a feeling of freedom, poetic lyrics accompanied by fluid melodies, engaging chord progressions, funky rhythms, and a voice filled with passion and soul. My vision includes piano, Rhodes, voice, harmonies, drums, bass, guitar, and strings and possibly horns too! No holding back for this sonic creation! The music for this album has not yet been recorded! But you can get a little live taste of 4 of the songs here!

“Party’s Over”

“Unfortunate Men”

“Home”

“Rebel Walls”

••• What's at Stake? •••

I've put every ounce of my soul into this project and into living genuinely for my passion and believing in myself. What is at stake is this music and this message not reaching as wide of an audience as I hope and envision for it and prolonged production processes due to my not meeting my financial goal. Each component of this project is incredibly important and needed for complete success — from making the best album with the best musicians and best audio engineer and sound team we can to packaging everything beautifully with compelling visual art in the form of photography and video to touring and marketing the album so it has a chance at thriving and expanding. From writing 16 songs, I will be narrowing them down to 10 to 12 songs for the album that really share my story, my observations of the world around me, my experiences, and my love from the past two years. This album shares messages of community, transparency, love, growing, partying, family relationships, overcoming depression, acknowledging pain, and more. I can't wait to share this music with YOU!

••• How Can You Help? •••

In order to bring this project to life, I NEED your help. Your contributions will literally change my life. Not only by allowing me to create and share the best album we can make but also by inspiring me with your support and belief, allowing me to share the message of “Cognizance” - a state of being aware with knowledge gained from personal experience. You will be in my heart and mind throughout the creation process and after as we share what YOU helped make possible.

Please

1) Click the pink "Back It" button now at the top right of this page!

2) Choose an amount you feel good about and select the accompanying reward. I have thought very deeply about these rewards and have done my best to make them fun, unique, and memorable as a token of my appreciation for your help!

3) Tell your friends! Share this IndieGogo link everywhere you can - this is a HUGE help! Places you can help to share the message: Facebook posts on your wall, in your stories, or private messages; Instagram posts and stories; Email, Twitter, Tumblr, Snapchat, etc. Let’s get this IndieGogo page out into the world throughout our circles of family and friends and beyond!

••• Anticipated Costs and Breakdown •••

Making The Album - $20,700​

I have spent six months meeting with different producers and engineers and visiting different studio spaces to find the right space, the right team, the right attitude, and to forecast a realistic budget for recording this album. 

Funds will go towards covering:

studio time • the audio engineer • producer • musicians day rates • mixing • mastering

Vinyl And Online Distribution - $4,600

It has always been my dream to create a vinyl album. There is something truly special about vinyl records: the tones, the warmth, the liveliness, the tangibility of it all, the printed front and back cover artwork. It is sincerely a work of art. And I wholeheartedly feel this is my time, this is the album, these are the songs that are meant to be pressed into a timeless piece of auditory art. I would love to have this available for those who enjoy listening to music in this way and as an artifact that can live on past me. The album will also of course be available on all major music platforms online. 

Funds will go towards covering:

album artwork design (photographer, location, editing, formatting)  • vinyl manufacturing • costs associated with submitting music for digital distribution

Music Video - $3000

Visual art is incredibly important to me and is as much a part of the album as the music. We will create at least one professional and beautiful piece of visual art to represent the albums flavor, texture, and meaning through video.

Funds will go towards covering:

director • videographer • lighting • actors • video editing • coloring

Rewards Manufacturing and Shipment - $1000

Costs incurred from making rewards and safely shipping out rewards with appropriate packaging - (vinyl, polaroid pictures, posters, t-shirts, stickers, pins)

Marketing via Tour + Press - $10,000

After waiting patiently for two years and doing everything in my power to find the perfect space, perfect team, and perfect musicians, I cannot wait to finally create “Cognizance”! But what happens after? I am an independent artist with no label or management team. I would very much like to publicize this album to the world as best I can! — to give “Cognizance" a real chance of finding its audience, so people outside of my circle of family, friends, and local fans can hear the music. Promotional costs can be exponential. I will promote as resourcefully as possible to maximize the results.

Funds will go towards covering:

Album release tour (transportation, musicians, lodging, gear rental) • PR to promote the album in well-known magazines, blogs, radio, playlists

••• Risks and challenges •••

There are many unforeseen challenges that can occur but I feel confident in the team I have put together and confident in my work ethic and passion to make the completion of this album happen no matter what! The main challenge will be creating, manufacturing, and mailing out/sending/performing the rewards in a quick (though not rushed) amount of time. But I can say confidently, WE CAN DO THIS TOGETHER! And I can't wait!
story_txt: ••• Cognizance •••Awareness. Experience. Growth. My second full-length studio album, the best quality album I have created to date, and in depth art project! Exploring community, love, fear, & awareness. Pushing myself sonically beyond anything I have ever created and reaching into the depths of my soul to bring to life art with a message through music that keeps the mind guessing and the heart happy!••• My Purpose •••Hello! My name is Brenda Carsey. The art I create and what inspires me to the core is music and community.  I find myself drawn to a path of service through creating safe spaces for people of all walks of life to come together, be themselves, and make friends. It wasn’t until recently that I accepted my passion for Creating and Holding space for others as part of my art. When my partner Will first told me that community was at the very center of who I am as an artist I didn’t believe him. I told him “Bringing people together is not art, it’s just logistics and planning and a fun hobby”. But now, two years down the line since he shared those words with me, I see what he truly meant. My art is community and the medium I work in and share that through is music. Music is my absolute joy and is my way of connecting with others.Three years ago I opened myself and my art fully to you with my very first crowdfunding campaign. It was both a beautiful and intense experience. Sharing my story publicly, reflecting on myself, my life, what exactly my art was, how I wanted to grow, what my goals were to get there, and asking for help... the whole process was tremendously transforming for me and challenged me in ways I had never experienced. With the support of 168 people -- family, friends, and fans -- I was able to successfully meet and surpass my financial goal which truly kickstarted my advancement, my motivation, my business knowledge, and my willingness to make sacrifice to see something massive through to the end. I thank you all eternally for the push I needed to set my dreams and ambitions in motion!From the support of that crowdfunding campaign, I went straight into the studio to record my first full-length studio album. In only six and a half days we tracked drums, bass, piano, lead vocals, harmonies, guitar, cello, violin, trumpet, tenor sax, and baritone sax for 10 songs of what would eventually become my album "Solitary Refinement". Working with engineer and co-producer Brian Frederick and a handful of talented and wonderful musicians, we created something truly unique and inspiring. After tracking, we went into mixing the album, leaving a full eight hour work day plus extra half day for notes for each song! After all of the tracking was done, we did mastering, another full 8 hour work day. All of this amidst juggling a day job, gigging in evenings, curating community events, spending time with family, friends, commuting, and all the other normal unexpected oddities life brings. After all of the beauty of creation and perfecting was complete, I then started working on album art, music video concepts, merchandise, fulfilling and packaging all of the rewards for everyone who had donated, and planning the album release show and album tour. 100% of the money raised from that first crowdfunding campaign went into the making of the album from capturing the music to compensating everyone who performed to mixing and mastering the album to packaging and distribution. Everything that came after the capturing and packaging of the album came out of my own pocket from expanding my band to touring to other merch to website building to PR.In the past two years since the release of “Solitary Refinement” I have toured much of the US (all of CA, OR, WA, ID, UT, NV, AZ, NY, TN, KY, AK), played Lightning In A Bottle Festival, played larger and more reputable venues locally (Hotel Cafe, Bootleg Theater, Moroccan Lounge, The Satellite, Teragram Ballroom, and had a month long residency at Harvard & Stone and with Sofar Sounds LA), released three music videos (“Don’t Sell Yourself”, “Sad, Sad Moon”, “No More”), all the while continuing to advocate for art and music in my community through curating events and opportunities for independent artists and musicians to express themselves and share their art through Wonder & Awe Productions (the name used for my curated event experiences). These events include open safe spaces for singer songwriters, multi-genre live music events, festivals that partner with non-profits to support local music and visual art while raising awareness, funding, and collecting donations for these non-profit partners. In addition to all of the above, for the past two years I have continued to write new music inspired by my life as I know it and inspired by people and situations I observe around me -- family, love, breakups, public shootings, partying, fear, depression, isolation, the experience of being a woman in the music industry and in life at large, finding new love, and much more! All of these experiences inspired music that I am now ready to record! It is time to continue to grow, time to get back into the studio, time to make something more beautiful and unique than I have ever made before, and time again to reach out to you to ask for help. I truly cannot do this without you!••• Past Projects •••Here are my past albums to quench your curiosity and experience through sound my growth as an artist and human on this planet. I will continue to push myself to create ever-inspiring art with a message through music that keeps the mind guessing and the heart happy! With your help, I know we can truly create something that pushes boundaries and inspires!Solitary Refinement (2017): https://brendacarsey.bandcamp.com/album/solitar...Satya (2014): https://brendacarsey.bandcamp.com/album/satyaLazy Daze (2012): https://brendacarsey.bandcamp.com/album/lazy-dazeSide Show (2011): https://brendacarsey.bandcamp.com/album/side-showThis is my heart and soul. This music is for YOU. This is what I do and how I can contribute to the world and connect with the fascinating souls in it. Learn more••• The Album •••COGNIZANCE. Awareness. Experience. Growth. A state of being aware with knowledge gained from personal experience.I will record a full-length, 10 track (and possibly up to 12 track) album with the help of a talented team consisting of a talented a reputable audio engineer and co-producer, a talented mixing engineer, a professional mastering engineer, and my amazingly talented friends and band members of 'Brenda Carsey & the Awe' Matt Brundrett (drums), Sherome Petty (Bass), Nazim Chambi (Guitar), Rebecca Schlappich (violin), and Jean-Paul Barjon (cello) and more! Every element of this album will be played by a human on a real instrument. We will be experimenting with live capturing via mic placements, partitions, different rooms and locations, and beautiful amps, mics, and instruments. This will be my second full-length studio album and the best quality album with the most creative approach I have created to date! This album will be fluid and flexible, receiving perspective and input not only from myself but from the audio engineer and from the other musicians as well. In this way I can truly cultivate an environment where my team's collective strengths will contribute to the greater whole. I am so excited to reach out for help and to bring a team and a community together to be part of the creation of this album!••• Real Piano •••I have been playing piano since the age of 10. I began by messing around and writing on my family upright piano and would also use my clarinet sheet music and choir music to dabble deeper into the instrument that fills me with joy! I have not yet had the opportunity in my life to record an album featuring me playing on a real piano. As a pianist I feel I must have this experience. To capture my music on a real grand piano, in a room with beautiful acoustics, capturing every nuance, every overtone, every reverberating note, would truly be a dream and bring so much warmth and realness to the music and to the record.••• The Sound •••This album can sonically be described primarily as 'Alternative Soul’ and secondarily as "Progressive Pop", two genres that I have coined for myself after playing all across the country and locally in Los Angeles with a myriad of band set-ups for a wide variety of people. The songs are extraordinarily honest, exposed, and keep the listener guessing. There is a feeling of freedom, poetic lyrics accompanied by fluid melodies, engaging chord progressions, funky rhythms, and a voice filled with passion and soul. My vision includes piano, Rhodes, voice, harmonies, drums, bass, guitar, and strings and possibly horns too! No holding back for this sonic creation! The music for this album has not yet been recorded! But you can get a little live taste of 4 of the songs here!“Party’s Over”“Unfortunate Men”“Home”“Rebel Walls”••• What's at Stake? •••I've put every ounce of my soul into this project and into living genuinely for my passion and believing in myself. What is at stake is this music and this message not reaching as wide of an audience as I hope and envision for it and prolonged production processes due to my not meeting my financial goal. Each component of this project is incredibly important and needed for complete success — from making the best album with the best musicians and best audio engineer and sound team we can to packaging everything beautifully with compelling visual art in the form of photography and video to touring and marketing the album so it has a chance at thriving and expanding. From writing 16 songs, I will be narrowing them down to 10 to 12 songs for the album that really share my story, my observations of the world around me, my experiences, and my love from the past two years. This album shares messages of community, transparency, love, growing, partying, family relationships, overcoming depression, acknowledging pain, and more. I can't wait to share this music with YOU!••• How Can You Help? •••In order to bring this project to life, I NEED your help. Your contributions will literally change my life. Not only by allowing me to create and share the best album we can make but also by inspiring me with your support and belief, allowing me to share the message of “Cognizance” - a state of being aware with knowledge gained from personal experience. You will be in my heart and mind throughout the creation process and after as we share what YOU helped make possible.Please1) Click the pink "Back It" button now at the top right of this page!2) Choose an amount you feel good about and select the accompanying reward. I have thought very deeply about these rewards and have done my best to make them fun, unique, and memorable as a token of my appreciation for your help!3) Tell your friends! Share this IndieGogo link everywhere you can - this is a HUGE help! Places you can help to share the message: Facebook posts on your wall, in your stories, or private messages; Instagram posts and stories; Email, Twitter, Tumblr, Snapchat, etc. Let’s get this IndieGogo page out into the world throughout our circles of family and friends and beyond!••• Anticipated Costs and Breakdown •••Making The Album - $20,700​I have spent six months meeting with different producers and engineers and visiting different studio spaces to find the right space, the right team, the right attitude, and to forecast a realistic budget for recording this album. Funds will go towards covering:studio time • the audio engineer • producer • musicians day rates • mixing • masteringVinyl And Online Distribution - $4,600It has always been my dream to create a vinyl album. There is something truly special about vinyl records: the tones, the warmth, the liveliness, the tangibility of it all, the printed front and back cover artwork. It is sincerely a work of art. And I wholeheartedly feel this is my time, this is the album, these are the songs that are meant to be pressed into a timeless piece of auditory art. I would love to have this available for those who enjoy listening to music in this way and as an artifact that can live on past me. The album will also of course be available on all major music platforms online. Funds will go towards covering:album artwork design (photographer, location, editing, formatting)  • vinyl manufacturing • costs associated with submitting music for digital distributionMusic Video - $3000Visual art is incredibly important to me and is as much a part of the album as the music. We will create at least one professional and beautiful piece of visual art to represent the albums flavor, texture, and meaning through video.Funds will go towards covering:director • videographer • lighting • actors • video editing • coloringRewards Manufacturing and Shipment - $1000Costs incurred from making rewards and safely shipping out rewards with appropriate packaging - (vinyl, polaroid pictures, posters, t-shirts, stickers, pins)Marketing via Tour + Press - $10,000After waiting patiently for two years and doing everything in my power to find the perfect space, perfect team, and perfect musicians, I cannot wait to finally create “Cognizance”! But what happens after? I am an independent artist with no label or management team. I would very much like to publicize this album to the world as best I can! — to give “Cognizance" a real chance of finding its audience, so people outside of my circle of family, friends, and local fans can hear the music. Promotional costs can be exponential. I will promote as resourcefully as possible to maximize the results.Funds will go towards covering:Album release tour (transportation, musicians, lodging, gear rental) • PR to promote the album in well-known magazines, blogs, radio, playlists••• Risks and challenges •••There are many unforeseen challenges that can occur but I feel confident in the team I have put together and confident in my work ethic and passion to make the completion of this album happen no matter what! The main challenge will be creating, manufacturing, and mailing out/sending/performing the rewards in a quick (though not rushed) amount of time. But I can say confidently, WE CAN DO THIS TOGETHER! And I can't wait!

story:
We Had This Crazy Idea

There’s a small island on the Pacific coast of Canada with 900 people, one general store, two ferries away from the nearest town.

Long story short, we sold everything, packed our bags, and left. 

On Hornby Island, you might see more eagles than people, and the only loud neighbours are the sea lions at the edge of the shore. 

It’s wild, beautiful, and mysterious. 

New Album, New Sound, New Us

While we were on the island, we asked ourselves: How could we express our transformation in a musical form? 

The answer was a new album and a new sound for the new us. 

We made nine songs that reflect our “re-wilding” and reconnection with ourselves—with nature, and its cycles. 

For us, it feels like a sacred album for these disconnected times.

Keep it Going

As you know, a music project is a big endeavor. After the creative process, it means recording, promoting, and touring in order to reach more people.

Now that we’ve walked a part of the journey, we need your support to keep it going. 

We feel like this album is a big turning point for us, and with it, we’d like to take this “rewilding” mission as far as we can. 

We believe that the world needs more voices that remind us of who we are, and that bring out the humanity that connects us to each other. 

 

What We Need (CAD)

Recording, mixing, and mastering: 1'500

Album Art 600

Online distribution 100

CD manufacturing 1'500

Music videos 1’000

CD distribution 200

Album Launch EU 2'500

Album Launch NA  5'000

 

What You Get

The satisfaction of having helped some nice people ;)

Advanced access to all our music

Tickets to some of our concerts

Artwork from the album 

Music lessons and meditation classes

House concerts 

"Simple living" workshops about how to simplify your life

And some surprises that we're saving for later...
 

What happens if we don’t get what we need?

Well, we’ll be a little bummed for a while. But after that, we’ll focus on getting the recording done and see how we make any of the rest.

 

The Impact

We believe that the world needs more voices that remind us of who we are, and that brings out the humanity that connects us to each other. 

We went to the other end of the world to find the space and the time we needed to finally reconnect with ourselves.

The transformation we experienced has already caused a great impact on us and the ones around us. This project is the attempt to enlarge that impact, and facilitate a space of reconnection through music, anytime, anywhere. 
 

The Challenges We May Face

We’re two very versatile people who are used to artistic bumps and bruises. 

Today, Esther is a singer and voice coach but for a long time, she was a touring actress. Marc is a published writer and a former classical pianist and multi-instrumentalist.

We released a previous album two years ago and since then, we’ve toured regularly—slowly building up an audience using other “Marc talents” for things like branding and content creation.

We’re in this for the long run, and we're ready to fully combine all our talents, learnings [f*k-ups], and our love for the craft of making music. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Ok so you can’t contribute cash, and that’s (kind of) okay with us. But if you still like us and wish us well, here’s what you can do. 

Tell others about us. 

If you already have and love our music, tell other people about it.

Share our stuff online and tell other people about it. 

Send us an email to say hi and wish us luck. 

 

Thank you so much, and hope to see you soon :)

Love, Marc & Esther

story:
After a successful launch of our streaming series, we have decided to try and keep the streaming concerts going with two new local bands a week! We're trying to pay our staff and bands some money for making these shows possible. Every little bit you can donate helps us keep local music alive and ensures Launchpad can come back stronger than ever. At the same time, we're going to try and interview all the bands. We wanna get a sense of what the Albuquerque music scene looks like right now, in this very pivotal moment for our community. 

We'll be filming and editing all of the concert footage together and adding a professionally mixed audio from our Launchpad sound engineer. Our goal with this project is to deliver quality filmed concerts featuring some of New Mexico's top and most exciting bands. If that's something you'd like to see, then please support our project. 

---------

Launchpad has been a staple in the Albuquerque music scene for over 20 years. It has been a home to local bands and a beloved stop for national and international touring acts, countless musicians have played the Launchpad stage to audiences of all ages. 

Live concerts have been on hold at Launchpad since early March. Most events have been canceled for the remainder of the year as we all do our best to defeat COVID-19. Now as we look forward towards an uncertain future, we need to adapt. That's why we're trying something new at Launchpad!

We are trying to launch....a streaming concert series at Launchpad. Our plan is to film some of our favorite local bands playing in the Launchpad and stream the concerts once a week on our social media platforms. All social distancing guidelines will be practices. Only band members, a sound tech and a film tech will be allowed in the building. Masks will be worn for set up, and bands will be spaced out 6 feet for the filming.

We need some funding though. We are going to be paying the bands and crew for their time. 
We're hoping to raise $3000 to film four-six more concerts. If we raise more we can film more bands!
We'd like to keep this going as long as we need to or until we are able to gather for concerts again. So anything you can contribute would help immensely, even if all you can do is share this campaign. 

Please help keep Launchpad and local music alive in Albuquerque!

Thanks for your support.

story:
UPDATE

I completed the recording of vocals and acoustic guitar for all 10 songs! I am now working on the arrangement of other instruments. Any money contribution makes a difference to help me complete the project!

Album Concept

X/O (undefined) is a re-framing of the abbreviation of affection. The O acts as zero where any number divided by zero is undefined. Relationships have symmetry; they begin and end in a state of unknown. This album is a result of the physical and emotional distance that I experienced this year, along with challenges related to transience and dislocation. If you have dealt with loss and uncertainty this year, I hope this music will resonate and transform those experiences for you, as they did for me.

My previous works

 

My Story

Turmoil of the Constant Traveler

I’ve not lived in any place for more than a few months since September 2017. My Girlfriend moved overseas for graduate studies and I uprooted my life in Portland, Oregon and embarked on an adventure. I stored my guitars and got rid of my possessions, except for what could be carried on a plane. I made a mobile studio that fit in my suitcase and with a travel sized guitar I set off—all while completing a Bachelors degree at the renown Berklee College of Music, using their online portal. I always had a safe and healthy environment but at times my journey wasn’t glamorous. When not with my girlfriend many places were sublets of one to three months between trips to the UK.

I returned home in February on the eve of the pandemic meltdown and made a mad dash across the country from Austin to Nashville and back to California, where I grew up. It had been over 5 years since being back home, and I hadn’t left of the best of terms, but returning was a powerful emotional experience of reconciliation. Reunited with my acoustic guitar, named Sol, I got back to my songwriting roots—Just Sol and I making cool vibrations.


On my journey I gained perspective about the value of home, friendship and a community.

Your Impact!

You connecting with the music is most important. If you are inspired to share this campaign  it will fuel the creative process. A financial contribution will make a huge difference in access to equipment and compensation for my contributing musical and visual artists.

If you have an idea for a perk that isn’t listed contact the team!

Budget

Estimated Completion

The target arrival for physical items is December 24th, 2020. My goal is to mix between November 1st to November 14th, so the early access digital content may be available sooner.

 

Sara Vierra

Isn't her work lovely? Sara has agreed to contribute artwork to the project. Check out the perks tagged with her name such as the cyrpto art perk or the physical prints!

Examples of her previous works:

 

Parting Words

In addition to the direct fundraising commitment to charity, I am proud to announce I will contribute a portion of the album’s earning to charity in perpetuity, in support of emerging artist.

I am proof that things in your life that seem insurmountable can be mended, healed and overcome. I send you my love and gratitude. Thank you for your support!

 

LIKE · SHARE · LISTEN

Instagram · Spotify

story:
About The Album

'Brush Strokes' brings the classic sounds of jazz rhythms, vibes, and instrumentation into the world of hip-hop. Freak Tha Monsta crafted the boom bap soundscape that jumps around from the fast-paced heist adventure to the sultry love letter to the empowering, uplifting anthem, and so on. Freak and Miggs offer the familiar NY lyricism and are joined by the soulful MothaBug on vocals. The three weave in and out of Freak's dynamic jazzy production to create a flavorful collection of tracks. Basslines throughout are provided by Jeff DeRosa. Some cuttin' and scratchin' by DJ Akil, and the album is hosted by Savannah legend Ike Carter. In the words of Mr. Carter, "Prepare yourself for a wonderful experience..."

Front Cover
Back Cover/Tracklist

 

Here's The Deal...

An album like this NEEDS to be pressed on wax. It's only right! The actual record will have a unique splatter design with colors that beautifully compliment the cover art.  250 records will be pressed, but only 200 will be available for purchase through this campaign.

This is far from a charity. If you purchase the album, you get the album. Simple and plain. Everything is explained in detail in the next section below. Every dollar made from a pre-order or album sale through this campaign will go directly towards the pressing and processing of the records. Of course, feel free to give more if you'd like. That's always appreciated. Just hit the "BACK IT" button up top.

If you can't give to the campaign, we understand, but we do ask that you share the campaign link and our video for "The New" to help get the word out.

Break It Down For The People

  • Our goal is $3,500 and here's how it breaks down.
    • Record Pressing: $2,500
    • Tax & Shipping: $350
    • Record/CD Packaging & Shipping to YOU: $650

*If we surpass our goal, but there are more physical copies left, those orders will be fulfilled.

*If we don't reach our goal, no worries.....we will still be getting the records pressed. It may just take a little longer.

Timeline

As soon as we reach our goal, or the end of the campaign (whichever comes first), the order will be placed to have the records pressed. We estimate that we'll begin shipping records out to YOU on Oct 1st. The turnaround for records is much longer than CDs. CDs will most likely begin shipping to YOU on Sept. 15th. All backers who purchase a record or CD will receive the album digitally as soon as 'Brush Strokes' is released. The album will be emailed as a zip file and include the cover art.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everybody got it like that. We understand. If you can't make a financial contribution, you can still help!

  • Share our video for "The New" by using this link: https://youtu.be/bzeXpiWvRow
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the work with your friends and family.

Yall are the best!

Thanks
story_txt:
About The Album
'Brush Strokes' brings the classic sounds of jazz rhythms, vibes, and instrumentation into the world of hip-hop. Freak Tha Monsta crafted the boom bap soundscape that jumps around from the fast-paced heist adventure to the sultry love letter to the empowering, uplifting anthem, and so on. Freak and Miggs offer the familiar NY lyricism and are joined by the soulful MothaBug on vocals. The three weave in and out of Freak's dynamic jazzy production to create a flavorful collection of tracks. Basslines throughout are provided by Jeff DeRosa. Some cuttin' and scratchin' by DJ Akil, and the album is hosted by Savannah legend Ike Carter. In the words of Mr. Carter, "Prepare yourself for a wonderful experience..."

story:
Short Summary

 

Hey ya'll So I am Jordan Brodie and I am Mr. Orange County Pride 2019.

Today is my Birthday. I'm turning 28 and all I want is for ya'll to donate to my fundraiser for the Human Rights Campaign. My idea is to get a song I wrote called "We Are the Future" recorded and produced. Then make a fun video to promote advocacy for LGBTQiA Rights.

As Mr. OC Pride my platform is Volunteering and Voting so I will be doing a volunteer fair as well as a politcal drag show this year to raise money to support Orange County Pride, The Orange County Imperial Court and The Human Rights Campaign.

The Human Rights Campaign has advocated for LGBTQiA Rights for more then a decade and are the reason why some laws are being changed in support of Equality for all. I want to support them and give back to them because attending their yearly conference Time To Thrive changed my life.

So, Please dig deep if you can. It means so much to me and us all.

Best,

Jordan Brodie

Mr. OC Pride 2019

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

So to get a song produced it takes me about 8-12 hours with a producer at the rate of 60$to 120$ an hour.

Then to get a video made. I've got to hire a camera crew and performers at various rates. Which can be 4-5 people at 60$to 120$ an hour and up. I'm going to do my best to get as much volunteers as I can to keep the cost down because this will all be for charity.

But, having some funding will help..

Some of the perks of your donation include.

Production Credits,

Participation in Video,

Personal Thank you card,

Personal Thank you video,

Song Written for you,

Solo Performance for you (local only if you're far I can do a video or livestream performance,

and more please check out the perks.

Thank you,

Jordan Brodie

 

The Impact

When we give our money to non-profits we invest in ourselves and the future of our society. The human rights campaign is working hard to ensure the we have safe feature and I want to create this song with a powerful message to help remind our next generation that they have the rights to be involved and stand up for our equality. =D

Risks & Challenges

Some of the risks involved are the hate from people who do not support the LGBTQ people. I myself have been bullied and made fun of by homophobic people. the more work we do to spread awareness and advocate the smaller the gap becomes between our communities. Lets's make a difference.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate you can simply share this with the share tools and encourage friends to donate. or attend my volunteer and political drag show later in the year. There will be plenty of ways for you to be involved.

Best,

Jordan Brodie

 

Thank you!!

story:
• If you were planning to record a live album, you’d restring your guitars, make sure your vocal pipes were in tip top condition, maybe select an appropriate venue, invite a specially selected audience, hire an awesome sound engineer and The Manor Mobile, and rehearse the heck out of the specially selected songs that you were going to play.
  • Well, if only! Those of you who know me will know that I straddle genres between blues, country rock and West Coast Hippy stuff, so a live gig reflects this. I hadn’t planned to record this gig but realised that I had my digital recorder in my kit bag. I flipped it to record in Wav, set it down next to the stage, and pressed record, and played 2 sets to a fairly attentive audience.
  • A day later I though I would check the quality of the recording from an audio point of view. It sounded pretty good for what it was. A little later I decided that I would listen to it to see if it was worth some work to release as a live album, so i listened to each track from 3 viewpoints: 1 - is this a song that doesn’t appear on either of my other CDs (one of which is also live) - if it does appear on one of those CDS, is this performance better - given that I have been performing the songs for a lot longer now. 2 is the vocal performance up to scratch 3 Is the guitar performance up to scratch - no fluffed notes or out of tune guitars.

What I need:

Funds to have the album professionally mastered by Stuart Dixon

Funds to allow for replication of the CD from a glass master

Funds for design and printing of cover

Funds for promotion of CD

What I need:

Funds for design and printing of cover
Funds for promotion of CD

story:
Short Summary

I’m Steve Schuster. For those of you who don’t know me, I’m a singer/songwriter and recording artist. I’ve been writing original indie, classic-rock-style music for over 40 years, including my latest two albums “Sweet Gems” and “Unassembled Man.”

Here on Indiegogo, I’m asking for your help to fund what I hope will become a classic music video and children’s book based on my new unreleased song called “When We Imagine.”

When We Imagine represents a labor of love, born of my vision of inspiring kids of all ages, starting with my 2-year-old grandson Joey who inspired the song. It’s a song that compels kids to be open-minded, free thinkers that realize that anything at all is possible when we imagine.

With your help on this campaign, we can together celebrate the power of imagination by bringing this video and kids book to life.

Thanks so much. With your generous help, anything can happen for these kids – anything at all when we imagine!

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • I'll be working with Italian animator Sara Soncini, a genuine talent experienced with creating music videos and creative videos for children, combining fun and learning. Sara's fee for creating the full-length animation is $1500 USD.
  • My stretch goal is to fund the development of a companion book to the song and video. I envision printing some example copies and then circulating it to children's book publishers.
  • I also envision starting the When We Imagine Foundation to bring educational music to children in underprivileged circumstances.
  • Depending on how the campaign goes, I'll apply any excess funds to the development of a second children's video of another unreleased song, "Sassafras Supersonic," and beyond that to the recording of my next album (already written!).
  • Even if I don't make my funding goal, I'll apply all funds to the animation of "When We Imagine." I'm committed to making this happen!

The Impact

By joining the We Can Imagine journey:

  • You will be an instrumental (no pun intended) part of launching an instant classic children's song, video and book
  • You will be supporting the indie rock music movement
  • You will help make a positive impact that encourages kids to use their sky-is-the-limit power of imagination

Risks & Challenges

This project is relatively low risk, but

  • The animator could conceivably cancel, requiring securing a new animator, delaying delivery of several of the perks

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign on your social media channels, just to help get the word out.

story:
Overview

We are so excited to release our 2nd full-length album! ‘Carried in Retrospect’ is an invitation to revisit the past through the eyes of and with the wisdom of the present moment, and a continuation of the story we began 5 years ago with 'Humble Beginnings...' It is an unpretentious retelling of stories from Tobin and Vanessa Bawinkel's lives and the lives of their grandparents and great-grandparents and a joyful invitation to celebrate the beautiful, fleeting moments of today. 

“Our words can paint a picture, but a song can clothe a life.” - "Vanessa's Song", Carried in Retrospect

 

Why Pre-order?

Our goal is to use this pre-order to help cover mastering, album design, CD and Vinyl production, a music video and the cost of marketing/promotion of the album... phewf! It's a lot, we know. Your order on the front end gives us the chance to do this, and every order includes a digital download of the album that will be available at least two weeks prior to the album's release!

So, thank you for all your support! We hope you enjoy some of the limited edition and exclusive merch, and the opportunity to get the album download in your ears ahead of time!

story:
ABOUT

My name is Scott Kettner - drummer, percussionist, educator and bandleader for Nation Beat - a group that explores the deep rooted connections between the music of Brazil and North America.   

Nation Beat has been releasing albums and touring all over North & South America since 2002.  Our music has been featured on NPR and has been recognized by grants from the National Endowment for The Arts and American music icon Willie Nelson. Many of you have accompanied me on this journey where I’ve had the opportunity to share this music and my experiences directly through performances and community workshops as well as my online tutorials and instructional books. But what you might not know is that I have been working for the past 2 years developing a new sound for Nation Beat that I’m really excited to finally share with you.  I’d like to invite you to join us on the next stop of this musical journey. 

A New Recording by Nation Beat

In an increasingly globalized music industry our sound aims to reach into the roots-based traditions and bring those voices to the surface by creating cross-cultural music that impacts the people around us and assures our similarities are stronger than our differences. Our new album is a contemporary call-and-response where brass band and percussion explode in a jazz-infused, funkified New Orleans-meets-Brazil carnival sound.  These explorations are not only exciting musically but they cultivate diverse relationships which empower us to find common ground beyond the music.  Nation Beat's new album will be released on CD, vinyl and digital formats which will be distributed world wide. We will record in late April and release it in November, 2019.

The music will showcase original compositions and standards from Brazil and New Orleans featuring horn arrangements by my good friend and musical partner Paul Carlon.  Nation Beat also features the talents of Joe Correia on sousaphone, Mariel Bildsten on trombone and Mark Collins on trumpet. They’ve been working really hard developing the new sound with me for the past year. 

Independent Music Needs You - To Stay Alive

As you probably know, making an album is a very expensive process - especially to do it right.  The reality of today’s music industry is that people more and more expect music to be free. In order for us to make our music come to life, we need your support. For those of you who have supported us all this time, we thank you and hope you will continue your support.  For all you newcomers, we hope you will see the value of our musical explorations and choose to support us.

The Indiegogo platform allows us to offer our community of friends and fans music, merch, and memories in exchange for your crucial support. When you support this project, you’re joining our Nation. Together, we can make something special that will last forever. 

HYBRID EDUCATION – Music Minus One

I’m also excited to develop the Music Minus One learning module. As an educator, I’m constantly exploring and implementing new ways of enriching the learning experiences of my students and future generations of musicians.  The educational component of this project will help expand my hybrid teaching platform where students learn through online digital media.   Once the new album is recorded I will create a Music Minus One version which will be used as a learning tool for student drummers and percussionists. I will develop learning modules that exclude the drum tracks on the recording so the student can practice along with the band, without the original drum track.  This is an important learning tool for young drummers as it guides them on the exploration of developing a unique voice while being closely related to the traditional rhythms. These play-alongs will be made available through my online academy (worlddrumlessons.com) which currently has over 200 monthly student subscribers worldwide.  Music Minus One will also be made available at our school residencies as well as to my students at the School of Jazz (New School University).   

Where Does Your Money Go? 

If you’re interested to know where your money will go for this professional recording project, below is a breakdown of our working budget to record, manufacture, and promote this album the absolute best we can.  The money that is not raised on this IGG campaign will be supplemented by private and personal funding. 

Production (Studio, Musicians, Producer, & Mixing): $6,500

Mastering: $800

Artwork/Graphic Design: $1000

CD & Vinyl Manufacturing: $3,500

Timeline

April 22-24, 2019: Record the album

May 13-15, 2019: Mixing the album

May 27-28: Mastering the album

October 31, 2019: You will be dancing to our music in your own home!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you are able to contribute to our campaign or not, you can further support our music, by sharing this link with your friends via email and social media.  A share goes a long way in helping us spread the word. 

Thanks for your kind consideration and your support!  Please share our link and ask your friends to join our Nation: http://bit.ly/support-nationbeat

story:
Woman In Music 

Hi! My name is Alysha Brilla; born Alysha Mohamed. I grew up in Brampton, Ontario, but have lived in KW for over half of my life now. I've been in the music industry since I was thirteen years old.  17 years later and the songs keep flowing, thanks to you. 

I signed a major U.S. Record Deal when I was in my late teens and entered the weird and wonderful world of Hollywood. I lived in L.A. for a while as one of the only women of South Asian ancestry signed to a deal...and dealt with a lot of the isms that come along with the industry and my own share of #metoo experiences that ultimately led to me moving back to Canada, producing my own records and having them be nominated for Juno Awards...three times! It has all been such a long and winding journey and has also flown by in what feels like a flash. It hasn't been easy, especially taking the road less travelled, but it has been full of lessons, incredible people and of course...beautiful music. I am still creating because of the support of my friends, family and community. I have had the wonderful experience of singing backup for amazing artists, playing keyboard for some of my musical heroes and now I have a new album I would love to share with you. Throughout the years, I have been connecting with other women and non-binary people in the music world to strengthen the representation of female producers and femme people in decision-making positions and creative roles. We still have a long way to go, but I picture the ideas, visions and expressions of women being highlighted in our global consciousness because I think a balance can be held in the energy and trajectory of the songs we hear and the world we live in.

I am in the process of writing and recording my fifth independently produced and released album titled "The Body" and I would love for you to be a part of the process and support by pre-ordering your copy and other associated goodies in this campaign. You become my record label and your support will help me make and produce a powerful album I feel I can take around the world with meaningful messages and sounds that incorporate nature and the human voice. Despite everything going on in the world, I feel more centred now than I ever have before in my life and this music business and I would love to share these new songs in a beautiful way with you.

"The Body" is a collection of new songs inspired by my life's experience as a human incarnate with autoimmune issues and the relationship I see between our individual body and the body of mother earth. I have experienced disbalance and disease, but also unbelievable strength, resilience and healing. I have seen a lot of the world and our planet from a unique artist and community centred perspective and I want to share my insights of connections between love and physics, biology and spirituality within a musical format. We are at such a critical juncture during human civilization where I really feel art and community creating art together is one of the quickest ways we heal and bridge emotional gaps. "The Body" will feature instrumentation from India including the Veena, tabla, voice and string section. As I produce this album, I will intentionally be supporting female and non-binary musicians, engineers and artists to create a living example of what is possible. Shout out to all of the amazing men I have worked with and who have supported this equitable vision since the awareness came to you. It takes all of us having a new vision to make it come to light. You are key players and I couldn't have made it this far without your generosity of heart. Let's make a healing album. I want to take this record on tour across Canada and elsewhere next year and build community around the musicians I perform with and you at the shows. #TheBody

What your pre-orders of my album help pay for:

 

  • Rehearsal Space
  • Renting a Recording Studio
  • Paying an Engineer
  • Hiring Musicians
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Artwork


I'd really love for you to receive some unique VIP perks I've put together. If you love and are passionate about music, you know the value it brings to your life.
 

What you get!!!


Ok the fun part. I have spent hours thinking "hmmm what would I want from an artist I love?" and put together VIP Perks for you to pre-order and be a part of this record making process with me. My exchanges for your generous support of this album include:

  • Exclusive listening to the record BEFORE it is released
  • Signed CD + Liner Notes
  • Handwritten Lyrics
  • Custom artwork mandala made by me
  • Limited Edition Bracelets made from my old Guitar
  • VIP Studio Recording Session Hangout
  • One on one Skype session (Guitar lesson? Singing Lesson? Advice?)

 

Spotify + How Does an Artist make a living?

Spotify pays $0.0084 per stream and this means that even with 1,000,000 streams, which I just hit this year (woohoo), that's only $1400 per year my song has been up there. That's $116/month, which is...enough to pay my phone bill? To be honest; people buy physical CD's less and less, so the best way you can support an artist is to pre-order the album. If you love listening to my music, following my social media (Instagram/Facebook/Twitter) or reading my blogs, the best way you can support that continued flow of content is to contribute to this current album fundraiser and keep listening and sharing my music. Who knows...maybe this record will be such a hit that I'll be able to build a recording studio in a tiny house and you can all come to my funny farm and we can celebrate!?
 

YOU are my Record Label!

I have been supported and nurtured by you, my community, since I began this musical journey 17 years ago and it has enabled me to make music with integrity, a message and my own unique sound and style. I was ready to give up music when I came back from L.A., but you supported and helped me produce music in my own unique sound and style from my heart to yours.

I have done Indiegogo Campaigns for two of my albums and they were both successful in helping me create Juno Award Nominated records and become one of the few nominated albums to be female produced.

With your pre-orders and support of this album, you become part of my team and allow me to keep making music I hope will uplift, inspire and change the world inside the listeners.

THANK YOU so much for being recipricol in your art consumption and supporting this new music I will be putting my heart and soul into for your heart and soul to receive in 2020.

xoxo

Alysha Brilla

 

"Just 17.1 percent of artists with songs on the Hot 100 charts last year were female."
story_txt:
Woman In Music 
Hi! My name is Alysha Brilla; born Alysha Mohamed. I grew up in Brampton, Ontario, but have lived in KW for over half of my life now. I've been in the music industry since I was thirteen years old.  17 years later and the songs keep flowing, thanks to you. I signed a major U.S. Record Deal when I was in my late teens and entered the weird and wonderful world of Hollywood. I lived in L.A. for a while as one of the only women of South Asian ancestry signed to a deal...and dealt with a lot of the isms that come along with the industry and my own share of #metoo experiences that ultimately led to me moving back to Canada, producing my own records and having them be nominated for Juno Awards...three times! It has all been such a long and winding journey and has also flown by in what feels like a flash. It hasn't been easy, especially taking the road less travelled, but it has been full of lessons, incredible people and of course...beautiful music. I am still creating because of the support of my friends, family and community. I have had the wonderful experience of singing backup for amazing artists, playing keyboard for some of my musical heroes and now I have a new album I would love to share with you. Throughout the years, I have been connecting with other women and non-binary people in the music world to strengthen the representation of female producers and femme people in decision-making positions and creative roles. We still have a long way to go, but I picture the ideas, visions and expressions of women being highlighted in our global consciousness because I think a balance can be held in the energy and trajectory of the songs we hear and the world we live in.I am in the process of writing and recording my fifth independently produced and released album titled "The Body" and I would love for you to be a part of the process and support by pre-ordering your copy and other associated goodies in this campaign. You become my record label and your support will help me make and produce a powerful album I feel I can take around the world with meaningful messages and sounds that incorporate nature and the human voice. Despite everything going on in the world, I feel more centred now than I ever have before in my life and this music business and I would love to share these new songs in a beautiful way with you."The Body" is a collection of new songs inspired by my life's experience as a human incarnate with autoimmune issues and the relationship I see between our individual body and the body of mother earth. I have experienced disbalance and disease, but also unbelievable strength, resilience and healing. I have seen a lot of the world and our planet from a unique artist and community centred perspective and I want to share my insights of connections between love and physics, biology and spirituality within a musical format. We are at such a critical juncture during human civilization where I really feel art and community creating art together is one of the quickest ways we heal and bridge emotional gaps. "The Body" will feature instrumentation from India including the Veena, tabla, voice and string section. As I produce this album, I will intentionally be supporting female and non-binary musicians, engineers and artists to create a living example of what is possible. Shout out to all of the amazing men I have worked with and who have supported this equitable vision since the awareness came to you. It takes all of us having a new vision to make it come to light. You are key players and I couldn't have made it this far without your generosity of heart. Let's make a healing album. I want to take this record on tour across Canada and elsewhere next year and build community around the musicians I perform with and you at the shows. #TheBody

story:
With so much gratitude for your support, I welcome you to be a part of bringing this vision of mine into creation. Your contribution will make it possible to cover the costs and complete the next steps to finish the album giving the wings for these prayers and song spirits to fly into the world. Your support also makes it possible for me to keep writing songs, recording them and sharing them with you all!

I offer this album as a medicine to support the healing of the deeper underlying sicknesses that humanity faces in this moment. Music has the magic, powerful and mysterious ability to go deep to the roots within us, to help us to heal, to feel, to call us back to our hearts... to Guide us home.

These songs speak of the journey of remembering who we truly are, where we really come from and what we are here for. They honour that which is Sacred, the Elements, the Ancestors, the Earth, the Sky, the Wisdom of the invisible kingdom, the Spirit world, the whispers of the Silent Voices that are guiding and reminding us that we are all part of a holy creation, all related, all a breath of the Great Spirit of life.

This album is my offering to the world in this pivotal moment of humanity, my prayer that we may reweave the Sacred web of Life and hand to our children a beautiful world that is thriving. It my offering of gratitude to the spirit world and to the beloved Earth that is our Mother.

For every single contribution towards this campaign a donation will be made to organisations providing COVID-19 relief for indigenous people around the world and those who have the least resources.​

 

 

How you can help 

  •   Pre-order my album now for however much you wish to contribute by selecting one of the perks listed to the right

 If you are unable to Pre-order at this time, not to worry! You can still help in several  important ways:

  •  Share this campaign by word of mouth as well as through social media (Facebook/instagram etc)
  • Email your friends and family around the world (this system works the best).
  • Generally spreading the word!
  •  

(*NOTE ABOUT PAYPAL - If you wish to pay using PayPal then please pay directly to ayla@aylaschafer.co.uk and tell me which perk you have chosen)

 

What You Get

If you wish to Pre-order the album then check on the right side for the amount you wish to choose and the corresponding list of perks that you can receive in exchange for your contribution.

 

Album costs

I have been co-creating this album with producer Txai Fernando and We are now 90% of the way through completion. Your donation will cover the costs so far (which have been loaned to project by NIXI Music) and pay for the finishing costs of the album. Making this all manifest is not an easy mission, nor is it cheap.

The amount raised will cover the recording, production and distribution costs of this album which is, £15,000.

The breakdown of these costs is as follows: 

Recording/studio fees/production/mixing/editing/mastering  - £ 9000

CD Production/download cards -£ 1200

Musician fees - £1500

Artwork and design - £1000

Other expenses, travel etc - £1600

Indiegogo fees - £750

Covid-19 Relief donations - ... ?

Anything raised over this amount will be used to buy the necessary equipment and set up my own home studio so I can record future projects at home.

 

TIMELINE AIMS

We aim to finish the:

Recording, editing and mixing - by end of May

Mastering and Artwork/design - by June

ALBUM LAUNCH - August!

Additional Perks - September - October

 

I am deeply grateful for your generosity, love and support. 
A massive thank you from my heart 
 

x

Ayla

 
 
It has been an amazing and inspiring journey seeing these songs become their full expression. It's an honour and privilege to have this collection of incredible musicians from all around the world sharing their gifts on this album.
 
Adrian Freedman - Shakuhachi
Asha McCarthy - Cello
César Aguilar Alcedo - Charango
Chandra Lacombe - Kalimba and backing vocals
Daniel waples - Hang
Ed Wade-Martins - Berimbau
Eran fakir - Ney
Giselle Real-d'Arbelles - Flute and backing vocals
Helen knight - Backing vocals
Herbert Quinteros - Charango, Quena, Toyos and voices
Hivshu - Spoken voice and drum
Ibou Cissokho - Kora
Joshua Wenzl - Backing vocals and Drum
Lee Westwood - Dulcimer
Michael Stanton - Oktav guitar and backing vocals
Misha Mullov-Abbado - Double bass
Nimrod Nol - Violin
Ricardo Sanchez - Percussion
Rowan Sterk - Percussion
Susie prater - Backing vocals
Txai Fernando - Percussion
Uriel seri - Conga
 
 

Biography

"The wisdom of Mother Earth is clearly channeling through Schafer, and just as our mother is, this music is also stunning." -Chalked up Reviews 

'This soulful songstress will astound you with her stunning vocal prowess and captivating presence. A deeply evocative sound that enchants and inspires beauty’  

– Ben Howard, Island Records - 

Ayla Schafer is a multi-lingual ‘world folk’ singer-songwriter and a visionary musical artist weaving together a stunning repertoire of original poetic songs with traditional and tribal music, her music expressing a passionate dedication to earth consciousness and the sacred ancient wisdoms.  

With a growing international presence she is a powerful voice in the world of ‘ceremonial/medicine music’ and the rising global community of people who are committed to residing in harmony with the Earth. To experience the essence of this young songstress is to be taken down an enchanting musical journey that ultimately leads us back to the very core of our own inner existence. 

www.aylaschafer.co.uk

story:
Who is Ray Of Lightss?

My name is Ray Of Lightss. I am an honorably discharged veteran of the United States Marine Corps who served his country in the Vietnam War. Also, I am a disciple of Jesus Christ, Who has given me the ministry of anointed healing music. I am contacting all my old friends, and my future friends, for fellowship in the giving and receiving of healing love. I am blessed and highly favored of the Lord to come out the closet with thousands of writings, music and photography that I will share with you who contribute to my new Ray Of Lightss’ Crowd-funding Campaign. After studying all aspects of music for fourteen years—and having earned five certificates and a Degree in music production—God has inspired me to go back into the recording studio to record some new original healing gospel pop sounding songs. Some of my last recordings were rushed, and could have sounded better if I had had the time and budget to go back in for enhancement, like all major artists do. This time, I want to have enough time and a $20,000.00 budget to do the best music I can do that will stand with any of the pop music that's out today. Because of my eight years of recording education at one of the best recording environments, that was at Long Beach City College, and that could stand with the best in the world, and that had some of the hottest and loving instructors on Earth; I now know more about sound and acoustics, then when I recorded in studios years before. This $20,000.00 budget will enable me to hire the best gospel musicians in the world—whom I have relationships with—and who are standing by and willing to help bring my vision to the public. I even know the recording engineer who has a fantastic studio with loads of analog and digital recording gear. He is ready to sit at the recording and mixing board to help bring this healing vision into the light also. This estimated budget includes $14,000.00 for musicians, $2,500.00 for studio time, $2,500.00 for the recording, mixing and mastering engineers, $500.00 for multimedia and $500.00 for the production and mailings of perks and rewards. As you can see, this has the extra benefit of you and I’m putting at least ten people to work!

Amazing Perks and Rewards for Your Contributions

Ray Of Lightss have archived thousands of writings and recordings during his fourteen years of music and recording education; and now is the time to come out the closet with these writings and recordings and share them with his friends. For $1.00 pledges, I will send you some anointed poetry from my 100-poem eBook entitled, Peace Through the Blood of Jesus’ Cross. This poetry covers all emotions of our lives, including religion, politics, education, sex and comedy. For $12.00 pledges, you will receive a CD of The Best of Ray Of Lightss’ Experimental Recordings. For $15.00 pledges, you will receive one or more of a hundred CDs of recordings of the Ray Of Light Show on KLBC where I received honors and write-ups in the LBCC Viking News. I was on KLBC.ORG Radio at Long Beach City College from 2009 through 2012. Recently, I received a praise-report of healing from one listener of Ray Of Lightss’ By Jesus’ Stripes We are Healed, from a past recording on The Ray Of Lightss Show. These radio CDs will introduce you to great guest interviews, teachings on healing, along with some of the greatest pop, gospel, rock and jazz music of all time. I promise you that these radio show recordings alone will pump up your home and car stereo systems with joy and excitement. They will lift you out of your conundrums, and cause you to jump up and shout! For $25.00 you can receive a reward of my healing eBook, How to Get God to Make You Rich. Also, for $35.00 pledges, you will receive the complete hundred-poem Ray Of Lightss’ poetry eBook entitled, Peace Through the Blood of Jesus’ Cross, plus a CD of Ray Of Lightss’ Greatest Recordings from his fourteen years of music and recording schools. For $100.00 pledges you will receive a package of all of the above, and more, that will introduce you to some of the most intriguing media you have yet to hear, and that will stand up with anything you have ever read or heard. For $10,000.00 pledges, this same hot band will perform this anointed healing music in your home anywhere in California and surrounding states. I guarantee that the hot anointing of these performances will set your souls on fire, and will

impart healing into your spirits, souls and bodies. For a $20,000.00 pledge, this band will travel to your homes across America. For the purpose of healing each other, let’s link our Social Media contacts with each other. Thank you and may Jesus bless, heal and prosper your whole family; and give you Peace through the Blood of His Cross. Thank you for the success of the Ray Of Lightss’ Crowd-funding Campaign.

rayoflightbutler@yahoo.com.
